Parking fee is $15 per car and they do allow you to park early in the morning before your check-in time so that you don't have to pay double at the park and the hotel. Only reason I didn't

This place is old and needs updating!  Only chose to stay at this location because my two favorites were sold out.  Musty smelly a/c units.  Breakfast not worth walking to.   At least the old carpet had been replaced with fake wood flooring and you could tell housekeeping put in alot of effort to make it clean.

I loved the breakfast, the pool and the room. Breakfast was delicious, with a great variety to choose from. The waffles were fantastic. I enjoyed the pool, which was warm. The hot tub was relaxing after walking all day in Disneyland, which was within walking distance, if you're in shape! The room was comfortable. I was dismayed at the additional and unexpected fees at check-out, parking was an additional $15 Per Day.

The hotel was only a mile and a half from Disney land. The price was =very reasonable compared to the one across the street from the park. There is a shuttle in front of the hotel that one can ride for $5 a day but I found out that if I walked one block up the street towards Disney land I could go into the Toy Story parking lot and ride the Disney Land bus for free. Save me about $30 a day with the family. The staff and the rooms are very comfortable but the parking is stress full. They have a valet 24 hrs to help move cars. This was a very nice hotel and I would recommend it to my friends. Best price I found compared to one for $250 across from the park but they will only let you park one car at those hotels.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your feedback!  So glad you enjoyed the Hotel and the great shuttle options to get to the Disneyland Theme Parks from here!  Looking forward to having you back as we celebrate Disney's 60th Anniversary and a newly renovated Hotel!

Summary: why charge for parking, when you charge for a room. friendly staff, I had no problem with that. the beds were ok. not comfortable, the windows were a weirdly configured to pen, and they have an outdated AC system.
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us!  I'm glad you enjoyed the complimentary Hot breakfast and close location to Disney!  Most Hotels on Harbor Blvd which is the "main hub" for the Disneyland Theme Parks have tight parking.  Which is why it was important to us to bring in valet parking for our guests.  They handle all of the parking needs so you can check in and begin to enjoy your stay!   Come back to see our Hotel improvements!  We are always changing things to make it modern, fresh and relaxing for families!

Summary: We had a nice stay at this hotel. It was clean and comfortable and the breakfast was nice. And they helped us when our reservation was incorrect. The staff was also helpful when our key would not work when we came back late from disneyland park.

Stayed here for a single night as part of a road trip - the room was clean, spacious and quiet, and only a few minutes away from access to Disneyland.  Breakfast was a simple buffet style, but enjoyable nonetheless.  Had to pay for parking, but otherwise a good hotel.

The breakfast was horrible! Rooms need to be upgraded and painted. If you book a room through a non hotel site, they won't let you use your points. TRUST ME go to another hotel.The rate for parking is 15 dollars per day, good luck finding a space in the small parking lot. The air in our main room was cold, and in the other room in was hot.  The only positive aspect of my stay at this hotel was the location, it was close to the tournament we attended.  I've stayed at other locations, the breakfast quality was terrible and the dining area was compact.  The rate was expensive for the quslity of room and service

Summary Heading: Excellent for families, two room suites and bunk beds
Summary: If you have a large family with kids the bunk beds and suites are great.  Glad there is breakfast to grab with family with kids.  Makes it more convenient.  Shuttle to Disneyland is right in front for $5 p/person.  Very convenient and can be used all day.  Lots of places to eat nearby also.

Summary Heading: Four adults and two children (grandparents from NZ and daughter and family from Australia).    We stayed 15nights.
Summary: Such friendly, helpful staff, any request was never a problem.   The breakfast was awesome for the whole family.   Walking distance to Disneyland (our choice to walk the 1.8 kms each way, sometimes a bit tough in the afernoon but the grandees never grizzled once), would rush "home" and spend one to two hours in the pool 😊.   The reception staff gave us an excellent referral for a taxi (awesome black 7 seater Dodge.    Price was really reasonable and the driver would always arrive early and be waiting to pick us up at a given time.   Reception staff helped us with tour confirmations.   Nothing seemed to be too much trouble.    Definitely recommended.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for this great review!  We love hearing about families who visited the Happiest Place on Earth and really had a great time!  We are so glad to be a part of that.  You're right, this hotel has such a great location to enjoy the Disney Theme Parks, restaurants that are walking distance, or just hanging out by the pool!  Please come back and visit us when your travels bring you to Anaheim again and check out our Hotel renovation!  We know you're going to love the fresh, modern look of the rooms and Hotel in general.  Happy Holidays!

Summary: This hotel could have been great. We booked through Expedia and found out after the fact that there was a daily charge for parking. Looking back, Expedia reflected the fact that there would be a "surcharge" but didn't indicate how much. It was located on the bottom of the hotel information page. During the booking process, it did not call this out. It did, however, in the e-mail that was sent to us once the hotel was no longer refundable.  The parking lot was always beyond full. We found our car blocked in by cars behind us. We found out later (after the panic) that it was a valeted car - but no one said anything to us that this might happen when we checked in). We didn't even know valet was an option.  We chose this hotel over others because they advertised that it was close to

I chose this hotel after hours (and hours) of looking for the "perfect" hotel for our Disneyland vacation. It was the winner because it 1) is close enough to walk (though it is a long walk, especially at the end of the day), 2) included breakfast, and 3) had suites, all at the best price I could find.  The one thing I found outstanding about this hotel was the customer service. From our pre-arrival phone calls with questions, to check-in and adjusting our number of nights, I never had a less-than-exemplary experience with the staff. Great job, staff!   Aside from that, the best I can give this hotel is a "fine." It wasn't freakishly clean, but it was fine. (Found some leftover items from the previous guests, but nothing wacky; just a hair clip and band-aid papers.) It wasn't

We stayed at this hotel in the final five days of a five week holiday.  We wanted a hotel close to Disneyland.  We found the room to be clean and reasonable in size.  A breakfast is offered which is basic.  Good family hotel.

Love the location, the service is great but just make sure your bill is right when you check out, you might be charge for shuttle tickets from other guests... Moreover their breakfast is amazing, do not forget to tip the staffs they really deserve it because they are going above and beyond to help you!

Good value. Ok breakfast (they at least have really good waffles). Not too far of a walk to Disneyland (straight down the street). Overall was satisfied. Wish they had scrambled eggs. Rooms not the nicest, but are clean. Nice stay for a family.

The family suite would easily accommodate 8 guests with the pull-out couch.  Great access to Disneyland and a staff that goes out of their way to make your stay wonderful.  The breakfast isn't the best but the staff makes up for the food shortcomings.  Didn't use the pool but got great sleep in the beds.

Overall this hotel was comfortable and provided a good breakfast. I would have liked the parking to be included in my stay since there are other hotels in the area that does not charge for parking. The breakfast seating area is small, so lots of families are cramped into tight spaces. There is inconsistency on the level of room cleanliness which seems to be dependent on the cleaning staff that day.  One day a bag of garbage and a cleaning cloth was left behind which makes you wonder if the room was actually cleaned. The next day it would be fine. The ice machine on our floor doesn't seem to work. Overall, it's still a good hotel for families on a budget.

Summary Heading: Didnt stay here THIS trip buuut...
Summary: OK I didn't actually stay here this trip but this is kind of a good review for BWPRIAS anyway.  I did stay here last October and really enjoyed the hotel and gave them a food review. I planned to come back to this same hotel t=on my next trip to Disneyland which ended up being this labor day weekend- almost exactly a year later.   The trip wasn't planned- came up last minute  so I had to make reservations  and such in a hurry. My son brought  another friend with him  who had never been to Disney just like he did last year when we went.  One of the first things he asked was if we were going to stay at the same hotel we did last year and I told him yes which made him happy. On the 13 hour drive out to Anaheim, as he gave his friend the low down on how awesome Disney was, he also

The folks who work here are clearly dedicated to making this hotel the best experience possible. The challenge here is that everything is OLD, including the beds.  Very very uncomfortable.  So much so that I was eager to get the sleeping part over with.

This is a fine property to stay at for Disneyland. Its also located within a block from the Toy Story parking lot. You can catch the bus into Disney there and back. Beware the hotel does charge for parking. Breakfast was just meh. The family suite with bunk beds was really great and the hotel staff very nice. The pool is not very big but good for a quick dip. There is a workout room which my son said was decent. You can hear alot of foot stomping and kids running in the morning , no doubt excited for Disney. Its to be expected and was not too bothersome. To far to walk to Disney in my opinion so just head to the Toy Story lot and ride for free.

We came in for the D23 expo and this property was booked for it's location. And was glad that I did. The property was close by to the convention was able to walk to it. The room we got was very nice. We had the king bed with the extra room and sofa sleeper. The room was big and spacious, the extra room had it's own a/c. The only thing that bothered me was that being right next door to the hotel laundry room was going to be an issue.   I was very impressed with the breakfast. Very good and lot's to choose from. Pancakes, Eggs, sausage even potatoes, waffles, cereal. I enjoyed that if there was not enough room where breakfast was you could eat outside under the umbrellas. Staff was very nice and helpful especially when my husband thought he lost his credit cards and had to change

I attend a business convention at the Anaheim Convention Center every year, and this year I decided to try Raffles.   Room had one queen bed and a set of bunk beds in two separate "rooms" (nice for a family). Room wasn't bad: noise was at a minimum, even though my room was directly above the breakfast room. Bed cover had a large bleach stain on it, but room was clean otherwise.  Breakfast was included in the price of the room and was great. Selection was the same every day, but included hot items like bacon, pancakes, eggs, etc. Items were well-stocked and everything was clean. However, breakfast room is very very small. If you go during a crowded time of year, be prepared to eat in your room.  Front desk staff was super-polite, even when my room key card had to be re-keyed at

Such a cute little hotel! Everything was within walking distance. You feel safe because there are so many people walking at all times. I stayed in a 1 bedroom suite and it was nice and modern. The pool area was nice and private. they also have a pretty nice fitness center.  The hotel offers a huge variety of free breakfast options including pastries, waffles, hot breakfast like eggs, sausage, and potatoes, fresh fruit, coffee, juice, etc.   My only complaints would be the housekeeping done on my second day there and the understaffed front desk. I noticed a blood stain on my bed the second night I was there and my room was half cleaned. I'm not sure if the housekeeper got a bloody nose as she was making my bed and left halfway through his/her shift but it was weird! Thankfully I

Our latest family vacation had a rocky start. We went from having planned the vacation for months, to canceling, then re-booking, then re-canceling and finally re-booking. They were very good at working with us and allowed us to keep the booking a the original price. It was a very wonderful experience.

We stayed here for 11 nights, very happy with our room and staff where very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was the standard hotel type, waffles, pancakes, eggs, sausages, muffins, Danish and donuts. Which was fine for a holiday treat. We had a room on the top floor, which was good as I think when motel is full being on a lower level might be a tad noisy. Only one thing could make this better would be a motel shuttle to Disneyland. You can use the ART line for a fee, or walk about 5 mins to the toy story parking lot and jump on there shuttle for free.

We have 6 kids ands 2 adults.  We stayed in the Family Suite.  It had two queens, a sofa bed and a bunk bed.  The room fit my family well and I thought the price was fair for the size of the room.  The hotel was about 1 mile from Disneyland.  It was a bit too far to walk because I didn't want my family to be too tired when they got there and I knew they would be too tired to walk all the way back after spending the day in Disney.  They offer a shuttle, but it was $5 for adults and $4 for children.  If would have used the shuttle it would have been $34/day.  I ended up paying for parking at Disney which was $17/day.  The hotel charged $15/day for parking which I thought was overpriced due to the distance from Disney.  My parents had a hotel right across the street that was

The hotel staff was friendly, caring and helpful. The room was clean and the internet worked well. The walk to Disneyland is a little bit of a hike, but was well worth it for the quality of this hotel.

Summary Heading: Good Stay - Far From Disneyland Parks Though
Summary: We stayed here during a very busy weekend in August (Disney Expo was going on at nearby Convention Center) but the front desk staff were very friendly and helpful and accommodated all requests.  The room was clean (we requested one large bed, we got 2 beds, but oh well), relatively quiet and fare priced.  It came with the free breakfast which was mostly carbs, cheap hot meats, waffle bar, cereal and coffee.  We like to eat healthier than this food provided, but was ok for a quick snack for us (not a whole sit down breakfast meal).  I would stay here again, though it is 10 blocks from the Disneyland Park, so we would try to stay closer to the park, but that is no fault of the property or staff.

Summary Heading: Good stay and close to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed at this Best Western for four nights, over all the stay was good. The room we had was a nice size; one king bed and the connecting room had two bunks. Room location was quiet and on the third floor above the office. bathroom and room was clean, when we needed something for our room the front desk was quick to get it for us; example ( towels, bathroom soap and a fan ). Parking was $15 a day, we had no issue with parking. We bought a shuttle ticket for the days we were at the hotel to take to Disneyland. In the morning, the breakfast was ok, but get's crowed, still a nice start to the day to fill up. Only complaint I had was that It really needed a desk and chair to do some work on. Overall, the stay was good.

Summary Heading: Great for families of 4 or more
Summary: I have 3 kids, 2 which are middle and high school ages.  Rooms with 2 double/queen size is too small and getting 2 rooms is too expensive.  This hotel was great for our size family.  I love that they have rooms with bunk beds and sofabed in one room and queen in another.  My kids were able to have their space and TV while my husband and I had our own space.  The rate was very reasonable for the size, I'd say even cheaper than some higher end hotels that have smaller rooms.    Laundry room on 1st and 2nd floors (maybe one on 3rd but hadn't gone up there) was nice.  Each had 2 washer/dryer each so good chance you'll find one available.  I have been in larger hotels with only 2 washer/dryer for the entire hotel.  Nice to have free wi-fi and breakfast.  Breakfast variety was okay,

I stayed at this hotel with my daughter and my sister for a visit that included the D23 convention and Disneyland.  I picked it because it was close to the convention center and I have stayed at some decent Best Western properties.  Unfortunately this wasn't one of them.  The beds were horrible.  My daughter couldn't sleep in the fold out bed (no one could) so she slept in the double bed with me.  Two adults can't sleep easily in a double bed.  They should have been queen beds.  We had them store our bags while we went to the park.  When my daughter came back to pick up her bags they couldn't find them, which caused her to miss her airport shuttle, thereby having to pay $120 for a taxi to LAX.  There were broken lamps in the room, and if we turned on the over-head light while

This hotel is somewhat dated but clean and comfortable. Definitely economical. The breakfast isn't amazing but does the job-like a MacDonalds. Also not too far to walk to the Disney Park and near a lot of decent restaurants .It was convenient to be able to buy all tickets at the hotel reception desk too.

Summary Heading: Good place to stay, just a couple of problems
Summary: First, let me say this hotel is close to Disneyland, is very clean, and has a very nice staff and plenty of hot water with good pressure in the shower. My 4 day stay there was a pleasant one, with these problems: The wall sockets were what I'd call loose; when I tried to plug in my phone, the plug would fall out of the wall. The only 2 tight plugs I found in the whole room was 1- on the side of the lamp, and 2- in the socket with the hairdryer over the sinks. So if you have more than 2 things to charge per day, investigate this problem carefully to make sure you have enough tight plugs. Second problem was that the AM/FM clock radio alarm could not be set, at all. in my room, 309, using the alarm was fine as long as you wanted to get up at 6:30 am. It cannot be changed from that

Summary Heading: Great Location but time for A Makeover
Summary: I know that this place is booked solidly year round due to it's walk able distance to Disneyland and California Adventures, but the rooms are in need of a sprucing up.and I am assuming that the management is looking for downtime to do the needed upgrades.  The bathroom needed more light, the room needs more outlets for charging portables and the furnishings are tired.  The housekeeping was impeccable, the breakfast buffet very good with sufficient room for the number of guests and adequate parking.  I would recommend it but only if the price is right for your group size.

I am a fan of Best Western Hotels and usually choose them when I travel for business or pleasure.  This stay was a pleasure trip and I chose it first because of its proximity to Disneyland and second because they had a "kid's suite" that would accommodate the three adults and two children in our party.  I was not disappointed. The stay was comfortable and the staff was friendly and helpful.  The kids loved the hotel pool and enjoyed our daily breakfasts.  I would definitely repeat this trip and stay at this hotel again.

The staff is very nice and helpful! We had some minor issues with our bathroom fan working and insects in the bathroom 2 nights. Overall not a bad stay, and is walking distance to Disneyland! Wish there wasn't a parking fee for guests at the hotel (at least gives us one car free)

This hotel is absolutely amazing! We love the rooms and especially the breakfast buffet. OMG! The buffet has just about everything you could ask for, besides bacon. I recommend bacon ;) The staff is great and ensures their guests are aware of everything we need to know about our stay. The proximity from this hotel to Disneyland is about a mile, but the close Toy Story parking lot is gracious enough to offer us a free ride to the park. My family and I usually make an annual trip for vacation and for business, and we'll definitely stay at this hotel again. Thank you Best Western Raffles Inn & Suites staff! You guys rock!

The staff were courteous and helpful. We were a little confused about how the valet service worked. There were a lot of hidden charges that they should just include in the rate of the hotel. This best western needs more parking space.

This was not my first choice hotel but unfortunately most hotels were sold out closer to disneyland because of Vidcon. This hotel turned out to be a good choice though, the room we chose was a 2 bedroom 5beds suite which comfortably accommodated the group. The staff there is outstanding. The rooms are outdated but clean. I did not get to use the pool or join for breakfast. Internet is quick given the hotel was to its max capacity. Parking could be difficult if the hotel is full but there is always a valet that will park it for you. There is a shuttle that runs very often but i believe the price is about $5 per person. If you dont have too many people in the group, i would recommend taking UBER instead. Uber XL fit 5 of us and only a $10 ride. Dropped us off at the Ihop in front

Summary Heading: Okay, but there are better hotels nearby.
Summary: This was an okay hotel. We were on the second floor.  PROS: Close to Disney with bus service every 20 min; Good restaurants nearby; free breakfast CONS: Carpet was filthy - after taking a shower my feet were dirty from walking on the carpet; some of the front desk staff don't know hotel policies - we asked about checking out a day earlier than planned and were told it would come with a penalty even though we booked through the hotel - this was not true; all ice machines were out of order during our stay; I was looking for a baggage cart at 7 am and they were being used by the breakfast room. Poor value for $200 per night. They know that they are close to Disney so they can get away with little things that make or break the stay.  We usually stay at Best Westerns because they are

This hotel has a great variety of rooms for families or larger parties. We got a room with a queen, a pair of twin bunks, and a sofa sleeper all for a reasonable price. You have to pay for parking, which is typical around that area. It is a bit over a mile to the front gates of Disneyland, so be prepared if you plan on walking. From what I could tell, you can purchase tickets on the bus/shuttle. Parking is VERY limited, so if you come back late, be prepared to give up your keys so they can double-park your car for you. There always seemed to be a parking attendant around, so that may not be an issue for most folks.  The room was clean, comfortable, and plenty big for our party of five. Extra towels were brought to the room quickly upon request. The staff was friendly and helpful

All staff we met, from the front desk to the valet, went out of their way to be friendly. The room is nice and clean, it was quiet at night, and the choice ofTV channels was extensive. Don't forget that you will be paying for parking every night, whether you use the valet or not. They do have shuttle service available for Disneyland, so you aren't paying Disney prices for parking, too.

We wanted to choose a hotel that was close to Disneyland.  We went for our daughter's 5th birthday, and made sure to let the hotel know that we were coming for a special occasion when we booked.  The hotel was a two block walk (about 5 mins) to the Toy Story Parking Lot, which allowed us to hop onto the free shuttle to the park entrance.  Total trip was about 15 mins. The hotel is older, however, the family suite that we got had a separate room with bunk beds and a tv plus play area, and then the main room with a king size bed, TV and access to the bathroom.  Upon arrival, there were cookies waiting with a Happy Birthday card for our daughter.  I thought this was a really nice touch.  We stayed on the top floor, in the corner, so didn't hear any noise from the rooms around us.

Summary Heading: Outstanding employees and a comfortable place to stay
Summary: I recently stayed at the BW Plus Raffles, booking a total of 6 rooms.  The attention that the front desk staff, Cruz and Yssis (sorry for not getting this name correct) was truly outstanding.  They went out of their way to make sure that all my needs for a wonderful stay would be met.  Also, the breakfast that they serve every morning (included with your stay) was truly icing on the cake.  The hot waffles that you make yourself, pancakes, sausages, eggs, cereals etc were so delicious, this was the highlight of my morning!  And the staff in the breakfast room were also outstanding!  (Please remember to tip them, they work very hard!)  The hotel is  a horseshoe shape with a nice pool area for the kids.  Disneyland is truly walking distance but there are shuttles that run every 20

Summary Heading: Convenient clean place to stay with large party
Summary: We were a party of six and stayed in one of the family rooms with a bunk bed and sleeper sofa in back room and a queen bed in the front room.  Staff is very helpful and rooms are nice and clean.  They have a great free breakfast and its a 15 min walk to Disneyland. The only thing I wasn't too excited about was the pool, there is construction next to the small pool and it isn't very attractive.  I would certainly stay there again because the price is right and the employees are accommodating.

We planned a trip to Disneyland with my 2 great grandsons, and this hotel was close not only to Disney, but to stores, restaurants and other things anyone would need while on a trip. I really like the Best Western Plus hotels. The one that we had for this trip was large with 2 rooms one with 2 queen beds and the other with bunk beds and a sofa sleeper along with its own bathroom, would be perfect for a nice size family. Plus the free breakfast was really a added plus. Very happy with this stay.

Comfortable and clean with a microwave and refrigerator in the room. Wifi worked just fine and plenty of towels. Walking distance to Disney however this motel is very noisy with families going to and from Disney morning and night. We stayed at this motel to see an Angels baseball game not Disney which was our mistake. You have to pay to park at this motel and parking is  limited especially at night but there is valet. If I remember correctly the  fee for parking is $12.85 per day and from what I could see most hotels in the area charge a parking fee.

Summary Heading: BUGS IN ROOM/NO PARKING BUT CHARGED DAILY FOR PARKING
Summary: WHEN we arrived we noticed flying bugs in the room. When I look in the window I seen tons of bugs. I called the front desk and they sent up a worker to see for himself. Our children's socks were filthy after 10 minutes of walking on the carpet.  He called them back and had our room changed.  By the 2nd day of our stay the same bugs have made it into our new room.SELF. There is a 15/per day parking charge, but when we arrived back from Disneyland we had no where to park. Many cars were double parked and we were told we would have to do the same and leave our keys with the valet attendant just in case the car we would be blocking needed to leave. We refused to do so and complained to the front office they moved another persons car and we parked our car. I have never experienced

So, the photo actually does look just like the room.  The only difference was the flooring.  It was wood laminate which my daughter was happy about.  She mentioned that when they go to other hotels and the baby crawls on the floor, his hands and clothing get dirty from the hidden dirt in the carpet.  I didn't mind it.  The only draw back was a small family of fruit flies that had taken up residency along with us.  We couldn't find the source.  We hadn't brought any fruit.  We decided to reside in harmony and it really didn't bother us.  The breakfast was more than sufficient for my daughter and grandson, it was also very clean and organized.  I appreciated the staff as well, they were friendly and knowledgeable.  The reception area wasn't large and didn't accommodate more than

Clean, Breakfast was good. Close to disney. Only downside. The staff does not seem to care very much. Very poor lighting at night, as i checked in, and was walking towards the stairs fell down and cut my shoulder and knee. Went to the office to get a band aid and report it, and no one cared, They did not even have a band aid to offer me.

This hotel had a very smooth check in and check out process.  The staff was very friendly, helpful, and attentive.  Breakfast was very good and the breakfast hostess was very helpful in finding us a table.

I am SO pleased with this place. Got a fantastic deal AND it exceeded my expectations. My 5 kids loved the  kids suite (they had their own TV! the older kids loved the wifi and hot breakfast. It caters to Disneyland - darn near next door to it- They sell tickets and staff know about the great downtown Disney scene... but we were visiting family this trip. DEFINITELY recommending to everyone and will be coming back for all our future Cali trips...

We were able to walk to Disneyland in 15 minutes and the rooms were clean. Downside was additional parking fee. The staff was very friendly and went out of their way to correct a reservation error. Close to restaurants and the Anaheim Convention Center. Pool area was nice and breakfast had a great selection of items.

GREAT. That's how I would sum up this location. We spent 4 days 3 nights here as a Family of 5 enjoying some Disneyland Resort Time. Are kids, 16,5, and 3 all loved it as well.  ROOMS We stayed in the family suite that had a 2 rooms. The main room has a TV, refrigerator, microwave, desk as well as a queen size bed. The second room is connected to the main room by a pass through area that has the sink and mirror. The second room has a bunk bed, couch with pullout sleeper, tall dresser, T.V. as well as small table that is perfect for kid activities. The floors are some variant of hardwood flooring, most likely laminate, and were really nice for this price range of room. Both rooms had newer AC/Heater units and the sense that I got from the room is that it just had a major

it was great.  We came down with our daughter, husband and two grandsons.  The kids loved the extra room with the bunk beds.  It was close to Disneyland an d that was great.  Great breakfast.  The shuttle bus to and from Disneyland was easy access.

We stayed at this hotel for the first time ten years ago.  Although it was not our first choice for this trip, I have no regrets.  The breakfast, cleaning and parking staff were exceptionally friendly and made our stay very pleasant.  With one exception, the room was perfectly clean, the internet was quick, the parking was easy and the bed was comfortable!  We had one problem with cleanliness that was handled very quickly and professionally and were surprised with a large back of cookies and free parking in response to our complaint.  Sometimes, the way a problem is dealt with says more than having no problems at all.  Happy to recommend this hotel to others!

This Inn is different from others i've stayed at. The charge for parking but of course we paid on top of our room bill. On our departure the valet at night parked a vehicle in front of ours. When asked to move it the valet discovers that he lost the keys. It took them over 45minutes to find the keys. This is the worst experience i've ever experienced and will not be returning.

We just got back from a 5 night stay here in a two room suite. I was a little skeptical based on the online reviews and even when we drove up but it turned out fine. It's not luxurious and could definitely use a renovation but the rooms were clean.   Pros:  The front desk staff was nice and helpful.  Housekeeping was friendly when we asked for more towels and they gave us what we asked for. The breakfast was really good with eggs, sausage, potatoes, pancakes and waffles. It gave us a good start to the day. The staff at the breakfast buffet was courteous and kept it well stocked. We even snagged a few muffins and some oranges to have as a snack at the parks. Free Wi-Fi in the rooms. There is a Disneyland parking lot (Toy Story Lot) less than a block away, on the same side of the

Summary Heading: Declined in Value from Previous Visits
Summary: I have stayed here many times.   Usually a great stay!  This time was not.  Maid service was highly lacking.  Had to beg for towels and toiletries daily.  After 3 calls and trips to office; the maid called for a list of desired items.  That went well for 2 days and then back to same issues.  No towels, no soap, no shampoo, no conditioner, no t.p.  Airflow in room in was awful.  NO ventilation in children's room.  Once light was out; so was the fan.  Poor engineering.   That room was like a sauna in the morning.  Need the fan to run during the night so air is drawn into that room or have it's own a/c unit.   Breakfast was a horrid experience.  The woman who filled the bins was perpetually mad.  She was angry and scowling every morning.  Slammed the bins closed on you and took the

We stayed at this hotel for a Disneyland trip. We got the 2 bedroom suite, which worked perfectly for our family. We were happy to see that the 2nd room had a door, it's own air conditioning unit, and TV. It was easy to simply close the door, if one of the rooms wanted to watch a different TV program, or retire earlier than the other people.   We enjoyed the outdoor pool and jacuzzi a few times. The breakfast was basic, but sufficient. The shuttle to Disneyland was just around the corner, and Denny's was just past that. We also walked to the convenience store, and stocked up our mini-fridge for the duration of our stay.   The staff was extremely helpful. They were able to give advice about anything, and even booked some daily excursions for us. If you needed anything, they were

My son and I stayed here in April while attending the Star Wars Celebration at the convention center. I really appreciated how close it was. It was an easy 10-15 minute walk. It was also a quick walk to the Disney parking lot where we caught the free a shuttle to Disneyland. I booked based on Trip Advisor reviews plus a great rate on a Trip Advisor sale.   We arrived before check in time but the front desk went a head and started our check in and stored our luggage for us. Both young ladies were friendly and were efficiently taking care of the several guests that were there. After getting some lunch and picking up some snacks at the Target up the road, we still had an hour to official check in time and were prepared to wait it out in the lobby, but a room was ready for us.  At

This was a very clean and comfortable Hotel Suite for the Price. Best value in the Anaheim Resort Area. Close to the Parks and Staff Was very attentive. Will definitely stay here again. Valet service was helpful considering this hotel is always booked solid every night. Rooms were very clean and the amount of staff available to meet your needs was surprising. lots of staff on hand , which made all the difference.  This property is cared for and it shows. Will definitely stay here again.

Bunkbeds, and seperate rooms within the room for 108 bucks a night. Easy, fast cheap shuttle to park. yes please. will stay again. Added an extra night stay with ease at lower rate with no hassles.  Super friendly and efficient staff.

This is the perfect hotel to go to during the summer, in my opinion. Yes, it does get crowded during the summer, but not really. Anyways, I stayed here last year in August with my family, and we did not have a lot of problems. Some problems were: The pool did not have towels (a problem for me) so we had to get some at the lobby, but that was okay. The ice machine kept running out of ice. The vending machine kept eating our dollars. Actually, it never gave us our snacks, so bring some or buy some.  It is fairly close, actually walking distance to Denny's, and there is a iHop near, too (of course). Night time here is perfect. The pool stays open late, and you actually can see the fireworks from the pool as well. The main problem some people might have is that it is not much of a

Summary Heading: Good service and amenities for price
Summary: We were pleasantly surprised with how nice this hotel was when we arrived. Because we have a large family, we usually need a big suite when we travel, but found that we could actually get two queen bed rooms at Best Western Raffles for less than any suite at another hotel. Having two rooms provided better privacy and having TWO bathrooms was definitely a plus!! The hot breakfast was actually pretty tasty and it was nice to have the Disneyland shuttle right in front of the hotel. On the last night there, we had an issue with the door lock and could not get into one of the rooms. It was a huge process to finally get into the room, but we were finally moved to a different room after 2.5 hours. Thankfully, the manager could understand our frustration, noting that we were extremely

The breakfast was very good. Lots to choose from. Room floor was very dirty. Thecarpet needs to be replaced. I had made a complaint in regards to this. The girl at front reception did send a bag of cookies to our room for this. Hotel does need to be updated.

I was worried about this place upon hearing my daughter booked it and had read the reviews but upon arrival the staff was very friendly and courteous.  The room was an excellent two room with bunks for the kids and a sofa bed which my adult daughter took and gave me the room with a queen bed to myself - heavenly.  The breakfast was the same each day but well stocked and fresh.  The OJ was terrific.  A granddaughter had left the light on in our car and the office called to alert us - well done office - thank you. We took the ART shuttle each day to Disneyland which was just around the front of the motel though we saw plenty for walkers.  The place was kept clean and tidy daily both inside the room and all around on the grounds.  I never noticed any excessive noise even though we

Considering its stars and usual clientele (im guessing) being overnighters or long weekend-ers, this was a perfectly adequate hotel for our 9 night stay. The rooms were spacious and clean (SO important!) and the beds were ridiculously comfortable! I wanted to take my mattress home! The room was tidied and beds made each day unless we requested otherwise. The breakfast whilst fairly basic, does have quirky elements such as make your own waffles straight from the batter, and whilst most on offer is not overly healthy there is fruit and yoghurt too. We also managed to have actual ENGLISH tea!! Very important for fellow Brits to know, as this was hard to come by ANYWHERE in Disneyland or LA..... There is also fresh cold lemon water, coffee and fruit available in the lobby all day,

The Best Western Plus Raffles is a great place to stay if you're visiting the Disneyland resort and you want to save a little cash. Rooms are clean and spacious. Breakfast is satisfying. Shuttle to/from park is a plus, (cheaper than parking at the Disneyland lot) and the bus stop is only yards away from the hotel. Guest services is helpful and friendly. The pool area is not very large, but it is clean and always stocked with plenty of towels. The downside at this location is, you have to pay for parking, about $15 a day. So you're paying to park there and ride the shuttle or you're paying to park there and then parking at the Disneyland lots. Regardless of the fact, we enjoyed our stay at Raffles and would recommend it to anyone.

Close to Disneyland - it took about 30 minutes to walk it - but it is right next to the Disney parking lot, which has regular shuttles to/from the park. The hotel was decent, clean, etc., but was kind of noisy with high school kids while we were there (three buses brought kids who were participating in some kind of Disney thing). Breakfast is good, but not exceptional. Our room had sleeping space for six in two separate rooms.

Summary Heading: Great Stay, nice breakfast and very close to Disneyland
Summary: The rooms were really nice, we slept well, and it was only around $10 for a cab ride to Disney, though you could walk it easily enough in 15 minutes if needed.    The breakfast was really great, and we even walked down to target one night as it was really close.

This property is very clean, despite the negative reviews. It certainly isn't a Marriott, but it is great for the price you pay. We stayed with our children in a Family suite. There was plenty of space. The breakfast was average, but it was complimentary so keep that in mind. It does get busy around 7-7:30AM, get there as early as possible! The staff was helpful and friendly. The laundry facility was decent. It is $6.00 for the soap and to wash and dry. We would definitely stay again.

Summary Heading: Perfect for a family on a budget
Summary: I'm staggered by how many bad reviews I've read about this place, we couldn't fault it. The room was very clean and tidy and made up perfectly every morning. Breakfast is fine given its free. Front counter staff were incredibly accommodating. Price was amazing. Bus for Disneyland is right out front. Kids loved the pool. Very very happy.

Only used the room for sleeping as our primary goal was visiting Disneyland.  Beds were comfortable.  The breakfast was great.  Bus stop just outside the hotel to take you to Disneyland.  Only took about 5-10 minutes.  Otherwise about a 20 minute walk.  Pool was great.  Pleasantly surprised it was heated.  Staff great and very accommodating.

We stay here every few years for our Disney vacations. We were a bit disappointed that we are now charged for parking and that overall the rates have gone up due to recent renovations (cheap renovations though as our laminate floor was already buckling)  The location is good, easy for older kids to walk to Disneyland, close to the CVS for necessities. The breakfast is good- we always go for the waffles which sustain us until a late lunch. And the Housekeeping! The first couple of days was good enough and then day 3 we came back after a long day and were pleasantly amused at the Stuffies party left for us. Fun for the kids and put a smile on my face too. We were a bit disappointed to be ground floor but it wasn't too much noisier.

We were very happy with our room.  We were on the bottom floor near the laundry room and when we first saw the location, we were unsure of the noise.  It actually turned out to be quite a good little spot with minimal noise.  The room was nicely updated and the laminate flooring was nicer than carpet.  We had a room with an extra bedroom and that was very nice to have separation from each other.  The breakfast room gets a little busy, but that's too be expected in a place like this.  The breakfast was good with lots of choices.  It was nice they offered an outside seating area as well to sit and eat.  The front office staff were awesome and very helpful.  The location was a bit of a walk from Disneyland, but there is a bus stop right out front and it was easy to use - don't

Summary Heading: Great place to stay with a family, walking distance to Disneyland for children
Summary: Highly recommend this place for large families to stay great, place within walking to Disneyland. Over great place. I would highly recommend it to Australia wanting to stay close to Disneyland and half way from universal studio and sea worworld.

My stay at Raffels Best Western in  Anaheim California was great. We would definitely stay their again! The location was three blocks from the convention center where we had the most pleasant walk every day as the landscape was beautiful and wonderful smelling. The are was close to several restaurants and near Disney of we wished.The hotel even gave information on other sites of interest.

Stayed here for four days. The room was clean. The breakfast was crazyyyy too many people too little food. I went one day and no more thank you. They were not nice Nd had no good food. Secondly the lights went out and everything was chaotic. No one to ask about anything!!!! Very unprofessional !!!!!!!  The worst part were the beds I couldn't sleep the whole time we were there. The beds are terrible there were three beds in my room and all were hard as a rock. Will never ever ever ever ever ever ever ever ever stay here again.

had a great trip and most of it was the room i stayed in, it was great. one thing was pool was almost to hot one or two days but still was amazing stay. and the breakfast was pretty bad only had it twice because could try anymore went and got milk every day but no food.

We stayed in a "family suite" 3 adults, 2 teens, and an infant. I really liked that the kids had their own space and tv but were still "with us". The suite had 2 full bathrooms, a small fridge and microwave which is great for families. The employees were very friendly, and the hot breakfast is decent. Definitely would stay again.

The name of the place made it sound like a hotel but it was a motel.  I still cannot figure out why they charged me 15.00 to park in the lot each day, especially considering that it was too far to walk to Disneyland.  Not only did I have to pay a parking fee, it was suggested that I pay to ride the bus back and forth to the park.  This adds 45.00 to your stay each day and the price is no longer as attractive.

My kids had a week off for Spring Break and decided to take a mini vacation.  Caught a Dodgers Game and one day in Disneyland. There was 5 of us which included one of my daughters friends. We usually get a room with 2 queen size beds and share beds. This wasn't the case here. I decided to find a hotel with a suite. After checking a few places we decided on the Best Western Raffle in Anaheim Ca. It was only two blocks from Disneyland which made this the best decision for our needs. The room was a 2 room suite with a bunk bed and and 2 queen beds. There was plenty of room for us all. The room was average. "Served its purpose" Nothing fancy but not as nice as expected. The complimentary  breakfast was also average but appreciated. Eggs sausage waffles. The price was definitely

Summary Heading: 3rd visit-this time tried the 2 Queen deluxe room
Summary: We have stayed at this hotel in the past.  We have tried both the 2 bedroom suite and the family suite when we had more family members with us.  This time we tried the 2 Queen deluxe room.  I requested the 3rd floor which is a must for this hotel!!!!  Bottom floors will get the noise from the upper floors and it is unbearable.  All bottom floors will always amplify people talking or moving above them as if they were moving bricks and yelling.  It will make your trip less enjoyable.  The top floor is better but you will still hear people outside your rooms or out in the parking lot.  The construction of this hotel and its windows was not well thought of.  But top floor is manageable.  This hotel (converted/renovated motel) is not a resort of any kind but a very comfortable, safe,

We are a family of 7 and we love the fact that this hotel has room for all of us. The pool is always nice and so is the staff! The breakfast is a great addition and saves us money when attending the park. The ART pickup is right outside the door. Very clean.

Hotel was clean and  comfortable however staff had very little knowledge of local attractions except for Disneyland go figure...  The noise from upper levels was unbearable however due to our timing (spring Break) there was no other option to move accommodation as everything was fully booked.

We called & booked thru Best Western at the last minute.  They made everything simple & gave us a great rate. We're a family of 6 so we got the suite & it was perfect for us! 1st room had a large bed & bathroom & the kids room had a comfy fold out couch & twin bunkbeds. We all slept comfortably.  Quite, clean, spacious. Breakfast was delicious, kept well stocked & clean! We were even allowed to swim a lil past 11 since we got in late. We will definitely put this on our list of family approved hotels!

Loved the heated pool at this location.  It's 2 1/2 blocks from Disney entrance, I easily walked there but you can  pay $5 for roundtrip Disney bus (or $3 is you're too tired to walk back).  Nice big room for their continental breakfast.

Hotel did not have enough parking.  People were double parked all over the place.  If you needed to move your car you had to go to the valet desk and ask them to move the car.  Should have enough parking for the amount of rooms available.  Also the hotel website said it had just been remodeled.  Maybe on the outside but the inside hasn't been remodeled in over 20 years.  It needs new paint, new wall paper, new beds, new bedding.  The only upgrades I could see on were that they installed laminate flooring on the 1st level.  Also the water was only lukewarm even when place on all the way hot.  The water also had a rotten egg smell to it when you 1st turned it on.  I have stayed at other best westerns that were nicer.  The beds to say the least were like sleeping on a rock, very

Summary Heading: Good Value for a Disney Hotel
Summary: This is an average hotel in the Disney strip but provided an adequate room (queen and separate room with bunk beds and sofa sleeper.  Good price and included breakfast. Be careful about adding taxes and parking fee - normal for Disney area hotels.

This would be the noisiest hotel we have ever stayed in, we were on the 2nd floor , and the noise from the 3rd floor was enough to stop you getting to sleep , if you have children request the 3rd floor . They also have an outdoor area by the breakfast room where guests were socialising till 4.30 in the morning . Rooms were clean , their cleaners did a great job everyday. Pool was good and warm , great having towels by the pool . Easy walk to Disneyland . Breakfast was average , full of over processed food.

Summary Heading: Will Never Visit Best Westerns again
Summary: this hotel is not worth the money the staff does minimal to help and are not friendly the rooms are dirty the morning breakfast is terrible  the air systems in the room sound like lawn mowers the wait times in the office were terrible my back hurt every night from the beds being uncomfortable

We had a great experience at this hotel.  We booked 12 rooms for our Cheer team for Nationals.  Everything ran smoothly and the customer service was exceptional.  Rooms were good size, clean and comfortable.

Summary Heading: Disney hotel great alternative for big family
Summary: good place to stay w/full breakfast and close location to Disneyland.  ART bus in front of hotel very quick to hop on bus to get to park entrance buses run every 20 minutes. For price and amenities it hit the mark and budget.

Stayed here 2 yrs ago for all star cheerleading convention. Management was rude, uninviting breakfast horrible!   I'm back again for cheer and didn't realized till I pulled in  was the same hotel I had been in before with cheer. Needless to say they haven't changed. Thier front desk person messed up on my reservation and it was made to be my fault.  After asking for a manager multiple times I was told she was in a meeting took hrs to get ahold of her. She told me I was out of luck and could not change rooms

Very pleased with everything.  Hotel was near capacity but the stay went off without a hitch... even breakfast.  Lots of food.  The staff was very prepared for the volume.  They even had a little outside area to eat the breakfast...., you face the parking lot, but still.  It was nice.

Our family loved the family suite with the two bathrooms. We had tons of room and everything we needed. It was wonderful to have a touch of privacy provided by the closing door between the rooms and my daughter loved climbing the stairs to the top bunk. 10 out of 10! We'll be back!

Nice, new hotel in booming Anaheim with walking distance to Disneyland, though this is not the closest B.W. to the amusement park. Large room, good breakfast. Small hotel parking, and as a guest you still have to pay to park there. Be prepared to noise of kids running everywhere - part of Disney experience.

my friend recommended us this holtel. it is really good. my family arrived at it at midnight, the staff tried their best to make us comfortable include parking and check-in. we enjoyed a nice hotel with nice service, we will visit it next time.

We booked off a Groupon deal that was a complete steal.  Our family of 5 (3 kids) fit comfortably in the two bedroom unit with bunk beds.  The location was fantastic as it was only a 15-20 minute walk to Disneyland and there were plenty of places to eat within walking distance.  The staff was friendly and made us feel welcome.  The spa and pool were a nice addition.    The only complaints would be it was very easy to hear noise from outside or other rooms, the breakfast was pretty bland and the same for 3 days in a row, and the smoking area was too close to the rooms (it was probably 15 feet from our bottom floor room).  Make the smokers go to the sidewalk out front!  We would definitely look at booking here again when we are looking for a family trip to Disneyland.

Bathroom was obvious afterthought, as the door was within a micron of hitting the toilet. Shower was designed for a child.   Quality of of their room remodels sucked, must have found the newest and cheapest labor, as obvious defects and patchwork can be seen. Floors were uneven in our room.  Buffet breakfast had minimal seating and NOT designed for families going into the park. Food was decent.   Easy walk to the Park.

Hotel was adequate for our purposes. Bus stop to/from Disneyland right out front. Hot breakfast included was acceptable. Bed was comfortable. We had our grandchildren with us for the trip, we had everything we needed. Centrally located for the things we wanted to do.

You can walk to disney from here, but it will be a long walk! I checked into the hotel late around 9pm. At check in the original room I booked was out of order, which I understand happens sometimes, but I was not called or notified that our room, which was suposed to be 2 queen beds, a bunkbed, and a pullout sofabed, was changed to 2 rooms with 2 queen beds. We had 7 people on the trip, 4 adults and 3 children. We specifically booked the suite because we were surprising our children with a disneyland trip, everything was prepped for the original room type, so splitting the room was a huge inconvenience and just ruined our plans. If i was called ahead of time, I would have never stayed at this hotel and would have booked across the street at the hyatt, which had the room type we

Summary Heading: Get this hotel if you have no choice
Summary: I really don't know why Best Western granted this hotel the Plus category when it is not even as good as their regular hotels. The amenities are very basic... three pieces of small soaps, one for the body and two for the face. a small shampoo, conditioner and lotion. there are two towels, a floor towel and three small pieces of face towels. there's a fridge, a microwave, a coffee maker with coffee packets, sugar and creamer. There's a flat screen t.v and an alarm clock. The room is small compared to other BW Plus hotels where I stayed before. They gave me a room for handicapped  as according to the person in the registration they are fully booked for the week. I  am booked for 4 nights which means that I am stucked in this room which is next to the laundry room so you hear the

Excellent hotel. Clean, room was spaceous. Walking distance to Disneyland. Reasonably priced and included breakfast. Friendly staff. We stayed in a suite, I would definately recommend stay at this hotel again.

Summary Heading: Average hotel with mystery egg products
Summary: Check-in was a breeze and the desk people were very friendly. I recently took advantage of the status match. Since I'm gold over at Hilton I am "diamond" at Best Western. There was absolutely no difference in checking in or anything. I mentioned jokingly to them about being "diamond" status and the guy ran back and gave me a bag with a bottle of water and some chips.  The hotel room was clean and functional. Nothing special.  The gym was OK. They need a few more machines in their and spray bottles to wipe down the machines after use.  The breakfast was pretty bad. They had these egg-product discs which were absolutely disgusting. I don't think I've ever seen eggs look like this. They were pressed into a circle like silver dollar pancakes. So, gross.  The rest of the breakfast

We always stay at this hotel. The staff is great. The rooms are great. The breakfast is very convenient and decent. You actually can have a warm breakfast. Great if you want an early start in the park.

This hotel had great staff and the beds were comfortable.  We enjoyed the breakfast, they had a variety of food choices (only thing lacking was fruit, they offered Red apples and Oranges). Our room was clean and quiet.

For the price this place is decent. The parking however is horrible! They have cars parked behind you, etc so you can't get out and they have to have someone move the cars around. The ice machine didnt work :( and I just knew the kids room deluxe was too good to be true. It was like a closet to keep the children in. No air conditioning or window. The room quickly began to smell when the kids stayed in there. They only had a vent to suck in air from our room into theirs.

My wife, my two toddlers, and my parents were staying there for a Disneyland trip. The room we selected had a bed and a fold-out couch in the main room and a small second room with another bed. The price was reasonable, it had a good breakfast, and it was a short distance from Disney shuttles. I wish the bathroom had been between the two rooms, though. I would definitely be willing to stay there again on a future trip if it was the best option.

The staff here were very attentive and friendly. The rooms were clean and the continental breakfast was very good. Walls are a little thin for outside noise, but livable. Overall a great experience for the 5 of us.

This is my second time staying at this hotel. We decide to stay at this location since we were bring our kids with us to Disneyland and the hotel has kids suites.   Gotta love the kid having their own rooms with bunk beds and a pull out couch.   Not a far walk to Disneyland, You can hop on the Disneyland shuttle at the toy story parking lot. But we mostly walked to the park.  Breakfast was great, plenty of stores and places to eat within walking distance of the hotel.  We didn't park but be warned they do charge for parking.

We stayed here 6 nights for a Disneyland family trip.  We had the 2 room, 2 bathroom suite which was great for such a long stay.  The breakfast had a variety of items that offered something for everyone.  Loved having the fridge and microwave for left over dinners, snacks purchased at the local store, etc..  Staff was cordial and helpful.   It was a little noisy at times, but not bad.  We had a room on the second level, away from the street and the kids' room was fairly quiet.  The pool could be kept a little warmer for February temps.   Walk to Disney wasn't bad.  We used the Toy Story bus at night, as the "Buzz Lightyear" lot is next to the hotel.   The area outside of Disney, within the hotel district felt a bit sketchy during the day and at night.  Quite a lot of homeless,

Exactly what we expected, not fancy, but not dirty or run down. Perfect for family who can't afford a resort. Kids had fun at the pool. Very convenient for going to Disneyland. Felt like car was safe for duration of trip. Worth the money we paid.

had 4 nights with 2 children in family room.Our room was great. Kids loved the bunk beds. Pool was lovely. You can see the Disney Fireworks from the hotel as it is that close - literally round the corner from the Disney car park. Only negatives were the same breakfast every day (sausage patties/eggs and cheap muffins/pastries),  no room safe, and not enough spaces for the number of cars so the car park gets very busy, but none of these really impacted on our holiday!

We stayed here at the Best Western and took our family to Disney Land. The price of the park is so high and the rooms, but this Best Western had a great deal on the rooms and it was close enough to the park. We rode the ART bus back and forth with no problems... Very nice stay and we enjoyed our stay and would love to stay there again.

we went to disneyland for 3 days, there are 7 of us, our room was well priced, clean and comfortable. The staff was all very friendly, and the free breakfast wasnt bad at all. Would recommend to others. Thank you for a great stay!

This is the 2nd time we booked a vacation here while we toured Disneyland. It is a much more affordable option then Disney properties are for a family of 7. We booked a room with an attached suite and 2nd bathroom. We were SO comfortable. The cleaning service went above and beyond just making the beds...we came home to find shoes and toothbrushes in tidy rows. The front desk personnel were also very kind and accommodating with our requests, and the breakfast selection was excellent, well presented and attended.

Absolutely no problems.  Every member of the staff we encountered had a smile.  Breakfast had a lot of selections, though it didn't vary from day to day.  Staff was very attentive and concerned with our well-being.  Rooms were clean and updated.  We booked the family suite, and it was perfect for our family.

Good location with easy access to a Disney parking lot shuttle.  Room was great for our large family.  This was our second time using this hotel for our Disney vacation.  The breakfast is good and has a larger variety of items then most hotel breakfasts. The parking can be a bit annoying, but generally you don't need to leave the lot very often.

Summary Heading: Decent motel for a family stay
Summary: We had two large rooms that each slept 6.  They were comfortable enough.  The kids especially loved the bunk beds. The staff were friendly and helpful. The food was good except we thought the waffles tasted kind of different than usual.  There was plenty of other food though; pancakes, sausage, eggs, potatoes, muffins, etc.  It was easy to get to Disneyland with the public transportation right out front.

price is great. I felt i got a lot for my money. Free breakfast, free wifi which work fast for me. Kids loved the bunk bed. The staff is nice and friendly. Walking distance to Disneyland. I did have a stroller or the walk would have been terrible for the kids coming back after walking all day.

We have stayed at this Best Western a few times and would stay again if the price was right.  The good: - Lots of different room configurations, with suites at pretty reasonable prices for the area. - Better than average complimentary breakfast. - Our rooms have always been clean and the beds are comfortable. - My daughter and her friends love staying in the bunk bed rooms.  The mediocre: - Pretty close, but not THAT close to Disneyland.  In the morning... when you have lots of energy... the walk isn't too bad.  But at night... after having walked around alllllll day.... the walk feels very very long.  A way we found to get around that is to take the Disney parking bus to the Toy Story parking lot (right next door) and just walk from there.    The bad: - Charging $14/night for

Stayed at Best Western Plus Raffles for 7 nights. We had a 2 bedroom suite as we were travelling with 2 teenagers. The configuration of the room worked for us. It was a bit noisy in the mornings sometimes but we expected that as it had young children excited about Disneyland. Disneyland was about a 20 minute walk. The breakfast was simple but adequate for our needs. The only problem we had was hiring a car and the girls sent us down near the Honda Stadium to collect it when we only had to go around the corner. Overall a pleasant stay but if we visited the area again would probably stay a bit closer to Disneyland.

the type of place that only exists because of Disneyland.  Highlights included: leaking toilet, floor/walls that shake whenever anyone walks by, a sagging lamp hanging off the wall, noisy AC, uuuuugly decor, smelly towels, and a special "not waterproof" shower curtain that turns your bathroom into a puddle. Continental breakfast was not edible, i elected to go without breakfast multiple days instead of eating what they had.  One genuine plus: free wifi!  That is still a rarity with hotels, so I was pleased about that.

Overall the hotel was fine. We spend most of our time at Disneyland so just looking for a good value for a large family. They served a better than average full breakfast that really helped save some money and was a wonderful bonus. It's about a mile walk to Disneyland and the hotel doesn't offer a free shuttle so it a little far but still do-able if you want to save money.

We arrived on a Friday night to get a night of sleep and an early start in Disneyland the following day.  However, we were met with horribly noisy neighbors that were hosting a party in their room and also had several small kids literally jumping in the beds and bouncing off our common wall.  Now, I know the hotel is limited in their ability to control the behavior of others, but the way they handled the situation was horrible.  After 3 phone calls to the front desk and no results and the wall banging escalating about 10:30pm, I banged on the to alert them to our frustration.  The next phone call to the desk led to them accusing us of bad behavior and still no results.  The kids finally went to bed about 11:30pm.  Other rooms also complained about them, yet nothing was done and

Hotel is a bit dated but very clean and the staff were great.  Breakfast has a good selection of items.  The rooms were quiet and clean. Pool area was a nice spot to relax.  A bit of updating might be in order for a Plus grade BW Hotel.

I always look for hotels that are good priced, kid friendly, free wifi, close to or within walking distance to Disneyland & free breakfast. This hotel is all of that but the hotel staff is lackadaisical. They were a bit unprofessional. We had a couple issues but all in all, the hotel met our needs. Neither horrible or great...just average.

Summary Heading: BE AWARE OF THE PARKING FEE
Summary: We love this hotel for the cool family suites they offer, however on our last visit we surprised by the $14.01 parking fee PER DAY they charge you. They say it is for "Valet Service" but we parked our car ourselves each day and still had to pay the fee per day. I feel that if you are a customer at their hotel you shouldn't be a charged a fee to park in their parking lot. We may not stay at this hotel again due to this reason.  The rooms are great and the breakfast was okay, but not worth the additional cost we paid for parking!

Good alternative to your expensive hotels closer to the park. Walking distance to the toy story shuttle. My family and I stayed in one of the family suites (separate room with bunk bed and pull out) Room was average no real complaints but the price was great. We did not have a car that trip so the shuttle was nice. BUT there are no real grocery stores near by we were told that a local store delivered  and found that not to be true.

We stayed at this hotel for 10 days. It has a complimentary breakfast, a pool and it's near disneyland and it's close to the toy story shuttle. The breakfast was average. It has a good variety of items to chose from, but the warm options aren't great and they are the same every day. The staff was wonderful though, very friendly  and attentive. Gabriela and Aracely at the breakfast room were wonderful. The breakfast room was very small and some mornings it was hard to get a table. The rooms are a good size, but you can hear everything, traffic, the neighbors walking outside and in the room above. The cleanliness of the room was excellent. They also have a guest laundry. What makes this hotel wonderful is the staff. However, one thing I didn't like was having to pay $14 a day for

First off it is a Best Western so don't be expecting Marriott. The rooms were clean and comfortable with lot's of sleeping for families (our room had a queen a sofa bed in a separate room with bunk beds). Breakfast was good with a little more variety than you usual. The staff was pleasant and efficient.  One of the main draws of a place like this is location and this one is quite good. Easy walking to the convention center and Disneyland, lots of restaurants withing walking distance as well.  Have stayed there twice and would do so again.

We checked thinking we had a 2 bedroom suite with 2 queen beds and bunk beds, but we had accidentally booked the smaller room. They didn't have the larger family suit available but they said they would look into it and call us in the morning. They never called. I called back and they said as they thought there was something they could do but had to wait till the manager came in again, no one ever called us back. Then we called for towels they never sent them. I went down and complained, they apologized and comped the parking but I still felt that their customer service was lacking. Also the hotel was very dated. It was old and had only 1 elevator in the far corner of the hotel. If we didn't want to walk around the entire building we had to carry our luggage up and down 3 flights

Summary Heading: Great Family Hotel for Disneyland Trip
Summary: We brought our three adult kids and spouses along with grandkids for a Disneyland weekend and stayed at this BW.  The BW Raffles Inn was with within walking distance of the park and the Kid's Suites were perfect for the young families.  The property was clean and the staff helpful.  We will definitely put this hotel on our list of Disney go-to hotels.

This hotel has the best breakfast I have ever seen in a hotel. The parking spaces are large and lots of them. The staff was pleasant and helpful. The beds in the room were very comfortable and clean.  The ART bus and the OCTA (Orange County ) bus stopped in front of the hotel and dropped you off at the entrance to the Disneyland Park. I would definitely return to this hotel.

Summary Heading: This is not your usual Best Western
Summary: Hotel was very clean. Breakfast was wonderful with great assortments to choose from. The hot tub was cold our entire stay! The office staff did the best they could but the repairman kept heating the pool hotter and not the hot tub, which the office staff had no control over. A shuttle would have been nice, end up paying for parking at the hotel and at Disneyland daily because it is too far to walk! The beds are very hard hotel beds!

The Raffles Inn and Suites is more a motel than a hotel, except that you pay to park on the lot.  We had a room with an extra bedroom that had a door that could be closed.  The room was clean.  The beds were comfortable.  The little fridge and microwave was useful.  We were beside the breakfast room, but that didn't bother us as it was only open for breakfast.  The breakfast was good for being included with the room.  It was very handy for us to dart in for a coffee while waiting for the others to be ready.  We could bring stuff to our room, which was nice.  There was a good variety of food and drinks.  Everyone should have been able to find something that they could eat.  The staff kept it clean and stocked.  We could walk to Disneyland quite easily.  There was no shuttle.

Loved how close it was to the convention center. I walked back and forth many times a day. Great service, friendly staff. Had no problems with the internet and the breakfast was good. Was awesome value for the price, I would stay there again for sure.

Stayed 3-nights in a 2-bedroom, 2-bath family suite in the beginning of January, 2015. Lots of room for our 3 adults & 2 kids! Room was very clean, but we did have carpeting instead of wood floors as shown in many of their pictures. It is obvious that they try very hard to maintain the property, which can be no small feat considering the number of people that stay here throughout the year. Room had a large refrigerator & microwave. Most hotels in the area offer a "continental breakfast," which is code for cereal, pre-packaged pastry & maybe apples. This hotel has a hot breakfast which was completely adequate - eggs, sausage, pancakes, waffles, cereal, fruit, yogurt, toast, pastries, etc. Do not expect a 5-star breakfast buffet, but it's sure better than most in the area! The

Nice staff....but.....  - awful odor that smelled like urine  - awful decor - uncomfortable beds with cheap sheets that actually gave me a rash - Rooms are in desperate need of renovation - Breakfast items were disgusting - rooms could have been a lot cleaner

We are a family of 4 visiting from Australia and stayed here for 19 night in December and January. We stayed in a kids suite which was very comfortable and certainly accommodated our needs. The kids said the bunks were very comfortable, although our 15yo preferred to sleep on the fold out sofa for extra room. The breakfast was adequate each morning and the staff in there were extremely friendly. The staff ensured a constant flow of food. Only downside was that the breakfast room is far to small for the amount of guest so finding a table was often challenging. Unfortunately the walls of the rooms are quite thin so you can hear every conversation and the whole room shook everytime someone walked past. The room was spotless and housekeeping should be commended on the fabulous job

We got a family suite - 2 queens and a bunkbed.  The second room didn't have a window, and was really small.   The closet/vanity space is also very cramped.   The internet was nice, easy to connect to, and fast.   The breakfast wasn't great though, just pastries & cereal, and really institutional hot foods.  The rooms were clean, so that's a plus.  They were also shampooing carpets in several rooms, so it looks like they take cleanliness seriously.     This is the first hotel that has charged a deposit, along with the entire visit's stay upon check-in, without indicating it would do so when I made the reservations.   When I asked management about it, I was just told this was policy.    Checkout was slow, it appeared that the receptionist was chatting with her boyfriend on her

The staff at Raffles deserve 4 to 5 stars for being very pleasant and accomodating.  The hotel as a whole deserves a 2 to 3.  Great prices but at a price.  I hate to complain and hate reading negative reviews but this was by far the noisiest hotel I have ever stayed and I need to vent.  The stucture is dated and creeky and every step by neighbors above is easily heard and disturbing.  My neighbors sounded as if they were dancing from one end of the room to the other at all hours.  I was suprised that the ceiling was still intact.  Others pounding up and down the stairs dragging suitcases behind them.  Car horns and alarms sounding only feet from your room.  All with no sleep can make a person go nutty.  Many of the patrons these prices attract appeared to be either on parole or

The room was dirty and there were cockroaches in the sink and bed bugs in the bed along with dead flees! Old and run down place. The customer service was good, and the pool was warm. The location was good, ART bus stop right out side. Close to dennys.

Stayed here during a Thanksgiving holiday visit to Disneyland and had a room on the second floor.  Was not disturbed by noises from other rooms even though hotel was fully booked.  Room are clean.  Daily hot breakfast was well stocked and meal staff was very accommodating.  Best part of our stay here was swimming the morning of departure!  The pool was heated and clean (stays heated year-round) and jacuzzi worked!  Kids really enjoyed this bonus since many places we stay at for winter vacations close their pools for the off season.  Previous posts mentioned being able to take a shuttle from the Toy Story lot into Disneyland.  Entrance to the Toy Story lot is at the end of the block as you turn right leaving the hotel entrance.  When you take the shuttle from Disneyland back to

Summary Heading: room for family at a great price
Summary: It was great having all seven,four young children and three adults, stay in the kids suite.  It was clean, comfortable and a great savings.  We have stayed at the Dland resorts before and while they are very comfortable, we saved 2/3 the amount of money that could be used at the parks.  The Toy Story parking lot is close to the hotel and because the lot has pedestrian access from the street, it is easy to use their shuttles.

Summary Heading: Cheap Hotel That Wants to Pretend It’s A Resort
Summary: During a recent stay at this facility over the Christmas holiday, I was amazed at the contrast between “Resorts.”  Having stayed at a different property (due to lack of availability at this one) which met the resort definition, this Best Western property fell short in many areas.  First, the check in process was horrible.  The property has one traffic lane in and one traffic lane out, and the valet basically takes up any room for all incoming cars.  I was asked if I wanted to valet, but declined informing the attendant that I was checking in.  He told me to go park first and to come back and I soon learned why.  This property has such limited parking, that it cannot handle the amount of cars to room ratio...forget RV's or trailors.  The front desk clerk was unfriendly, asking
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your comments...we appreciate the honesty of our guest feedback!  I'm so excited to tell you 2015 is going to be an amazing year for the Resort and the Hotel!  We are doing a complete room enhancement which includes new bedding, new Disney artwork, all new furnishings, and more!  My hope is that you contact me when your travels bring you back to Disneyland so you can experience the new hotel!  We are so excited for the room changes as it will greatly add to the overall experience along with complimentary hot breakfast and great service!   Our valet team does a great job of maneuvering cars and making sure your vehicles are safe, and parked as close to your rooms as possible.  Since most hotels in Anaheim have limited parking,  we knew this was a great answer to solve the problem.  We will do the work for you and bring your vehicle whenever you need it.
