Remember this is a 3 star hotel not 5 star you get what you pay for.

We did not find the pictures to be an accurate representation of the rooms. The floors were filthy and bed spread looked like it was 30y old.  We were very disappointed.  When we went back to the front desk to check out after spending 90 min finding another hotel, they charged us for the full night. This was the WORST Best western we have ever stayed at - and we stay at least 10 nights a year in various BW hotels.   Staff hid behind policy and refused to do the right thing for their guest.  This was not the start to our vacation that we needed.  We moved to the Marriott down the road and are thoroughly pleased.

Clean rooms, good beds, descent hot breakfast. Walking distance to Disney which made it a great location. Staff were very helpful with tour booking, transportation arrangements and tickets to Disney. All around a very decent experience at the hotel.

Planned a last minuet get away to Disneyland. Our Regular Hotel was already Book. Glad we tried this hotel. Hotel was nice and clean. Staff were Friendly and fast to check you in and out just what we wanted after driving in Bumper to bumper traffic for 4 hours. It was a wonderful hotel.

We had a family suite at BW Raffles.  Our 5-year-old granddaughter loved the bunk beds.  The staff got us into our room early which we appreciated.  Everything was clean and worked great. Not luxury but a nice hotel when you spend most of your time in Disneyland. We appreciated the breakfast each morning.  Great for families.

This was a great place to stay with our extended family for out trip to Disneyland.  Easy walk to the parking next door to catch the shuttle to Disneyland and also to nearby shopping and restaurants.  We would all stay here again for our next Disney holiday.  Great value.  We weren't expecting it to be so nice, but it is a lot better than how it shows in the website photos.

Absolutely perfect if you're traveling with kids and want something reasonable and clean. Very quiet and the breakfast is fine. You're close to disneyland and to shopping and restaurants. make sure to get the are shuttle pass.. (ART)

We wanted a safe and clean place that provided breakfast and that was within walking distance (15-20 minutes slow walk) of Disney. This worked out great. There wasn't any variation in the breakfast day to day and we had to pay an additional fee for parking (which they were clear on up front), but overall we would recommend this for those on a budget.

We spent 7 nights in a family suite on the main floor. The room was clean, and spacious, and I especially liked the laminate floors, much cleaner than yucky hotel carpet. We didn't have a car so parking was a non-issue. Toy Story parking lot is right next door so we would walk to the parking lot each day, and take the free shuttle right to the main gate. Breakfast was so-so, but it's what you can expect for free. Saved a ton of money by eating there each day. The beds were very comfortable. The pool was nice and warm. Draw backs: very little insulation between floors, could hear every step the people above us took. Pool area furniture was broken (apparently they have new furniture on order). Other than those minor things this place offers great value. I would definitively stay

Our experience with my wife at Best Western Plus Raffles Inn & Suites was amazing and changed our bad memories with previous stay at Days Inn in Anaheim during our honeymoon. The Best Western Hotel and staff were so awesome and warm they made our stay unforgettable. We got our Best Western Club Card Free! We looking forward to stay again at Best Western soon.  Thank you Best Western

The hotel was nice food was good but the service was so poor we will not return.   The service was not what I have come to expect from Best Western at all.   The housekeeping came at 4pm everyday even after we asked them to make it earlier due to our sons nap time. The toilet paper roll was never changed. The bathrooms were not well cleaned.   Both times we went to use the pool the hot tub was cold and not working.   My special needs sons favorite doll went missing. We looked everwhere and it was no longer in the room. We were told it was not lost in the laundry. I did however go to laundry ask them and was given the same answer. I left my number in case it was found and received no call. Only after 2 days of my son asking did I call back again  to see if by chance it was found

Room was clean and nice.  Very noisy as we were right next to the breakfast buffet.  Multiple small personal items went "missing" during our stay.  Too long of a walk to Disney Parks.  Would not recommend.

I have been staying at BW for years.  I am a Diamond Elite member.  This was the worse BW Plus I have stayed in.  This hotel does not measure up to most plus hotels.  The room was dated and the carpets were crunchy under foot.

Liked that parking was "inside" the hotel structure and not readily accessible from the street.  Felt more secure leaving the vehicle.  Liked the "hardwood" floor.  Felt liked it was cleaner than carpet.  Nice variety at breakfast.  Only drawback there was it was the same everyday.  Shuttle to Disneyland was right outside the hotel.  Shuttle dropped us off at the front gate.  Accommodates a family of 6 with plenty of room.

Summary Heading: A good place to stay near Disneyland
Summary: We stayed there earlier this year when we visited Disneyland. Good location and walking distance to the parks. Rooms are comfortable and clean. Family suites are good value. Breakfast was a big let down; choice of food and presentation. Cutlery is plastic and crockery paper - never experienced that in a 3 star hotel.

The hotel is very close to the Anahiem Convention Centre and 3 blocks from Disneyland.  Breakfast is good, but lacks fresh fruit.  The family suites are very convenient for a group or large family.  Book early otherwise the rates are very expensive.

While a little dated, the rooms are clean, quiet, and comfortable.  The bathrooms were especially clean. The breakfast was good, not spectacular. But it did save us lots of time and expense of eating at the IHOP down the street. Overall, an exceptional value for the money.

Good deal for the area. Decent breakfast, though not a wide array of healthy options. Facilities were clean. Staff was mostly helpful, though not particularly attentive. Great location in walking distance to Anaheim Convention Center and Disneyland. Public transportation was easy.

We stayed here as a base for Disneyland.  The hotel is a 10 min bus ride to Disney or probably a 20 min (guess) walk.  The buses came quite frequently - we never waited more than 15 mins.  Our room was a Kids Suite.  It was great - adults at one end, bathroom in the middle, kids in bunk bed at the other.  We had a sofa too.  Plenty of space for all five of us and we do like to have space in a hotel room!  There was a simple buffet breakfast each morning - not the largest selection we had on our  holiday but certainly enough to choose from.  The pool was lovely - spacious around it and a real suntrap.  Plenty of parking and very quiet - we never heard anyone else.  Considering the price, I think this is good value for money and a good cheaper option for families, especially if

We stayed here on a trip to Disneyland.  I booked this room because on the front page of the hotel ad on Best Western.com it stated the hotel is 1 block from Disney.  Not true...it was about 7 blocks from the Disney entrance.  Our room was great and the hotel was clean, however there was a large group of young cheerleaders staying there also and they were very noisy well into the night and made it hard to sleep.  We had to turn the t.v. on all but one night to block out the yelling. The breakfast was great as was the service.   We probably would not stay here again, only because I would want to stay somewhere closer.

We stayed at this hotel, the service, food, cleanliness and overall experience was great! Closely located to Disneyland, you can either walk or take the bus. Fabulous room rates, and the kids loved the heated pool! We will be back!

This was an extremely clean hotel with very comfortable beds.  The cleaning help was trustworthey and available most of the time when we needed things.  The rooms were quiet and neighbors were not heard.  Though we would have preferred a sit down restaurant, the meals served continentally were hot with good variety.  Would definately recommend this hotel to folks.

I was comfortable staying there for 3 nights. friendly staff, clean bed. I was able to see the fireworks outside from the room, that was nice! Continental breakfast was pretty good for convenience, the break fats was decent - waffle maker, yogurt, coffee, bread, cereal station,....

Our room type was great with 2 rooms and 2 bathrooms. the furnishings were old and worn but clean. The air conditioner worked but poorly. we didn't sleep well because of the constant noise overhead. Breakfast was fair and easy access. close to Disneyland. The staff was friendly and helpful.

This hotel was great for a large group.  It was clean and comfortable with a lot of room.  We had 2 adults and 5 kids from age 12-16.  There are not a lot of frills but we were going out everyday.  Have stayed in all Disney Resort hotels and other suites in the area.  This was well priced, clean and easy to access everything.  Staff super friendly and helpful.

Average Hotel,  very clean and comfortable. Breakfast was a joke. Plastic cutlery and paper plates turned me off from the start. Bacon very over cooked, and poor selection of bread.  Rooms very dated, looks like something from the 70's.

Summary Heading: Decent place to stay, but not ideal for Disney trip
Summary: After my husband used his Leatherman tool to fix some of the major issues with our room, we were able to relax a bit and enjoy our Disney vacation. Our room was on the ground level and tucked away in the back corner of the property, behind the stairwell. It had obviously been broken into recently. The window lock was bent so that it wouldn't latch and the screen was bent out of place. My husband was able to bend the lock back into place so that it latched once again and he straightened the screen frame so that it sat in the tracks correctly. Our front door and its latch showed signs of being repaired recently. The door itself was newly painted and there was a metal plate attached to the door frame that was covering up splintered and broken wood. We honestly think the door had

It was not what I would expect for a Plus Location but it was clean and good enough for a night of much needed sleep.... I was unable to try the breakfast as the could not keep up with the amount of guests eating. Granted that there were several cheerleading squads stay at the hotel... but I would have assumed they might put a few extra staffers to help keep things moving.

Only real complaint I had was the annoying telephone message light blinking the whole entire time I was there and where are the plug ins.  How come hotels never provide a place to plug in your cell phone by the nightstand?   This was probably the best deal for staying near the convention center, easy walk.

Summary Heading: OK Hotel - Terrible value for the money
Summary: Not a good value for the money paid at all. The hotel itself is OK as cheap accommodations, but at 129+tax, this is not cheap at all. A more reasonable price for what I got would have been about 60 dollars, on the high end.

great place to stay,clean,comfy and right price...i highly commend  it ,very professional stuff ...my kids love the warm swimming pool,we love the excellent breakfast offer in a very clean environment ... every where i go out of town i always look for best western hotel because the quality

Perfect for our family of 6 at an amazing price, Breakfast was great, the staff were great. I would stay there again in a heartbeat as well as recomend it to family and friends. We used the ART transport system to and from the park which was perfect because it stops right in front of the hotel and drops off at the park.

I almost passed on this gem due to the ratings.  Wonderful clean room with an excellent full American breakfast including a waffle maker. Save on parking by walking two block to the Toy Story parking lot and taking the free shuttle to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Good hotel, close to DLand and public transit
Summary: Room was fine, clean, quiet, large. Nice to have Anaheim Resort Transit stop nearby - parked the car on Thursday and didn't move it until I left. Close enough to DLand to walk (about 15 minutes at a slightly greater than leisurely pace).

I traveled over spring break with a group of 50 dancers.  This hotel was perfect for our competition at the convention center. The staff was incredible to work with from the group manager Shawn to the desk gal Cruz. Extremely nice accommodations to fit our large group needs and the perfect price! The breakfast is awesome and they made us a sign. The hotel also let us use the breakfast room for a pizza party. They had security at the entrance which was a great plus for us. We walked tondisneyland which was very close.  There is also many food options near by. They were also accommodating for our bus because there were multiple there for the competition.  I recommend this hotel to anyone planning a group trip. It would even be great for families.  Thanks for a great stay!

This is one of the best places to stay in a great area of the Central coast for the price.  Plus Severino's Bar and Grill is excellent with great happy hour prices!  The breakfast is worth the room rate and everything that is included is a great bonus.  The complimentary drinks at the bar is a nice touch. We have stayed there for many years and will continue to make trips over there as long as the rate do not go sky high.

I reserved the room with the bunk beds and pull out bed in a separate room because we have 3 kids.  We didn't get that room and there were no more available.  Made sleeping arrangements difficult.  Big bummer since that was the main reason I chose this hotel

Summary Heading: Very good for less expensive Disney experience
Summary: We couldn't afford the Disney hotel this time so chose this from a list of same-priced places in Anaheim.  When I called a couple times to ask about shuttles to Disney and from LAX, I was pleased with the helpful answers.  During the stay, the staff was always helpful and friendly.  We opted to take a city bus to Newport Beach on our third day and the staff made a big effort to print out schedules for us and wanted to know how it had gone afterwards.  FYI:  I wouldn't take that particular trip unless you are city savvy.  I lived in Philadelphia for years and it was much like riding the city bus in grittier parts of the city.  It required one transfer but it was only $5 for the whole day.   As others have said, it is a very average, clean place to stay that is close enough to

Great location to Disney and room configuration terrific for our family of 6.  We had the bunk room with second bath. Worked beautifully when having to bathe everyone after a day in the park. The breakfast was good and saved lots of time and money. Would stay here again.

Good room we read Tripadvisor on this hotel and followed other peoples lead.We chose our room top floor so no one above us,we had no car we arrived by Amtrak from San Diego and bus to Anaheim great no problems.Staff were very helpful rooms clean no problems there they are getting dated and it will be ready for an upgrade soon but we had a good stay.Breakfast was very good and was close enough to Disney to walk.All tour and shuttle buses for L.A. tours and airport shuttles were done from hotel and picked us up from the hotel.Had a lovely stay here recommended would stay there again

We stayed at this hotel when we went to Disneyland.  The two best features: the location to Disneyland (we walked to the Woody parking lot and took the shuttle) and the breakfast.  We needed two rooms and asked that they be next to each other, and they were.  We didn't really spend that much time in the room since our purpose in Anaheim was to be in the parks; however, we all thought the rooms were quiet and we were able to get a comfortable sleep.  If we were to go back, we would look into staying at this hotel again.

The room suited our needs.  We had a problem with the towels.  You could tell that they had been laundered but they were not clean.  Some had makeup, some had globs of hair.  The water when first turned on had a very bad smell.  It cleared up after running for about 30 seconds but was there every time you turned the water on.

Nice place to stay.  Parking is good for SoCa.  Has walk-in shower that so many BW lack.  Nice room with hardwood floors.  Keeps allergies down.  Friendly staff.  Lot attendant was great!   Breakfast is ok.  About .5 mile from DL.  A bit of a hike but doable.  Would consider when back in area.

The hotel is close to Disney land, which was nice, although it would be nice if parking was included in the rate, like the other best western that is right across Disney land as well. We choose this b-w because the other one was booked and they include parking, so that was a disappointment. Other than that everything is fine.

This hotel was excellent, we were able to check in early.  Our party of 5 which included our 2 children loved their separate room.  The breakfast was good, my little ones loaded up for our long day at disneyland.  Saved us alot of money on that.  We walked down to the parking for toystory parking to catch the bus which was great, because by the end of the day having to carry tired children would have been tough if we had to walk further.  Staff was great and our room was very clean each night we returned. Only thing bad is the parking but we didnt use our car while there so it wasnt a problem once it was parked.  The attendants were very nice and quick. We would definitely stay here again when we come back to disneyland.

Summary Heading: No Frills but gets the job done
Summary: If your the type of person or family who will be seeing very little of your hotel room while playing at Disney I highly recommend this hotel. Its no frills, but its close, its clean and its affordable. Their breakfast is terrible but perfect to grab some some coffee and maybe some cereal or yogurt. Ihop is about a block away if you are in the mood for a more hearty breakfast. LIke the reviews prior, we took advantage of the free shuttle at the Toy Story parking lot a block away. Its fast and FREE! Don't waste your money on ART. We stayed for three nights and I would stay there again.

Found this hotel as one of the 'good neighbor' hotels for Disneyland. I paid for the rooms in advance so upon check-in, it took literally 30 seconds to get us in. Front desk staff was quick and friendly. They we're all very knowledgeable about the area and Disneyland (shuttles, times ect) Rooms were very comfortable and welcoming. Very nice decor and overall loved them. The complimentary breakfast will save you some $$$! Quiet property at night. Great location with many places to eat just down the street. Parking can be a little cramped but even if your parked against the wall and another vehicle blocks you in the valet guys were so friendly and quick at moving vehicles so that you can get out. Wish the parking area was bigger and not so cramped but you cannot beat the price and

Summary Heading: Raffles Inn and Suites, Anaheim, CA
Summary: The motel was all that it advertised to be.    The rooms are clean and the linens are fresh--daily if you want them. Minor wear was seen.   The breakfast room can be quite busy if guests who are attending a convention eating early in the morning between 6:45 and 7:45 a.m. Of course, you may eat outside or in your room if you prefer. The breakfast has sweet roles, several selections of dry cereal, yogurt, milk, apple or orange juices, coffee, different toasted breads, pancakes, waffles, eggs, sausage patties, and county-fried potatoes.   It is in easy walking distance to the Anaheim Convention Center. If you want a good steak, Ruth's Chris Steakhouse is across the street. Disneyland is about a 20-miniute walk with many chain restaurants also within that time-period in walking

This hotel was ideal because they were able to accommodate our large family. The rooms are decent - not great but not poor. The service was excellent and the value was good for the product provided. The breakfast was not good, but that was the only negative. We would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Happy with Best Western PLUS Raffles Inn & Suites, Anaheim
Summary: This hotel can accomodate my family of 4 very well with nice bunk beds and separate room for my 2 kids.  If you travels with kids make sure to book for family room suite with 2 separate rooms that the kid room has their own bathroom was the plus.  Staff here were wonderful and my total stay experiences were extreme satisfied.  Just that the pool supposed to be heated but on this visits my kids couldn't swim in it because the pool water was too cold.  But at least they still enjoyed the hot spa.

Summary Heading: Best Western Raffles Inn and Suites
Summary: Our stay at the Best Western Raffles was most enjoyable, the free breakfast was most appreciated.  It was clean and comfortable.  The purpose of our stay was to go to Disneyland and the walk was a bit farther than we had anticipated (about 3 large LA city blocks), so the kids were tired.  The hotel did offer a shuttle service which would have been an option.

Great staff, very eager to assist. Not enough parking for hotel guests but the parking attendant was very trust worthy.  Parking lot for Disneyland shuttles is adjacent to this hotel and very convenient so no driving or parking at park was necessary.

Great stay - only problem was the pool heater was broken and the spa did not get hot enough - breakfast was okay but I'm a healthy eater and options besides an orange or apple or oatmeal were limited. Processed eggs, greasy sausage - I just had toast and fruit but for free what do you expect.

Hotel is clean, staff is friendly - cost was fantastic!  Only...no gym!  Around corner from Disney parking lot - 10 minute walk to park!  Parking gets full late at night - we had to give up keys to parking attendant one night.  Breakfast overall was good - lots to choose from.

My family and I absolutely loved this hotel. Perfect suite for our big family. 2 queen beds, 2 bunk bends and a pull out couch. Great employees. Close to Disneyland. Clean rooms. Felt safe and secure. Breakfast was delicious.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your great repsonse!  We enjoyed having you here and look forward to you coming back and making more memories!  We have some exciting changes that we are making to the Hotel and we cant wait to see you again!   All my best!  Shawn

Summary Heading: It was great!  The staff was awesome
Summary: This place was really great and well priced.  We stayed there for 4 nights, 3 adults and 2 children, the kids slept in a bunk bed, I slept on a pullout bed and another couple slept in the other room.  it was about a 15 minute walk to Disneyland, we took the bus a few times and walked a few times.  The hotel staff was really helpful and friendly and able to answer the many questions we had.  The breakfast was great, especially for a hotel breakfast, it saved us a lot of money.  I will definitely stay here again on my next trip.  Only negative was that the hot tub wasn't hot, the pool seemed warmer.

I have stayed at this hotel in the past and chose to stay here again for the kid suites!  Unlike some places I have stayed, it really was a kid suite with their own room, TV and bunk beds.  After a long day at the Disney hotels, it is nice to put them in their own room to relax and have our own room to relax in!  The breakfast was good for a hotel breakfast.  Close to Disneyland.  Be aware there is additional fees for the parking.

We had gotten this hotel on a groupon deal but I would not pay full price for it. The hotel is very loud. In the early morning you can hear all the families leaving for Disneyland. The hot tube wasn't hot, it was barely lukewarm, and the shower took a while to heat up as well. The breakfast was decent, good variety. My main complaint was the noise level. The hotel is shaped like a square with the parking lot in the middle so you hear every single car and person outside.

Stayed in a 2 room suite with 5 kids and we were pleased with our time there. Rooms were clean, plenty of towels for all, great breakfast in the morning too. A little far of a walk from Disneyland when you've been walking all day, but bus stops right in front of hotel and Disney parking directly next door.

I stayed here with my husband, 2 daughters and a brother-in-law for a 7 night stay. We stayed in the queen suite and it was very accommodating for the 5 of us. We stayed on the 3rd floor after reading the reviews and glad we did. Barely heard any noises around us. The breakfast was OK but you do have a few choices and it served its purpose. A good 15-20 walk but can always take the shuttle from the toy story parking lot a block down the street. Would definitely come back. Recommend rooms on 3rd floor if you don't mind the hike or taking the elevator.

We've just returned from our epic Disneyland trip and it was so much fun. This Best Western was great. It was clean, comfortable, and a true bargain. It is a bit older and in need of updating but it was clean, which is a priority for me. The staff is great. All very nice and willing to help with whatever they could. Breakfast was pretty blah, but it was free. Waffles were the best deal, hot and fresh.  The location was perfect. Just a couple minutes walk away from the Toy Story Parking Lot where a free shuttle waits to take you right up to the front of the parks. No need to drive or pay for the ART shuttle. It was a bit of a bummer that the rooms didn't have safes. And yes, it is noisy. It's a family hotel right by Disneyland so it's not hard to imagine that it would be a bit

Summary Heading: Great room set up for families
Summary: We stayed in the 2 suite room.  The first room had 2 queen beds with an internal door to a second room with single bunk beds (2 beds) and a sofa bed.  Each room had a bath room.  Yes the rooms were a little dated but for a family of 5 to have a bit of space was great.  You never had to wait for the bathroom.  The rooms were serviced daily - no complaints!   The car park was right there with the choice of lift or stairs.  We all managed to find something for breakfast, and sitting outside on the stools was great.  Check in and out was easy, the staff answered all our queries with a smile. It was easy to get to Disneyland, we just walked up the road to the Disney Toy Story car park and caught the free car park bus to the gates - too easy!!  The price was reasonable for a family.

This hotel was very conveniently located close to Disneyland.  The breakfast was definitely adequate.  It was not gourmet, but plenty of options (not really healthy ones though).  The value of having a family suite was the selling point for us.  I wish the bathroom was on the adult side of the door instead of the child's side, but that would not be a deal breaker for the future.

Summary Heading: Value hotel with good shuttle to Disneyland
Summary: We were an extended family in three rooms (one connected for the older kids). Friendly, helpful staff over the Presidents holiday week made our multiple day visit to Disneyland a good vacation. Just a note on the room rates. Plan on adding about $30 extra per day for all the taxes, fees, and assessments that were not quoted in the original room rates. That might be common throughout the area though. The pool heater was not working and the spa heater produced tepid water at best. Like I have read from previous comments, basic room and amenities for the brief amount of time you'll spend in it.

I was travelling with my 2 adult kids, so my daughter and I had a queen bed each in the main room and my son slept in the bunk room. There were 2 bathrooms which was handy. You could walk to Disneyland, though we went to the close-by carpark and caught the free shuttle. Breakfast was ok and the hotel was quite comfortable.

We love this hotel a hidden gem! We have stayed many places around Disney and truly love this place the staff from desk clerks to Maint and housekeepers are always pleasant. Clean rooms, good breakfast, great for couples or groups and a great $ deal when spending all your money at Disney and spending little time or a lot of time at the hotel! The pool is wonderful when we take the grandkids! It is a short walk to the toy story parking lot!

Summary Heading: Just a place to sleep and shower
Summary: Basic room and amenities.  My kids noticed an orange and some garbage under a bed from a previous guest.  Sink drain smelled like sewer when water ran into it.  Nothing fancy at all.  Positives:  Wi-fi worked well,  good shower, breakfast waffles good. Glad price was low.  I guess you get what you pay for.

We stayed here for a week and found the hotel to be very comfortable and well-situated. Walking distance to almost all attractions in Anaheim (Convention Center and Disneyland). Rooms were very clean, beds comfortable, but a little bit noisy when someone walks on the floor above you (we couldn´t figure out how someone could walk above us since we were on the last floor, but still, there was noise). Breakfast is average, probably more "american" style than we expected, I have to say that I expected something better. Internet connection in the room was excellent. Very nice staff, especially the guys at the entrance to the parking. There is also a bus stop just in front of the hotel so it´s also good for families who want to leave the car at the hotel. And at night, you can see the

This Best Western is across the street from the convention center. It’s an easy walk to the convention center and they will allow you to park in the parking lot before and after check in/out if you have reservations. The hotel is clean and overall a good value for the price. The continental breakfast was average but did the trick. There are plenty of restaurants nearby. I will stay there again when in town.

We stayed here with 2 adults and 2 preschool aged kids for a week in January 2014. It's a perfectly passable hotel. The room was clean, bed reasonably comfy. A huge plus, in our situation, was the kid suite room. (Or whatever they call it.) A separate sleeping area with a bunk bed makes for a perfect set-up for a family with 2 kids, much easier than trying to put the kids to bed in a typical room with 2 queen beds.  The breakfast was, sorry to say, awful. Based on reviews I wasn't expecting anything extravagant, I was just hoping for simple and decent. The fresh fruit was lovely, but that's about it, and we gave up on trying to eat at the hotel. Eating at McD's would have been a big step up quality-wise!   The location was fine. We put our kids into a big stroller and could be

Had a great overall experience at the Raffles Inn - great value for the cost and family-friendly hotel for our Disneyland trip.  Beds were comfortable, clean room & bathroom, internet functioned well, nice TV/fridge/microwave, parking was good, complimentary oranges & newspaper, good breakfast, good location & easy access to free Disney shuttle, staff was helpful.  I really appreciated the accommodation of my room request as I'm a light sleeper.  They even upgraded us to a family suite on the last night (birthday celebration package) at no extra cost which rocked!  Was a little noisy in the early mornings but that's to be expected with so many families with young children.  Although breakfast was good, a couple things would have made it even better - more fresh fruit (bananas),

Summary Heading: Clean and Close Enough to Disneyland
Summary: We took my 4 years old niece to Disneyland last week and stayed at this hotel for 2 nights.   The hotel doesn't look very nice from outside but the rooms are remodeled and nicely decorated. We stayed at a one bedroom suite since there was 5 of us: The room was clean and spacious. It could sleep up to 6 people. The staff are polite and professional. Breakfast is decent.   The location is good, you can walk to the park if you choose to, we didn't because we didn't want to walk back with a tired little girl. They also offer shuttle service to the park.   Overall we had a pleasant stay and would recommend this place.

Enjoyed our stay. Have stayed here several times. Looking forward to upgrades at hotel! Cruz, who works at the front desk, was awesome.  She was so helpful.  Also, the parking attendants made us feel that our vehicle was safe and sound.

Not what I was expected from their pictures. Small, not very clean and not updated rooms. Bad customer service, we forgot a stuff animal from our 4 years old and took us one week of phone calls with different people to have it shipped to our place.

We had one bedroom suite, clean and spacious.  Average decor.  We had a package that included free parking, a movie, fresh baked cookies, and popcorn.  The clerk at check-in did not know anything about the special, even thought it was on Best Western.com.  I showed him the confirmation and he gave me the free parking and movie, but not the rest.  The walls were very thin so we could hear everyone that walked by outside.  Housekeeping was very noisy.  Started rolling their carts by at 6:00 a.m. talking very loudly to each other.  They allowed smoking and alcohol in the pool so there was a big party going on.  My daughter was disappointed that she couldn't swim.  Also, I wanted to point out that on their website under amenities it says local shuttle.  This is an Anaheim Shuttle

Summary Heading: Timber floors and Lino make upstairs sound noisey
Summary: We have been traveling for 3 weeks in various hotels in California and this was the worst for noise and breakfast. At first impression was good with easy check in and secure car parking (extra charge)  With lots of luggage we thought we had won a great location on the ground floor, the rooms were large with a separate room for the kids (inc a tv ) in general they were nicely presented and looked comfortable. When going to bed we noticed the bed was unstable and when one person moved so did the other person , then at midnight our upstairs neighbours arrived in and  due to timber floors and vinyl floor covering every foot step could be heard. I am not saying the were stomping either but the noise was enough to keep us all awake till they finally settled  and I am not a light
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your feedback!  I'm so sorry your stay was less than perfect as thats exactly what we strive for!  Most guests are so excited to experience our brand new hard wood floors on the first floor only.  They're modern, clean, and functional.  We are excited to have options for our guests and we offer rooms with carpet on the 2nd and 3rd floors.  I hope you come back and try another room type and maybe a higher floor might be nice for light sleepers.  During busy times, this Hotel is certainyl filled with laughter and families celebrating and making memories.  We are proud tobe a "green" property and have recycleable items in our breakfast room.  We also have a compliemntary HOT breakfast that guetss appreicate because it's a complete breakfast with lots of vairety for kids and adults. We want you to have options and save money while you're here...so you can spend at the Disneyland Theme Parks!  Thanks for your feedback as we always try and improve the quality of our guests visit!

Summary: Oh boy. I didn't want to do this, but here I go...  I should have known. We all wanted to head down the 5 and go to disneyland. Looking up different hotels, my sister in law stumbled upon a groupon(I know, I know, we shouldn't have) that was a descent enough deal and we looked at the pix, seemed ok, so we purchased.   I called the night before we left because I'm just like that, to see if they had our reservation and they assured me they knew we were coming. We arrive pretty late maybe 11 pm, I walk in to what they call a lobby (plastic picnic table shoved in what used to be there lobby with laptops out on it). They had us on the list but when we got to the room, it was there basic room meant for one person. There was 4 of us. We had booked the king suite with 2 king beds. She
Manager Response: Thanks for your response to your recent visit with us!  My apologies you came to visit us as we were transforming our Hotel.  It's important we stay on trend with quality decor and furnishings and provide our guests with new bedding, a brand new lobby and a newly renovated breakfast room.  We are one of the busiest Best Westerns in Anaheim due to our variety of room types we offer.  There's soemthing for everyone.  If for some reason, one of the room types doesnt work for a family, we are certainly open to changing it so you're comfortable.  I hope you reutrn to see some of our additional improvments to the property and the new breakfast items we've added so you can see why this Hotel is a favorite among so many families coming here for value, quality and making great memeories with their loved ones.  Thanks for your honest opinions, we hope to see you back so your next visi tis perfect!

Summary: Every year I come to Anaheim for a trade show, and every year I book at the Raffles Inn.  Consistency would be the word I would use for this Best Western hotel.  The rooms are clean, the breakfast is nice, and the staff is always friendly.    While they could maintain what they are doing, I feel like they are always looking for ways to get better.  And that's a good thing....

We came to Anaheim, CA. with our children and in-law families to do a surprise 96 Birthday Party of my Mother. After read others reviews, I chose this hotel and booked last two rooms here (others in my family have to book somewhere close by!!!). Thanks to Karla and Richard! They did their best to set us up to our rooms. They were so friendly and professional. This hotel is located in the heart of Disney Land area, right on the Harbor Blvd., with a little walk to theme parks and with all restaurants, shoppings, attractions near by. It's also close to Interstate 5 for easy access to LAX. Airport or to San Diego. One of our room was with 2 Queens and the other was two rooms suite with Queen and Bunk Bed also had Sleeping Sofa in room. Both rooms size are quite large. Carpet is

The staff was great, but the noise of all the other guests was heard through the thin walls. This rooms were clean and decorated nicely. The bathrooms had convenient soap dispensers, but they were not filled in the vanity area and the one in the shower had conditioner in the body wash and shampoo slots.

I was immediately impressed with the friendliness of the staff when I pulled in.  Everyone from the parking attendant to the cleaning staff was smiling and helpful.  Clean, comfortable, and within walking distance to the park.  I will certainly stay here again on return trips to Disneyland.  A really great value for a family traveling on a budget!  And when you add in a Costco discount, it makes it even better!

We always stay at this hotel when we go to Disneyland.  It's always been nice and comfortable and this time was no exception.  It was great.  The rooms were clean and comfortable.  The breakfast was nice and easy to get around in.  We had an exceptional clerk that checked us in and out.  I believe her name was Cruz?  Very personable and polite and informative.  I hope she's there when we go there again which will be in a few months.    The only problem we had was with the valet service (which is not part of the hotel).  When they moved the car they left it unlocked all day with all of our things in it.  This won't stop us from going there again though.  We just won't use the valet!

This is a wonderful place to stay when visiting anywhere near the Disneyland area. The prices were reasonable, I loved that they had a separate room for the kids. Breakfast was good, and with 3 kids, free breakfast alone saved us about $30 a day. Clean, maids were very nice and professional. Wonderful experience, we will definitely be back again.

The Raffles Inn was in the middle of a lobby remodel so the first impression wasn't real good!  When we got to our room, a family suite, we were very pleased.  The rooms were clean, with plenty of room for my children/grandchildren!  I will definitely recommend this motel for other families and will return to stay here on our next trip to Disneyland!

Hotel was very accommodating and staff is extremely friendly and always smiling and greeting you in all parts of the property. Great location and clean neighborhood only a few minutes from Disneyland and 3 miles away from the Angels Stadium

Summary Heading: Great Home away from Home during the Holidays
Summary: We had a great Christmas spent at Best Western Raffles and Disneyland.  We made sure we had a suite with a bedroom so the kids had their own room for Christmas Eve.  The hotel is s good location with restaurants around and about a 25 minute walk to Disneyland and a shuttle was available for a cost.  We drove and parked at the Mickey Garage for $16 a day with in and out privileges.  The staff were all great!!  Everyone was genuine and hard workers.  On the bottom floor the foot steps above are a bit loud in the morning but we were always up early to get to Disneyland so it didn't affect us that much.  The breakfast is OK.  The breads were dry and I wish they had more healthy breakfast choices but that didn't stop us from eating there every morning.  This was our second time at

this hotel and staff went above and beyond for our family.  One of our family members has special needs so we wanted somewhere with a little more space.  The room was awesome.  A queen plus queen sofa bed in one room plus off of the main room was another bedroom with another queen bed.  The pool and hot tub were great after a day of walking around seeing the sights.  They were in the process of reno'ing the front entrance and there was very little noise or disruption.  Great place to stay.  Would definitely stay there again.  Guest Laundry was a bonus.

This hotel is located a mile from Disneyland parks.  It is located only a block south from a major parking lot with shuttle service.  We used the shuttle even though we didn't park in the lot.  This was a life saver.  The room slept our 5 comfortably in one room, tough to do.

Convenient is the best to describe this hotel.   It is a bit noisy and kids running amok at all hours.  They have a nice breakfast included in the nightly room rate that begins at 6:30.  Close to Disney & convention center. I would definitely stay here again.  The valet was so helpful & nice that I asked him questions instead of going the the front desk.

Summary Heading: Great Location, but not the best stay
Summary: We booked at an incredible value. Upon check in, the front desk staff and parking attendants were very nice. However, our room was just ok. The worst part was the noise. We were on the bottom floor and heard kids running up down the halls and in rooms at 6AM! There was so much noise from then on...luggage, laundry carts, housekeeping chatting loudly, more kids running, kids running and laughing, and more running. I understand this is a family friendly hotel, but make sure families respect others in the early morning. Housekeeping came to our room around 8AM...seriously?Definitely not a place where you can relax, sleep in, or be in peace and quiet. Do not stay here if you want to sleep in past 6am and be undisturbed by housekeeping and other guests at odd hours...you can hear

This by far was one of the best stays ever! I got an AMAZING deal, breakfast was good and just close enough to the Toy Story parking lot to walk!! My kids were so comfy in the room they hung out and goofed around watching TV instead of going to the park!  We will stay here again :)

Summary Heading: Hotel was okay; just don't leave anything behind...
Summary: My daughter left her Christmas gifts in the room and they were not turned in by housekeeping. We were sure we left them, but discovered them missing hours later and were very sad when no one found them.

This was the most comfortable stay at a hotel we've had in a very long time. It was a slight distance from Disneyland but we knew that before coming down. Besides, it's the holidays and a little exercise is good for you. When we come down again, we will be sure to check this hotel first for availability. Thank you.

My family and I had a wonderful stay at the BEST WESTERN PLUS Raffles Inn & Suites. Eric (?) was outstanding and delivered GREAT service at the front desk on Monday December 16th. Nice rooms, wonderful breakfast, lovely property, and all staff were super nice. If my family and I chose to stay at a Best Western again that's a bit further away from the Disneyland parks then we will definitely stay here again! As a former Best Western General Manager I was extremely impressed....and I have high standards when it comes to hotels!

Stayed here the first week of December.  We had a family room, which was quite spacious and clean.  It wasn't as quiet as I would have liked during the day, but at least there was never enough noise at night to wake me up.  Just under a mile walk to Disney, but there is a ART stop just outside the door or a 5-10 minute walk to the Toy Story parking lot.  The free breakfast was good but got a little boring by the end of the week.

We stayed for six nights and used this as a base for our LA stay as we did not know any areas of LA and this proved a good choice. 15 min walk to Disney, rooms were clean & ok, not flash, it was a bit odd with the washbasin in second bedroom. We were on ground floor and with two floors above, was noisy at night. Parking was hard at times. Breakfast was a bit chaotic and food was average. To get into rest of LA was about half hour on the freeway. Would use this place again as the staff were great, price was good at about $100 a night for four including parking.

This hotel was great for our large family, we stayed in one of their family suites. The beds were not the best but the hotel and the rooms were clean.  The breakfast was good with a decent variety of items to choose from both hot and cold!  We were able to walk to Disney in 10-15 minutes which was very nice and there were a lot of restaurants very close offering a variety of food/dining choices.

First of all, this hotel is only about 2 city blocks from the Disneyland parking shuttle which takes you to the main gate. We walked back and forth every day. Second, we loved our room! A room for the kids with bunk beds and a sleeper sofa and TV and a room for us, queen with television, with the bathroom in between. The entire staff was awesome! Great breakfast with eggs, sausage, waffles, fruit, yogurt and so much more. A simple, clean hotel with everything we needed and wanted. Eliminating unnecessary frills Disney guests won't have time to use, helps keep the prices at this establishment very reasonable. Can not recommend enough!

This hotel was great for my family of 3 kids.  The breakfast was great, the hotel was clean, and we saw fireworks right from our balcony.   We had a suite where it had one big room with a queen plus and pullout sofa bed.  It also had another attached bedroom with a queen bed.  It was great for our family.

I loved this hotel! It definitely made our Disneyland trip even more spectacular! We stayed in a family suite with two queens, sofa bed and bunkbeds (plus two bathrooms). It was very economical considering the money you save with their continental breakfast. Which is amazing by the way...Overall a perfect experience!

Summary Heading: What I expected based on other reviews
Summary: I stayed at the Raffles Inn Best Western in October for 4 nights.  There were 2 adults and 2 kids, and the suite we had was perfect for us!  We had a typical hotel room with 1 queen bed, 1 couch that folded out, and 1 bathroom.  Added to that was a separate bedroom, which was perfect to put the kids in.  That way the grown-ups could stay up after the kids passed out at night.  We had a microwave and fridge in the room, too.  The room was very much what I expected.  Not amazing, but clean and standard room.  The housekeeping did a great job cleaning every day, too.  Based on other reviews, we requested a room at the back of the property (off of the main road), and we never had any issues with noise.  The pool was small but worked great for us after a day at the park (as did the

The hotel is walking distance from the convention center and Disneyland.  The parking situation is terrible.  There is not enough parking so a valet blocks you in with other cars.  We checked in and left all of our valueables out and the air conditioning on to cool the room.  We went out to eat and returned two hours later to find that a best western employee had been in our room.  I was upset that anyone had been in the room since we had just checked in.  We did not request any service of any type.  I was told that they came in to change the couch.  They should have changed it out before renting me the room.  They left a small table in the middle of the walkway and turned off the air conditioner that I had left on to cool the room to MY desired temperature NOT Best western's

Summary Heading: Spotless rooms, nice breakfast very comfortable
Summary: Great value for the price, great location minutes from Disney, room that slept 8 and 2 bathrooms.  Beds very comfortable. Would have no problem staying there again.   Parking was a challenge and does cost $ however the parking valet took care of that.

This was our first time at this property. We are AP holders at Disneyland, so we often stay for one or two nights and generally choose a hotel based on past experience, value, and convenience. This time, Raffles was the best choice and we couldn't be happier with it. The room was spacious, the beds were comfortable and we loved that the we had two sinks outside of the toilet/bath area - makes it easier to get ready for the day. We're already looking forward to our next stay there!

I always stay at Raffles because their prices are good and the breakfast filling. I've found that the service is always good. Phone ahead for the best prices. It's withing walking distance to Disneyland, then we take the shuttle back to the off-site Disneyland parking after a day of fun in the parks!

2 adult couples and 4 kids we stayed in the 2 bedroom to bathroom suite for about $100 per nite. Includes a great full breakfast and parking (other hotels charge around $15 per nite for parking). And they did not charge for our extra vehicle! Definitely will return.

Pros - very comfortable beds, very close to the Disneyland parking lot where you can walk to and catch the free shuttle at Toy Story lot - value  Cons - Room was not what was represented on the website, carpets needs to clean, walls were very thin very noisey

Summary Heading: Great value hotel. A great hotel for a weekend at Disney.
Summary: My family stayed here Friday and Saturday night and we had the family suite, which is two queens bed and a pull out sofa. The room was your typical best western hotel. The key thing was that it was clean, the ac work, and they had hot breakfast. The restroom was a little small but it was doable. I liked that the vanity was desperate from the restroom. So people can shower and others can brush their teeth. The hot breakfast was great. A good way to start out your day at Disney and the price of the hotel was reasonable. I would stay here again in a heart beat.

Very good hotel, good prices, and the room was awesome, close to Disneyland.  Loved the customer service, I had a problem with my tire and Jimmy the Valet guy right away with out hesitation offered his help, together with Guillermo a maitanance memeber, both changed my tire.  I really appreciated the help, I honestly would stay here again.

I was really surprised at this hotel. The price of the room was great although the taxes were high. Very good breakfast provided. I would definitely stay there again. The bed was one of the bests I have slept on in a hotel in a long time.

This hotel is 15 minute walking distance to Disneyland. The hotel is comfortable and has one elevator. Offer breakfast and parking (included in the price you pay), which makes it a bargain compare to neighbor hotels.  It was not a 5 star room, however it was very comfortable and has all the amenities you need. I would stay here again.

This reasonably priced hotel is family oriented. It is located in the heart of Anaheim resort area. Disneyland parks are close but a good walk. You take the ART service for a small fee. Even better, it is a 1 block walk to the Disneyland car park where you can take the FREE shuttle to the parks.  I stayed in the family suites. The suites are adequately spacious and clean but the bathroom is quite small. I found from my experience that the beds are very comfortable and that house keeping is superb.The free breakfast is generous and varied but it can become quite difficult to find a free table due to the small size of the dinning area. The offer free high speed WiFi and self-serve laundry facilities for a nominal fee. There is a gated small swimming pool onsite which is accessed

We stayed 6 nights.  Queen bed and small room with a bunk bed, pullout bed and a door.  Only 1 bathroom.   Staff professional and kind. If you are looking for affordable this is the one.  Hot free breakfast every morning and a quick drive to Disney. We had a corner unit room 339 and could see the Disneyland fireworks and the pool from our room.  Very quiet considering it's a Disney neighbor hotel.  Very small main room but 2 TV's and a door separating the kids room was great!  I would recommend this hotel for those on a budget!

We stayed at this hotel after winning a vacation package through Best Western. At first we were upset that we were going to have to stay so far away from Disneyland but were very pleasantly surprised. The room was clean, spacious, newly remodeled, quiet (except for the loud mouth adults that felt it was okay to scream out side the rooms down to the parking lot), hot breakfast was great with TONS of options, my daughter and brother had a great time in the pool (it is shaded in the afternoon). WiFi didn't always connect but we were there to close down the parks, not surf the net. The highlight of our trip was the fabulous woman behind the counter in the lobby, Cruz! She is a beautiful soul, so kind and a pleasure to talk to. Cruz had so much knowledge of the area, how to get to

Summary Heading: A clean place to lay your head...
Summary: Our family of 4 stayed here Oct 6-10/13 during our trip to Disneyland.  Check in was great, Cruz was wonderful and very helpful.  We had a kids suite and to be honest it was not what we expected.  It was quite small ~ the main room had a queen size bed, tv and desk and chair as well as small fridge and microwave. The second room is accessed through a door off the main room and it had a sink, bunk beds, a tv and full closet. The access to the separate bathroom was through the 2nd room.  There was no way to watch tv from anywhere in the kids room unless you stood in front of it as it was placed at the end of the bunk beds. The kids didn't watch tv anyways so it was a moot point but very strange placement for sure. The hotel is  older and there are definitely things that need

For the price we paid ($85 per night) it was a great deal and worth it! We took the ART shuttle from hotel to Disneyland. It isn't really good walking distance with young children or after walking all day at the parks! Breakfast was included which was a perk for us....could have had more variety and changed it up since we were there for 6 nights and had the same thing every morning! But it was hot and pretty good. This is not a fancy hotel, but it was nice and clean. Might stay here again sometime...but don't love the room doors being on the outside!

The place was OK. It's clearly an old property experiencing all the maintenance problems:  the hot tub's plaster is cracked and broken off in some places, several of the deck chairs are ripped and sagging, the rooms have lots of little paint issues and small broken or disconnected pieces (e.g., the metal ring that's supposed to cover where the toilet water feed line comes out of the wall).  The rooms are very cramped and small (and I agree with the other reviewer that the pictures are nothing like the real room). We had the "suite" with bunkbeds and two rooms and there was hardly room to move in the room with 6 people and their stuff.  It smelled funny when we first arrived and when we turned on the A/C units it smelled like urine.  Luckily, the smells went away after several

Summary Heading: I'm Impressed With The Staff Here!
Summary: This past weekend, my family went to Disneyland and I booked this hotel as a "package".  One of our suites was supposed to be handicap accessible...well it was not!  Unfortunately, I was told that none of the suites were accessible even though I had it confirmed on my reservation. I was furious because my mother was along on the trip and had never been to Disneyland and was experiencing it for the first time with her grandchildren..with her mobility limitations we would have had a hard time.  "Gary" made sure that the room got an bath seat for the tub and saw to it that a brand new raised seat was placed in the restroom.  No one minimized my frustration and saw to it that we were comfortable.  The suites were spacious and contenental breakfast was plentiful!  Thank you Gary and

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel, would stay again
Summary: We visited Disneyland from October 9th through the 13th and stayed 4 nights at the BW Raffles Inn.  We usually stay at the BW Park Place Inn right across the street from Disneyland but because it was booked up, we chose this hotel instead as we prefer Best Western hotels.  The Raffles Inn was very nice and we were happy with it.  It's location was a little far from Disney but within walking distance.  We walked the first day to and from the park and it took about 15-20 mins (we have 3 kids.)  It's about .8 or .9 miles from Disneyland.  The second and third days we walked about 5 minutes to the Disneyland Toy Story parking lot and took the shuttle in instead.  That is really the way to go, especially at night on the way back.  It's super easy, just walk into the lot through the

Summary Heading: Would recommend for a family going to Disney
Summary: My kids loved the bunk beds and we like having the two room suite although I wish the room was a bit larger and the door separating them wasn't glass. The walk to the Toy Story lot and the free shuttle couldn't be beat, it drops you right at the gates to the parks. We also enjoyed walking to the nearby restaurants. My only complaints was that I wish there were some healthier options for breakfast (bananas) and that it took 30 minutes while my kids were in the bath for towels to be delivered and when we called a separate time for toilet paper were told that there was no one able to deliver it so we would have to come and get it. Other than that no complaints and we would stay there again.

The beds are very uncomfortable, parking is a nightmare, they tell you it's ok for a late check out and ask you to leave because they are overbooked. I asked for a kids suite and we got bunk beds rooms are nothing like the pictures posted on their website Disneyland is not walking distance

I understand this is not the fanciest place, but we've been happy staying here before and the location can't be beat. I come to the area on family business ... NOT to visit Disneyland (although I do like to schedule one day there). Too many extra charges - phone and movie even though you don't want them. Parking and shuttle even though you aren't going to use them. I wish they'd disclose all the extra fees up front. But, the worst of it was crickets in the room! How do I know that? Because I stepped on one the second night - made sure I promptly delivered it to the front desk. The first night the noise was so bad a maintenence worker came and acknowledged the cricket sounds were coming from inside the room somewhere. I thought it would be taken care of. The next night it was too

Good choice for large families -they sleep up to 8 in some rooms.  It's also next to Disney's ToyStory parking lot (no charge if you don't park).  We had a ground level room which is great for traveling with a baby and stroller.  The "hard wood" floors did need a good cleaning (mop) rather than dust mop.  The beds are comfortable but a bit hard (we have a memory foam mattress topper at home - you just can't beat it).
Manager Response: Your comments are so appreciated!  Thanks so much for bringing the whole family here to visit!  We love family reunions and make sure we do somehting "extra" to help you celebrate FAMILY!  Let me know when you're coming back and we will make sure you know how mcuh we appreciate you! All my best for a Magical Holiday!

Summary Heading: Dirty dump with a clean remote.
Summary: Checked in here last week with my niece and three children. The service was non existent and the room was dirty and smelled. Property is not well kept. Couldn't get out of here soon enough. I had reserved for five days and left after one night. Beds were not great.
Manager Response: I'm so sorry you didint have a great visit and I hope you allow us a chance to make it right when your travels bring you back to Anaheim!  We are so excited to see our Hotel constantly change and upgrade to provide our guests with a great value and clean, modern rooms!  We have already completed an Exterior Hotel upgrade with modern, fresh colors as well as hardwood floors!  We are also upgrading the sofa sleepers, all bedding, and a complete transformation of the inside of our rooms!  It's important we stay on trend with whats new!  We're also doing some very special changes in the room that will pay respects to Disneyland!  You will know you're at the Happiest Place on Earth when you enter these rooms!  Hope to see you back!

Summary: Enjoy being able to walk to the parking area to ride a bus to Disneyland. However, the breakfast gets boring after 2 days, same thing no changes. The parking spots are small and limited. The wood floors are nice. Need a towel rack in the sink area. The walls/floor are thin so you hear the walking above you like giants.

We stayed here for 4 nights for a Disneyland trip with our 8 year old granddaughter.  It is not luxurious, but we did not expect that.  It was nice, clean and safe.  It was a little bit more of a walk to the front gates than we were expecting, but we (and our 8 year old) made it without too much complaint.  The staff was very good and the breakfast was decent.  We felt like it was a good value, so we were pleased.

We stayed in a family suite for 3 nights! The family suite is the way to go for the whole family.  2 queen beds, 1 queen sofa bed and bunk beds for the kids.  Staff was friendly for the most part...other than one woman in the breakfast room, who refused to give us water for our water bottle.  That problem was quickly corrected when brought to the attention of the reception desk.  Parking was a bit troublesome at times, however there was no charge for parking, so that was good.  I would have liked to have had a free shuttle option to Disneyland...they charged $5 per adult and $3 for kids.  It was cheaper for us to park at Disneyland!   We enjoyed our stay here.  The kids loved the pool and the bunk beds were a hit!!  Overall a nice experience at a good value.

Parking sucks but overall, we enjoyed our stay, just bring your own water bottle if you go for breakfast, one kid got mad at his mom for bringing him apple juice instead of water, lol. It gets pretty crowded in the breakfast room so come early or, like what we did, went to the breakfast room and took our food back to our room so we don't have to spend breakfast in a crowded room overflowing with other guests.
Manager Response: Hello there!  Thanks for the honest feedback regarding your visit.  I'm glad you took advantage of the HOT breakfast buffet being offered complimentary!  We also took care of the tight parking situation most Hotels experience in Anaheim-We have VALET parking!  We heard your concerns...and came up with an answer.  It's woking out great!  Hope you come back and enjoy the Hotel!  We are doing some great upgrades!   Happy Holdiays!   Shawn

Summary Heading: Very good hotel at a great value
Summary: Very nice hotel. The family suite is excellent for your whole crew.  Very short walk to Disneyland.  One that the kids can do as well.  Does come with breakfast, although we didn't eat the breakfast.  Very close and convenient to many places and attractions.

Would never stay at this hotel. Horrible food, not close to disneyland, rooms smelled gross, and the plugs did not hold our electronic devices. I would have rather slept on the floor than the hard beds we experienced.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your feedback about the rooms...Our guests getting their moneys worth when they travel here and really getting to enjoy our spacious rooms when they visit us is the most Important thing!   While it an honor to be a part of the Disney Family and enjoy hosting guests from all around the world, I'm sure you can understand our rooms get alot of usage!   Having said that, I want you to know we are upgrading our rooms to provide you with more comfort, and more modern amenities such as, brand new lamps with more outlets, new bedding, brand new sofas sleepers (already here) and more!  My apologies your stay wasnt perfect but we will make it right!  I hope you reutrn to see the exciting upgrades!

Summary Heading: Serious Value for the Disneyland Visitor
Summary: We stayed two nights here and thought it was great. It is located close enough to Disney so you can walk. Your other options are to take the shuttle -- $5 per person round trip -- or walk to a nearby Disney lot ("Toy Story" lot) and ride the Disney shuttle. Plenty of choices. The hotel offers a really good breakfast buffet with lots of options including pre-made pancakes, sausage patties and eggs. There are plenty of carbs, too, but you have lots of options if you're going low-carb.  Our room was decent-sized and clean, with a refrigerator and clean bathroom. Because it caters to Disney guests and families with kids are coming in late, it is not the quietest of places as people walk by your door. There is a nice, clean pool and a whirlpool -- not a therapeutic spa, but a place
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your great response!  You really made the most of your trip and I loved that you found great value in what we're offering!  We want you to be comfortable and relax so you can make some great memoreis!  I'm looking forward to having you back to celebrate the MAgic of Disney with us when you can!  Let me know when you book because we LOVE to treat our repeat customers EXTRA special!   All my best!    Shawn

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for our recent trip to Disneyland. We have been three times previously and have always stayed closer to the park. This time we had three generations so we chose this hotel as they had family suites. The staff were the friendliest and always very courteous and helpful. We would definitely stay here again.

This is a place for families!  And it was swarming with them.    First the downside:   There is not enough parking,  hard to believe for a motel but true.  Cars are double parked everywhere.  Management knows this and they do their best to cope.  The complementary breakfast is plentiful but by the fourth day you realize that it is exactly the same every day, no variation, none!  And it is a mob scene...but it does prepare you for the rest of the day in Mouseland.  On the upside:  Our room was very clean and had all the required towels etc.  no need to beg for more at the front desk.  The second sleeping area had a bunk bed and hideaway bed...good for up to six people.  In all, not overly roomy but adequate.  And the price was very right for a family.  Tips:  the hotel is barely

Arrived at Best Western Raffles after a nightmare flight from Melbourne where my daughter and her family of husband and two children aged 2 yrs 6 mths and an 8 month old were sitting next to a vomiting family of young children. Consequently, we arrived at Best Western and within hours they too were struck down. I cannot begin to say how wonderful the staff at Best Western were. They did everything within their power to make them more comfortable, including changing sheets whenever needed! We bow to their wonderful staff and say a big, big Thankyou.  The hotel itself is lovely and clean, reasonably priced, has a nice pool and is close to Disneyland. We will certainly stay again, hopefully in better health.

Summary Heading: Grate place to stay the night
Summary: We stayed here for 4night in the kids suit and loved it. It had a queen bed and bunk beds and my kid just loved sleeping on top. the room was very clean and neat there was a microwave if you need it good for lift overs. Loved that the spa was open tell 11p.m. so we could use it after a long day of driving to San Diego for the zoo and Sea World. You can see the fireworks at Disneyland from here too if you are on the 3rd floor. The free breakfast is ok but you cant beat free. If you want there is a Denny's just around the corner. The staff is really nice and helpful they was able to get me checked in early. They have a small store with water and Disneyland stuff if you need to but a tee before you go there, but it closes a bit early at 9 so if coming home late like us get water or

Summary Heading: Good stay- but watch out for billing errors!
Summary: Hotel is clean and well located. Breakfast is pretty good, but come early to avoid the hordes. Staff is pleasant. You can see the Disney fireworks from the parking lot, which is fun. However, we stayed two nights and they billed our credit card for four. What a mess!  Still trying to straighten it out.  If you go,I suggest paying in cash.

Summary Heading: Great for families on a budget
Summary: This hotel is great for people with families as it provides free breakfast, internet, and a nice swimming pool and spa.  You can take a 5 minute walk to the Disneyland Toy Story parking lot and take a shuttle for free to Disneyland or the walk is about a mile. Ask the hotel staff for details.  They also have a convience store which I would advise to buy any autograph books and pens here rather than at Disney.

Our room was clean and comfortable and the staff was very pleasant and helpful.  If we needed anything, it was provided promptly.  Breakfast was delicious and plentiful with an outside eating bar.  The little pool and hot tub were great.  The front desk staff were wonderful, especially Eric, Cruz, and the lady on duty on Sept. 21 in the morning.  They took care of every whim.  The computer is located right in the lobby and it worked great!  The location is perfect for Disneyland as the shuttle is right outside the door.  Restaurants are very close.  A Denny's is just down the street.  Last but certainly not least, the room rates are very reasonable.  We would definitely stay there again.

Summary Heading: Great Place and upgrades are ongoing.
Summary: Great Staff and Breakfast.  Room was comfortable and with reduced price reasonable.  The property has been upgraded since our last visit and is much better. I expecially would like to recommend Cruz at the desk...she was fantistic.  Also Shawn Ross, the Regional Sales Manager, is exceptional in taking care of any problems that happen.

The hotel was very clean, the staff was helpful. the breakfast was really good although I think they were overwhelmed with the amount of people as they did run out of things, but refilled as fast as they could. Loved the idea of the being able to catch the bus to Disneyland out front. Will definately stay there again and would recommend to friends and family.

Summary Heading: Great for a family on a budget visiting Disneyland
Summary: We were visiting Disneyland with our two teenage children from New Zealand. The room was ideal with one big double and two bunks in another room. It was in walking distance to Disney and had a nice little pool. The air con was very loud and the toilet small but we only used the room for sleeping. However we were disappointed with breakfast. Everything served on paper plates and processed. Very high carb or covered in fats!!

After reading all the bad reviews toward this hotel I rather see it with my own eye.  The exprerience my family and myself was great and I would stay here again.  My kids were happy to know the pool was available from 8 am to 11pm specially in a hot weather.Breakfast was good and if anything was needed the personal would get it for you as soon as possible.

Breakfast was just okay, yet very convenient and will save you money.   Parking is horrible all the spots are tiny and it gets packed so be prepared to get dings on your doors. Be prepared to pay a hefty resort fee for.......nothing!   The room smelled funky. Don't let your kids walk on the carpet without shoes or else expect to throw out the socks after removing, within 5 minutes the soles will be black. Gross!!!!   If you are a light sleeper you will not be able to sleep because you will hear every single step, door, everything through the paper thin walls.  Front desk person that night was not in the best mood, she seemed so unhappy to see us.

The Best Place Near Disney, Friendly Staff & Best In General... We Give It AAAAAAA+++++++Want The Good Place To Rest THis Is Were You Go Also Keep In Mind Disney Is Only 5BLocks Away Also Shopping Also Near By Outlet Mall Only 5 Min Away. Food Is Also Min's Away Great Place To Have Fun With Family They Go The Extra Mile To Accomidate The Whole Family......  From My Family To Yours I Give It 6 Thumbs Up.......................................................

We were going to New Zealand and wanted a break at Disneyland for one day.  This hotel was perfect for the 6 of us as the family room was nice and big with a separate bedroom. A short walk to Disneyland or there was a shuttle available.  Breakfast was excellent with a good variety of hot and cold foods.  Staff were excellent and very friendly.  I would certainly recommend this hotel for a long or short stay.

Stayed here last September for a visit to Disneyland- And they were wrapping up painting the parking lot. We got a great, clean room with more than enough room for the two of us. The staff were more than helpful- we had a bit of laundry done, and that was handled well as well. We've rebooked it for an upcoming return trip, we liked it so much!
Manager Response: Thanks so much for coming back and making this your "home away from home" while visiting Disneyland!  I'm so glad you were able to see and enjoy all of the changes being made here and I'm excited for you to see the other improvements we have in store for you!   Thank you for taking the time to send us a message, we love it!   Lookig forward to seeing you again!  Shawn

Summary Heading: Finally something designed for families with older teens
Summary: this type of room was perfect for a family that has a young adult son and teen daughter, and a mom. Great accommodations!!!! shuttle to Disney right in the area. This was worth the price for the amount of room and location. breakfast was good and plentiful. hot coffee , tea and hot cocoa available too.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your feedack regarding your recent visit!   I'm so thrilled you had a chance to experience the Suites and find the value in it for families!  I'm also excited to tell you over $1 million dollars is going to making the inside of the rooms more modern, with fresh decor and furnishings!  I look forward to you coming back to experience all of our upgrades and changes. Our room types allow the families to be together in a large Suite and you have enough space for everyone to relax and enjoy each other!  Cant wait to see you back again!   Your Disney Friend! Shawn

Summary: Hotel was clean and I enjoyed the accomodations.  I had read previous bad reviews, but I had a pleasant experience.  I travel frequently for business, so my expecations of the accomodations matches the price.  I believe this motel has great value for the price.  If you want a five-star breakfast, go stay at a five-star hotel or plan on eating breakfast someplace else.  The limited parking was not a problem, the motel compensated by treating the lack of parking spaces with a valet.

The hotel is small and comforting.  Has a nice pool to relax in, and the rooms feel like your normal Best Western hotel room.  The breakfast is a little more than what I was expecting.  In addition to the muffins and donuts, you'll also find pancakes, sausage, eggs and waffles.  The staff are nice and are willing to help.  Now for the not so good.  The wireless internet was horrible in our 3rd floor bedroom.  I finally gave up.  Not much parking, so get there early so you can park your own car.  If you have young kids, and plan to walk to Disneyland, bring a stroller or don't walk.  It's a long hike to the park, and my little guys were physically exhausted, as I was too.  Now Disney does have a parking lot right next door that they bus to.  But the busses are only supposed to be

Summary Heading: BEST WESTERN PLUS Raffles Inn & Suites
Summary: This was a great place to stay. We we got one of the suites, which fit our whole family comfortably. The pull-out bed was a little uncomfortable, but they always are. The hotel was very clean, staff was great.  The continental breakfast was amazing! They had cereal, yogurt, pancakes, waffles, donuts, milk, juice, sausage, eggs, muffins, and the list goes on.  Best continental breakfast that I have had for free at a hotel.  What a great touch! Parking was a little crunched, and they had to valet cars behind us a couple of times, but they moved them quickly.

We had no problem our stay here.  I read some of the reviews on here after booking and I was considering picking another hotel.  I am glad I didn't.  We stayed in room 136.  The room had bunk beds and a a pullout.   The customer service was excellent.  The front desk staff (Eric,Gary,Maggie & Karla) could not be more helpful.    Luis is one of maintenance workers who will go out of his way to ensure you have a great trip.    The location is a good 15 minute walk to Disney and a 10 minute car drive to watch a Angels or Ducks game.

We arrived at the hotel at 10am, way before check-in but leaving the car there and making our way to Disneyland for the day was no problem,  The staff were extremely helpful and polite.  The shuttle bus cost $4 per person and ran from just outside the hotel. It was a 5 minute journey and the last bus back was at midnight.
