(Be aware that the bus back takes a rather circuitous route)       Our room was clean and comfortable.The breakfast room was a little overcrowded with some guests sitting outside on the staircase but there was a variety of food and beverages available and to be honest people were just stocking up and preparing for a day of Disney fun. There is a swimming pool at the hotel but it is rather small and I didn't see anyone use it.

This hotel was very clean, friendly staff, accomodating. The breakfast service always had plenty of food, hot and we found it never ran out. The ART/shuttle system was our main complaint. Considering the hotel charges a fee with your room for this shuttle service, it rarely ran on time, we were given miss information about start time (ie was told it would start running at 6:20am for early/Magic morning to Disney parks, when in reality it finally arrived at 7:10am). The hotel did sell the shuttle tickets, however only single day vs a 3 day pass. you can go next door to another hotel and use the kiosk but also found that to be an inconvience especially as this hotel was only 1 of 4 stops on that particular route. We did finally walk one day due to the shuttle service, it is a long

We like this hotel because they have bunkbeds which work great for our kids.  They have muliple room configurations to match your family's needs.  The breakfast is very addiquate with enough varity that most people can find something to eat.  If you are going to Disneyland this Hotel is only a 5-10 minute walk into the Toy Story parking lot where you can take the free Disneyland shuttle into Disneyland.  No waiting for the right bus to show up.

I booked this hotel to stay a couple of nights and surprise my oldest child with a day at Disneyland. I was wanting something close but reasonable, nice, and clean. I have to admit I was very skeptical of this property. We arrived about 8pm, greeted with a warm smile and very helpful gentleman at the front desk. He was very helpful with questions we had. We got into our room and I was amazed at how clean, and nice it was. The shower and water pressure was the best I have ever had in a hotel. It was walking distance to Disneyland.  We also need some toiletries the next day, it was very nice to have a little gift shop right downstairs. Very reasonable to on their prices.  We had breakfast one morning we stayed it was good enough to get us started.  The morning we checked out we

this hotel was walking distance fromn disneyland, downtown disney and local inexpensive food chains(tacobell, carl jrs, subway)great for families, not to mentioned you get free breakfast at this hotel!!!

Stayed here for 7 nights with 2 teens in town for VidCon. The 1 BR suite was large, clean and comfy. Breakfast was surprisingly well done for a hotel, with waffles, pancakes, sausage patties, cereal, fresh fruit, yogurt, juices, coffee, tea and cocoa. The girls ate here everyday even though Denny's was 1/2 block away. Big $$ saver!! Quick walk to the convention center. Also even though I am an annual Disney passholder and get free parking, we walked to the Disney lot 1/2 block away and took the shuttle to the park from there. It was too close to bother driving!! Do not pay to take the hotel shuttle when you can hop on the parking lot bus. Great trip, great hotel, great location, courteous staff- will be staying there again!!!

This hotel has been criticized for breakfast crowding, parking, and cleanliness. I experienced NONE of these problems during 4 days in August, 2013. The valet managed the parking lot. The room was clean. The breakfast suite was only crowded during the last half hour. What do you expect? If you come to breakfast just before it closes, expect it to be croweded. This hotel provides good value for money.

Stayed here for two nights while visiting Disneyland with family of 5 including two teenagers.  The place is excellently located for the theme parks, from which is it is only a few minutes drive.  The staff are friendly and helpful and the pool area is pleasant.  The breakfast was also excellent considering the price paid.  The only snags were firstly the parking, with there not being enough parking spaces for the number of rooms and secondly the room was not the most cheerful we stayed in as part of the trip, this must have been the same one the reviewer below stayed in as it was next to the laundrette also.  Having said that the room was perfectly comfortable and had everything the description promised and the laundry room did not operate at night so we were able to sleep OK.

Summary Heading: Think twice before booking this one!!!
Summary: Kids suite is freezing while master bedroom is boiling hot.  Breakfast buffet is nasty food is like rubber.  Limited to no parking.  Filthy, foamy and slimy is how I would describe the Hot Tub and Pool area.  Rooms are dated and way to cramped.  Save yourself the headache and go somewhere else because the staff could care less.  It was so bad we rented another hotel room somewhere else just to get a good nights rest.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your honest feedback about your recent visit to our property.     I was so saddened to hear you didn’t have a great stay as we pride ourselves on being a great value for our guests visiting the Theme Park with friends and family or in town for a Convention/Sporting Event.    I know we are one of the favorite Hotels in the Resort area due to the variety of room types we offer to families, our affordable prices, and our great service!   I look forward to having you back here one day and I'm also excited to tell you even during this buisy summer season, we have completed the Exterior upgrades to the Hotel so we maintain our fresh, modern look.  We are always working on improving the Hotel with the latest decor and furnishings and I hope you come back to see the transformation of the guest rooms.  We are also proud to be part of a Hotel Brand that offers a complimentary HOT breakfast buffet to all guests and I hope you were able to try all the different options on the menu to really enjoy it.   We are in the completing stages of our 2 million dollar renovation. While there’s never a good time to do improvements, it’s one of our top priorities along with unmatched customer service.  We understand things will happen from time to time  however, our main goal is to make it right if a guest is not thrilled with their visit.  Look forward to seeing you again~

Summary: I had reserved two family suites and in one room the sofa bed was broken so the staff went out of their way and they had a 2 queen bed already reserved for not having the sofa bed in the suite. The rooms and breakfast was great and we would definitely stay here again.

Office Staff very nice and professional.  Room was nice and clean, no frills but we are only there to sleep.  We travelled to Disneyland with Adult Children and I love the separate rooms for privacy.  The breakfast was adequate.  A great value.

Our check in/check out was incorrect, the rooms had a stagnant water smell, out clothes had the same smell after being in the pool and hot tub. Would not stay there again. On a positive point, the hotel was very close to the bus line that took us to Disneyland and the offered free stays due to our mishaps. I think before they put us in these rooms, they should have checked it better since the knew they had plumbing issues. It could have been a great stay otherwise.

Summary Heading: Bring your earplugs or don't stay here.
Summary: Just got back from our stay in the "kids suite" at this hotel. Beware when making your reservation that this place has 3-4 different types of suites....be sure you're getting the one you really need. Based on the online description I was expecting 2 queen beds, plus a bunk bed and fold out couch. However, upon arrival they explained that was the "family suite" and my reservation was for a "kids suite" which is a bunk bed, sofa, and 1 queen. The sofa bed was the most uncomfortable pull-out sofa bed possible. Felt like the springs and bars under the mattress were going to come through the sheets at any moment. Just miserable.   This place is really a motel...not what I'd call a hotel. Outdoor corridors and in-the-wall/window A/C units. When we got to our room it felt like at least

This hotel is exactly what they say they are... A Best Western near the Disneyland Resort.  We wanted a family suite, but could not get one.  We were able to make due with the standard 2 queen room - although it started to get a bit crowded toward the end of our stay (5 people + luggage + Mickey SOUVENIRS)...  We appreciated the breakfast the hotel provides daily, however, the room that they provide it in is CRAMPED and rather warm... we ate there the first day and after that we fixed plates and took them to our room every other morning. The pool is small, but it works... I mean my kids totally enjoyed it.  They really liked the temp of the water :) The staff was helpful and courteous.  The desk clerk explained to us how to utilize Disney transportation.  The valet always

Summary Heading: I wasn't going to review, but repeated bad customer service forced me to
Summary: We stayed in a "Family Suite". Got there, room was hot (90+). After repeated calls & eventually yelling at Front Desk (which I never do), it took 4+ hours to fix the a/c. Next day, we return from Disneyland and housekeeping has turned a/c off - room is hot again (90+). Next day, we return from Disneyland and housekeeping turned a/c off - room is hot again (90+). Both nights it takes until midnight to cool the room down. I tell the front desk when I check out, and they act like I am some complaining person - and say they are taking $10-20 off of my $600+ bill. Really?? I have stayed in hundreds of hotels over the years, and have basically never complained. It is not my personality to complain. Also, in the "Family Suite", the couch in the kids room blocks the door. The kids room

The service was good and the room was clean, but this was definitely not one of our favorite places we've stayed in.  The pool was tiny, hotel was noisy morning and night, small room and bathroom for a family of 6.  We moved to another hotel which was much nicer, larger, and had a beautiful pool for pretty much the same price, although it did not include breakfast, it was still very worth it!!

We stayed in the family suite with our four children.  It was awesome!  The room was very spacious and clean - a "kid room" with a pull out couch and bunk beds were great.  The 2 queen beds were very comfortable.  There were 2 full bathrooms and 4 sinks - great for getting a large family ready for Disney.  We stayed on the 2nd floor and were able to see the Disney fireworks from the outside hallway/balcony our first night.  We also used the pool which was fine.  The breakfast room was very nice - great hot breakfast which was perfect before hitting Disneyland.  It was super busy but they kept up nicely.  The walk to Disney was about 20 minutes with our kids age 3-12 (we walked both ways).  I would definately recommend this hotel for families!  It was much nicer than I

Summary Heading: Spiders in our room every day of our stay.
Summary: On arrival the hotel looked good until we got to our room 303 and 304. We had spiders in the rooms ranging In size the first night I removed them and advised the front desk. Every night for the next 3 nights we would return from the parks to more issues. There were webs in the ceilings if you looked you would find them. We checked out early after 4 nights as the hotel staff could not solve the problem moved to a different hotel. The kids with us did not sleep will worrying about the insects in our rooms. I would not recommend this hotel due to lack of pest control and accountability for the facility.

Summary Heading: Good Rooms for families and Good Breakfast
Summary: We did not intend staying at this motel while on our Disneyland vacation. We had reservations at another Best Western that was closer walk to Disneyland but the day of arrival their Water heater broke so they sent us to Raffles Inn. We are happy we stayed here except they put us in a room next to their industrial laundry / maids room and directly in front of the stairs. When people walked down the stairs they could see directly into the room if we did not keep the curtains closed and shroud ourselves in darkness. BUT since we arrived at 1am and had not had reservations to this motel we could understand they gave us what they had. That was the ONLY bad thing about this place... except maybe the parking. Parking is a bit tight if you do not get their early, however the front desk

Dirty room on arrival, floors hadn't been mopped for however long...noise all night until the early hours, pool is a disgrace, lack of parking...just a pox 60's hotel that should be demolished! Oh and forget the breakfast it's disgusting...stay over the road at the Doubletree for a little more would be my recommendation!
Manager Response: Thanks so mcuh for your honest feedback about your recent visit.  I'm so sorry your stay was less than perfect because that's exactly what we want you to have. While this Hotel is known for it's spacious Suites, and great rates, we know parking is tight at most Hotels in the Resort and we wanted to address it and fix that.  Guess what, we did!  We now have Valet parking for ALL guests!  As soon as you step out of your vehicle, you dont have to worry about parking anymore, the professionals will do it!  You can just enjoy your visit.  I hope you return to try our complimentary "upgraded" hot breakfast buffet and see all the new furnishings/paint we are doing to each room.  We are proud to be part of the Disney family and you can count on us always changing and improving our Hotel so every guest that stays here has great rooms, great memories, and team who strives to make it right when you call on us.  Contact me directly next time you're visiting the Happiest Place on Earth!  I would love to help with your new reservation!  All my best!  Shawn Ross-Director of Sales and Guest Relations

Summary: This isn't a fancy place but it was a great price and all that you need when you basically will just be sleeping here.  We especially enjoyed the two rooms in one.  The room we had had two beds and a bathroom.  You open the door near the tv and there's another room with bunk beds and a sofa bed along with another full bath.  The nice thing is that there was just one entrance, so you didn't have to worry about kids getting out.  The complimentary breakfast had several options and was a nice, quick way to fuel up before hitting the parks.  The location isn't bad.  You always have the option of jumping on A.R.T, the transit system.  For just a couple bucks, you can ride back and forth to the parks.  There are ART stations near most of the hotels, so it's easy to hop on.  And it

I didnt like the way the AC system works...one room cold the other hot. Breakfast can be better and more sitting would be nice. Great Fireworks View!!!!!!!! Very Close to Diney parks we went walking and return in a taxi.

We stayed here one night in order to be up early the next day to enter Disney and not have to fight traffic. The hotel told us we could check in after 3 pm so we arrived about 3. Then they said because we had a 2-room suite check in wasn't until 4:30 pm. We were not happy. However, they did give us a pool pass and there was a bathroom in the pool area so we could change. This pacified our grandchildren (1, 3, 5) for about an hour. Fortunately after that the room was ready. Having the two rooms with queen beds & the sleep sofa worked well with smaller children. The room was clean but dated. Still the location close to Disney and the 2-room suite made it acceptable for our purposes. The breakfast included was full not continental and was also acceptable in quality.

Summary Heading: Great Kids Suite for Disney Stay!
Summary: We just spent 3 days at this hotel near Disney. I chose it because of location, price, free breakfast and kids suite. It was a 5-10 walk to the Toy Story parking lot which takes you to the parks for free or you can catch a bus outside for $3 a person each way...no thanks. Plus, you are already paying for parking at the hotel which I didn't think was incurred until checking out. Resort fee includes parking at $11 a day. So, I didn't feel bad taking the shuttle at Toy Story. The rooms were nice, quiet and the breakfast was very good, included eggs, sausage, pancakes, waffles, cereals, yogurts, pastries, coffee, juice, etc. Overall, happy with my stay here. Kids bunk room was great, also had an extra sofa bed if needed. There is a gift ship on property which I highly recommend

This hotel may not be very fancy but it is extremely clean and the staff are absolutely amazing. The front desk helped us out with everything we needed and went over and above for us. The cleaning staff was beyond exceptional, our room was made to be spotless everyday with lots of fresh towels. Our experience here was far more than we expected, only thing I wished there could have been is more healthy options for breakfast.

We loved that there were two bathrooms and that there was enough room for our party of 7.  The kids got their own TV.  The room seemed clean enough.  We liked the breakfast because you could make your own sausage Mc Muffins.  There was plenty to eat.    The down sides were that the parking was HORRIBLE.  There were super skinny spots for a place that had mostly SUV's and vans.  Worse yet, there were not enough spots for all of the hotel guests, so some people had to block others or park in a red zone.  The pool was dirty.  There was lots of hair and a few bits of garbage floating on the surface of the pool.  There was a lady chain smoking near the pool.  And the final challenge for this place was that there is no complimentary Disney shuttle.

May family stayed at this hotel from 5/26/2013 to 5/29/2013 for our son's 5th birthday trip, a surprise trip to Disneyland. I made this reservation with them in January 2013 asking for two specific things, one was to be on the side of the hotel where we can watch the fireworks from Disney and to be on the third floor. When we got there, we were given the third floor but apparently all of the rooms facing Disney were taken. Even though I called them two days before our scheduled arrival date wherein they confirmed that we would have the room that we requested. The rooms were layed out kinda of strange. We had a kid suit but the bathroom area was on the side of the door where the kid room was.  So every time we had to use the bathroom, we had to go into the kids room. Our son

The hotel is about a 20 minute walk to the main entrance of Disneyland but we got such a great deal on our romm that we opted to stay here rather than moving closer to the Disneyland entrance. We had 6 people in a family suite (accommodtaes up to 8). Hotel staff were very pleasant & helpful. Breakfast had a nice variety of hot & cold selections.

Summary Heading: Worst hotel I have ever been to
Summary: We booked this hotel through a friend. We were running out of time before leaving and asked him to search for us a suitable one near Disney..well I regretted that the minute we stepped in. For me it is rather a motel than a regular hotel. The clerk upgraded us to a bigger room, which I was grateful cause I have no idea what a regular room is. There is no window in the room and it becomes very stuffy and unbearable so we had to open the door at times. The suction fan toilet is very noisy .One night i woke up on people running and walking in the floor above us that the ceiling was creaking very loudly.The  Breakfast is very mediocre , ready made omelet discs in hot dishes :(. Well , I regretted staying in anheim the whole time and specifically in this hotel.

After arriving we were told that they don't hold rooms, even with a reservation. Too many people don't show up.  I don't think it is worth the chance in the future. When I make a reservation I expect it to stick, don't tell me it is only good if someone else doesn't get there first.

My wife, 21 year old daughter and I stayed here from May 5th - May 8th during our trip to Disneyland. This is a nice place to stay. The place seems to have been kept up to date if not been updated. It is not a luxurious place, but for the money that it costs, it is worth it!!! It also is very close to Disneyland. The shuttle service (A.R.T.) stop is right outside the hotel. I would stay here again if I travel to Anaheim again.

Overall a good stay with a couple of exceptions.  Breakfast room was way overcrowded with the Disney crowd all wanting breakfast at the same time.  We also were wakened at 1:30 a.m. to move our car which was not parked fully into a double parking spot ... we were not told the rules when checking in and no signage explaining how it worked and we were worried about being blocked in when we wanted to leave in the morning ... parking was free, so I guess you get what you pay for ...

We booked two rooms for our family's vacation to Disneyland. It was awful.  there were bugs in the bathroom and the walls were so thin you could hear what the people in the next room were saying. The beds were very uncomfortable and you could hear children running up and down the stairs for most of the evening. We have a daughter with Cerebral Palsy and we tried to check in early as she needed a nap after the long plane ride but they were firm on the 3pm check in. Thanks a lot for choosing rules over compassion guys!!! Never  to return.

We absolutely Love this Hotel...The Rooms and Staff are Wonderful! The rooms were Beautiful...Clean...And Huge...It was like A Home away from Home! The Staff like Family...they remember your name and are very Helpful...Curtious and Extremely Friendly! Eric at the Front Desk...was Especially Helpful and Friendly...Extremely informative about the Hotel...and Near by Sites and Attractions! He is very Personable! We Rate this Hotel and the Staff...Especially Eric...A 10 1/2!!! Thank you for An Excellent...And Memorable Stay!

Our family had two suites for two nights for a week-end at Disneyland. I had a corner suite with two other adults that worked out perfectly for us!  The largest room of this suite had a king bed, mini-kitchen and table, and hide-a-bed. The second bedroom had a queen bed and its own sink area. The breakfast area had plenty of indoor and outdoor seating. The menu variety was very good -- waffles, pancakes, eggs, sausage, yogurt, fruit, breads and muffins. The outdoor pool and hot tub, plus a mini-general store, were nice amenities.

The hotel itself was great, good breakfast, great maintenance service.  We needed an iron & a fan & they were delivered within 10 minutes.  One set back......I booked this 5 day reservation in January.  Specifically at the BW Raffles as they have suites.  I booked a 2 bedroom suite with 2 baths.  I confirmed this the end of March and also the week before our arrival on 4/22.  When we got there, we were put in a room with 2 queens and a sofa bed.  I called the front desk and luckily they had the 2 br/2 ba suite I had wanted but charged me an additional 60.00 plus tax.  I felt that the BW should have honored my booking with a 2 br but they said the reservation was only a 1 br. S. Mitchell

Rooms are newly renovated. I love the wood floors instead of walking on icky carpet. Everything was comfortable and clean. Air conditioning was quiet and worked well. Two sinks in the room for two queen beds. "Gary" checked us in quickly and called to check on us once we were in our rooms. Check out was quick too. We even forgot our daughters blanket! I called and they began checking for it. When I arrived "Eric" was wonderful and called one of the service members to check again. "Yolanda" showed up a few minutes later with it. They saved us from our daughters tears that could have been shed. Breakfast was great too! We will be staying here again!

I stayed at this motel 4/16-4/21 due to my sister and her family booking a room here.  Overall this establishment is middle of the road, not horrible but not great.  I will say the front desk staff was very friendly, accomodating and helpful. (i had to make 3 seperate reservations due to certain days being sold out until the last minute and they were able to combine them and let me stay in the same room) Parking, as commented on in previous reviews, is challenging(we were able to park every night but had to utilize unmarked areas at the ends of marked spots made possible only due to small car size).   The rooms are clean and beds are fairly comfortable, bathroom size was adequate,  the maid service was excellent.  Sleep would be a challenge if you are a sensitive sleeper.  Foot

My husband and I stayed here on our last trip to Disneyland.  The hotel was fairly close to Disneyland, about a 20 minute walk to the front gates.  However, after a full day of walking, that seemed like a very long way.  We usually walked to the Disney parking lot and took the free shuttle from there, that only took about 5 minutes.  The room was clean and spacious, and the staff was always friendly.  The breakfast was really good, lots of food including waffles or pancakes.  The only downside were the crowds in the morning.  One morning we just grabbed food when we got to the park, it wasn't worth fighting through the line for the free breakfast.     Overall, the rooms were clean and nice, the breakfast was good, and the staff was friendly.  For what I was able to book this

We stayed here for our trip to Disneyland. The room was very clean , but it was not very comfortable! The foldout couch was very uncomfortable, but I understand that they usually are, the other beds were just ok. The worst thing was that the room temp was very hard to control, too hot and then too cold, we are not usually that picky but it was even waking up our exhausted kids! We were tired from walking around the park all day and the last thing we wanted to deal with was trying to fix the temp ALL NIGHT LONG! The breakfast was very good, but also very crowded, maybe go earlier to miss the crowd!

Groups of teenagers stayed there and apparently were unsupervised. They ran up and down the halls screaming and cussing until about 2am. Then, at about 6am started all over again. The front office offered no help. After four days of little sleep I decided it would be worth it to pay more for a quiet hotel. This is a MOTEL, not a hotel. Parking is a disaster. We took a taxi at night so we would not lose our parking space. People double parked and blocked you in.  All in all it was a terrible experience and highly do not suggest you stay here, even if the prices entice you.

My family and I came all the way from Australia. The first place that we visited was the Best Western Plus Raffles Inn and Suites. It was in walking distance of family restaurants and free shuttle buses to Disney Land. All rooms were included with a delicious continental breakfast which included, fruit, toast, waffles, pancakes and make your own Mc muffins. There were very comfortable rooms and the rooms were automatically cleaned and done up again every morning! The rooms had there own air conditioners which you could adjust to the right temperature. More than adequate while out all day sightseeing and Disney Land. I would recommend this to any families with young children that are out all day and just come home for dinner, a sleep and a delicious breakfast.

Front desk was very friendly and helpful.  breakfast was delicious and plentiful!  eggs and sausage too.  had 4 of us in our party.  room was spacious with fridge and micro.  the only negative was that housekeeping kept knocking on our door to clean the room at 8 am and then 8:15 and we were all still sleeping.  otherwise, great place to stay.

I would like to say the staff is awesome here but parking was horrible . You loose the desire to want to drive around and explore because you may not have a space.  Cars were triple parked and the spaces ate so tight my new car got a ton of dings.  Also the rooms are outdated, tvs are raggedy and the beds need to be replaced along with the sleeper sofa.  The only plus was an awesome cleaning staff who made sure your room was stocked and supplied extra blankets and pillows. We had an awesome view of Disney fireworks every night and pool was clean. I must say breakfast was also decent and very wide variety of foods. The rates are very good for the area but they could ease up on charging the extra resort fee to compensate the terrible parking situation!

This hotel was ok, for sleeping. Some of the rooms have been upgraded that were really nice. My room was not the carpet felt wet and dirty, I had to call for towels, toilet paper, and extra blankets. I hope they would get all the rooms upgraded. The breakfast was good with alot to go around.

we got the 2 queen bed suite with the bunk beds and pull out queen size coach in the other room. GREAT Value! 2 full bathrooms for my large family helped us to save time and relieve stress. Beds were ok comfy. I give the room an A+. Hotel not too far from Disney and the free parking was nice. Very good breakfast! A great way to start our day to Disney on full stomach's. thanks soo much Best Western for taking care of us at such a great price. I will definitely be returning and telling my friends!

So nice to find a hotel that welcomes my large family in one room!!!!  We stay here every trip now.  It is clean.  The parking isn't a problem even when busy they have a workable system.  I only have the same two negatives  the coffee is awful!!!! If how it tastes matters to you bring your own and make it in room.  The other challenge is the bus loads of cheerleaders etc that are allowed to run around the hotel unsupervised by chaperones.  Maybe something can be said to these large groups of kids that come in about hotel manners?  Otherwise great stay again!

Towels were not replaced, dirty linen was left on the floor, the last day a bottle of cleaning solution and a dirty rag was left in front of the TV.  Soap and toilets were not supplied until the last day.

Summary Heading: The best way for the best price
Summary: This hotel is really good for many reasons. The king room we took was clean and spacious. It is well situated as it is 3 minutes away from Disneyland. Besides, there are a Target store, restaurants and the 5 freeway close to the hotel. The continental breakfast - included in the price- is very good. I will definitely recommend this hotel

We enjoyed our 5 nights in Anaheim.  We arrived late the first night, check in process was quick.  Our room was on top floor.  Room had everything we needed.  Fridge kept our drinks nice and cold.  A first for us was that we were always given 4 bath towels.  It's annoying to have to request right amount of towels when we are checking in with a family of four, but this time we always had plenty of towels.  Breakfast was good, we always managed to get a seat, but others not so lucky.  I'd stay here again.

This hotel was a great place for families.  The breakfast was perfect, and the staff was great.  Everything we needed was taken care of.  The bed was very comfortable and clean. The pool was maintained well.  We felt safe and secure and it made our trip wonderful!  It was just the place to relax after a huge day at the park.

Summary Heading: Good price, across Harbor from Convention Center
Summary: So I try to be thrifty when I can.  On a recent convention trip I chose the Best Western based in cost, rather than the Hilton, Marriott, or Sheraton.  I will admit that it had been a while since I stayed at an external access door establishment. But it was fairly pleasant.    Room turned out to be a 2 room suite, not sure if I was lucky or this is normal.  The normal part was then also quite large, good are with couch, table, work table, etc.    Bathroom was adequate, not too large or too small.  Shower and toilet was in separately closed are, nice if more than one in the room.    They had buffet got breakfast, but not that great.   Think of McDonalds on a buffet, suffix ER but nothing worth writing home about.  It was nicer than traditional Cont breakfast though  So worth a

Hotel was great and in a great location and would definitely go back! Staff was friendly and helpful. Also the price of the stay was very reasonable compared to other hotels in the area! I would definitely recommend anyone to go their.

Wow, just got back and had a great time at this hotel. Had the bunk bed suite and there was so much room, it was fantastic.  The staff was always so friendly an accommodating, the breakfast was a GREAT surprise. Good food and great value here folks.      Pool, Hot Tub, designated ONLY smoking area.  The walk to Disneyland is three long blocks, about 20 minute casual walk. We walked it in 10-15 every day great exercise and chance to chat on the way and home.     I can not think of any draw backs either.  There was always hot coffee and fruit in the lobby to.     If you can walk, want a great value and a great big room for a family (bunk beds, pull out sofa and large Queen), clean and inviting try this. I joined Best Western Rewards and now I am receiving points too. Enjoy your

Front desk staff was not friendly at all I didn't feel welcome through my stay. Eric at the front desk seemed like he didnt want to be there and gave me the wrong informations regarding my room rate discount. The front desk manager was very rude and sassy. I ended up staying at another best western down the street and had a great time as the staff was very very friendly and welcoming. I would neve stay at this best western location as I felt un welcomed.

I love this hotel!i have stayed many times! We are premium annual pass holders and we always try to stay here, clean ,only like 10 minute walk to Disneyland ,the breakfast is also good will be back for spring break

Clean, comfortable rooms and beds. Very helpful staff. Great free breakfast options. The hotel is next to an official Disney parking lot were you can catch the free shuttle. If you desire to walk to Disneyland from the hotel, it's less than a mile from the Disney entrance. We asked about keeping our car in the hotel parking lot after we checked out of the hotel so that we can enjoy our last day at Disneyland; the hotel staff said it was just fine to leave our car in their parking lot for the day and into the evening. Great value for a hotel close to Disneyland.

The hotel is great, the rooms are average. The staff was very helpful. But when children go running down the halls on the different levels then the hotel shakes and everyone outside is so loud that sleep wasn't in our cards.

They were our Saviors after our bad hotel! Clean, helpful and friendly staff, COMFY beds, roomy rooms, amazing breakfast options, if you need something front desk is a call away and they bring it to you in a timely manner, on site was so helpful! ALL AROUND AWESOME AND GREAT PRICE!

We were very satisfied with this hotel for our Disneyland trip.  This hotel is 1.2 miles from the maingate.  Instead of walking to Disney, you are more than welcome to hop on a shuttle bus at the Toy Story Parking Lot.  It is a short walk from the hotel; just follow the signs to the shuttle bus. The beds were comfortable.  Plenty of hot water and water pressure was great.  The breakfast was mediocre, but filling.  They have danishes, donuts, cereal, yogurt, milk, orange juice, apple juice, coffee, english muffins, sausage, and eggs.  On alternate days, there is make yourself pancakes or waffles.  Staff was friendly.  Only problem we experienced was not enough towels; staff only replaced enough towles for two people instead of four on our second day.  Would highly recommend and

We just returned home from spending 5 nights there. I thought the price was very good for a suite for 6 people. I thought the staff was excellent and were very pleasant and willing to help. My wife had a medical problem while we were there and they they were able to give us information on who to call to get her help. It was in a very good location and the ART bus stopped right in front of the Inn.

Usually stayed at the Fairfield Inn in Anaheim, but will stay at the Best Western from now on, as the suites were great for the family!    Sleeping arrangements are much better for families.  courteous staff.

We stayed in the Family Suite. The price was terrific. The Family Suite we stayed in had a main room with 2 queen beds, bathroom, TV, small fridge, and microwave. It had a smaller room separated by a door that had its own bathroom, bunk beds, fold out couch, and TV.  We had 3 adults, and 2 kids. There was enough room for everyone, although in the 2nd room the fold out couch took up almost the entire area when we pulled it out. Other than that, the room was clean and comfortable.  We got there before check-in but they let us park and go to the parks for the day. There is a shuttle available for a fee to the parks, or you can walk but its a good 25 minute walk.  Breakfast was very nice for the price; cereal, yogurt, juice, coffee, pastries, toast, sausage, eggs and either pancakes

The service begin at check in and it people were so nice.  I asked if they could try and get us a room by my daugher and they said sure.  My room was 2 doors down from her.  The ktichen girls were amazing.  They worked so hard.  It was very crowded and they never stopped cleaning and making sure everything was full.  My 5 year old grandson was sharing with me that they were out of chocoloate donates.  Within 2 minutes one of the workers brought over a new box of donuts with 3 chocolate donuts and let him pick one.  Check out was just as pleasant.  I travel alot and this was one of the best experiences I have ever had.  Thank you to you and your staff.  We took a card and we will be back.  My daughter felt the same way.

Great value for the price.  Rooms were clean and well equipped with a microwave and fridge though a bit noisy.  Really impressed with the front desk- we got in early and they were full- but they moved things around and got us in.  That made our day!    Close enough to Disneyland, wifi and free parking- and we appreciated  the hot tub and pool after a long day at the parks.  Breakfast was fantastic- we were pleasantly surprised by the great selection of hot and cold items.

Chanced into this place finding a deal from Priceline, and that ended up being the main negative - when the reservation from them didn't go through. Was more than made up for by the super friendly desk clerk. Super clean, nice décor, decent breakfast, just a little loud with the kids - what do you expect across the street from Disneyland?

Needs some updating. Lighting is very cold and florescenty. Room was clean, wood floors, large flat screen tv, microwave and fridge, coffee maker in bathroom. Bed was very comfy. Free breakfast. No prob with parking, they let us keep our car in the lot to go to Disney even though we didn't check in until 11pm AFTER going to Disneyland. Overall got a great deal on hotels.com and would stay here again.

Hotel is within walking distance to Disneyland but in anticipation of all the walking we were going to be doing at Disneyland we opted to take the ART bus that stops just outside the hotel-we decided on the $5.00(per adult) daily pass which allows for unlimited rides back and forth. We were pleasantly surprised to find we were booked into a mini suite---one main bedroom complete with a nice sofa, coffee table, microwave, refrigerator, flat screen tv and bathroom plus an adjacent bedroom also complete with flat screen tv and a privacy door. Our party consisted of myself, my daughter and my little 4 year old grandson so we really appreciated the privacy factor offered by this arrangement.       There is a great breakfast buffet in the morning --hot foods consisted of eggs, sausage

This motel was good value for the money.  Rooms were clean and adequate.  The bus stop to Disneyland is right out front.  The pool was nice and warm.  Since we spent most of our time in Disneyland playing, this accomodation suited us just fine.  A place to sleep, have a snack and a swim and breakfast in the mornings.  We stayed in the family suite with 4 children and it worked great.

A good place to stay.  Comfortable king sized bed but the pillows are small.  The room size was good, with fridge, desk.  It was a handicap room so some things were different.  We did not request a handicap room.  Coffee maker was in the bathroom and not much room for it.

I was very impressed with our stay at the Best Western Raffles. Before I even stayed at the hotel, I made phone calls to the hotels to see if we could switch our room. They were completely sold out 1 out of the three nights we were staying there but said they could move us and our belongings around. Once we got there Claudia was VERY accomidating on trying to get us all three nights in the same suite and she did! Jerry was I believe the manager and was so helpful. The breakfast was awesome hot and a huge variety. The rooms were also very clean and fresh. Would recommend this hotel!!!!

I was really worried after reading some of the reviews, but it fit our budget perfectly.  We had a group of 8, we got the family suite with 2 bathrooms for a great price.  We requested one of the rooms with the hardwood floors and were pleasantly surprised.  It was clean and well kept.  There were nice flat screen tvs, updated bathrooms, and the beds were comfortable.  The kids loved having their own room.  I didn't worry about my kids touching things or the room being grimy at all.  The free breakfast was great.  No, there weren't waffles every day but there was still plenty to make it worthwhile!! The room was ocassionally busy but we never had a problem finding seating.  The shuttle ride was such a breeze.  The pickup is right outside of the hotel.  It was never full (granted

Perfect location for the convention, just a short walk across the road and the Marriott car park and you are there. Close to Disney, great shopping and restaurants all within walking distance. Quiet, fabulous views of the mountains. Rooms are a good size, shower pressure good, gift shop has everything you could need and is very reasonable. Only issue was how the bed was made, they kept folding he sheets in half and not tucking in the bottom which would be OK for kids, was a bunk bed bed but it drove me nuts as I had to remake it every night, otherwise I froze when I role over and my feet would stick out. I will be returning when I bring the kids to Disney. Breakfast was ok,  if you don't want the whole American breakfast they supply toast and muffins.

This was like a normal stay at a hotel.  You do not have to pay for parking, but the charge you $10.95 for a resort fee.  This is funny.  With was no different than staying at a Motel 6 except for there was no carpet in the rooms, wood flooring.  So really parking is not free.

We arrived here after having this hotel booked for over four months. The room we were originally allocated was right next to the laundry, staircase and elevator. It was so unbelievably noisy that neither myself (who sleeps like the dead) or my partner got any sleep. If you are booking this hotel. Please ask for one away from the staircases or the laundry. YOU WILL NOT SLEEP.  However, I went to the front desk and asked to be moved into a quieter room. We were moved within the hour and into a much more comfortable, quiet room.   The hotel itself was clean, but was in desperate need of a refurbishment!   Overall, this hotel was decent for the price and location and would consider it again after the upgrade.

This had to be by far the noisiest motel I have ever stayed in.  You could hear a pin drop from the neighboring rooms.  The toilets and showers above us sounded like they were coming thru the floor.  These units were supposedly updated although I think that must have been in the 70's.  When we tried to check out the last day the desk wouldn't let us in because it was 5 minutes before 7am.  Our shuttle was there and we needed to go.  I wouldn't recommend this motel for future visitors.

Located within walking distance of Disneyland. Rooms are clean and quiet.Staff was ok, not as friendly as last time we were there. They serve a great variety of food for breakfast both hot and cold choices.

My husband and I stayed here for for nights for a quick getaway to Disneyland. At the time of booking it was one of the cheaper hotels in the area. We did not rent a car and walked to and from the parks everyday. The walk was not bad for us (two adults that travel lightly) but I imagine it would be a little far for small children, parents with strollers, etc. The hotel is right next to one of Disney's parking lots, so you can walk over there and take their shuttle. There is also an IHOP nearby for late night hunger fits!  Other than the location, I was not overly impressed with this property. Our room was large but out of date with very uncomfortable beds. Breakfast was convenient (and free) but a little bit below standard. The staff upon check in was rude and impatient. While

The room was very clean as was the whole property.  Staff was very nice.  Especially the maintenance guy - didn't catch his name.  He was friendly and helpful.  The breakfast selections were great too.  Only problem was the light above the sink didn't work very well and was very dim.

The only good thing about this hotel is the free breakfast.    When checking in, I wanted to pay cash but was told it would be easier on her if we just paid at check out.  That was fine until we saw that our room did not include a safe.  She still would not allow us to pay so we had to hide the money for our entire 4 day stay.  Terrible customer service.  While they claim that the rooms have been "newly renovated" with brand new carpeting or hardwood floors, our carpet was disgusting.  It was stained and our socks were black after walking on it.  Our room also smelled terrible the entire length of our stay.  There was no way that it had been renovated in the past ten years let alone recently!  Old curtains, bedding, decor, just awful.  Our bathroom was fairly large but the

We stayed over thanksgiving weekend for a family get away. My 83 year old Dad came down on Friday. He was late and I must have called the front desk 4 or more times to see if he arrived. The front desk was so helpful with getting my dad set up in our room and helped with the shuttle. They told me I was not bothering them and I was more than welcome to call to check on my dads arrival. I can't say enough wonderful things about their customer service. Breakfast was good with lots of healthy choices. Our room was very clean. Housekeeping does a great job. Parking and only 1 elevator are the only negatives for this best western. I would stay here again just for the customer service we received and CLEAN rooms. Thanks again to the staff for the help with my Dad.

We left an item in the room and checked out and headed to Disneyland. When we realized it was missing we called to see if we could pick it up on our way home. The man who answered was no help he said we could call in the morning to see if housekeeping had it and then pay to ship it home. They don't have anyone in housekeeping except in the morning? What if a guest needs extra towels or a child has an accident and fresh sheets are needed. Not to mention the fact that we were right there and now have the added expense of shipping. Plus they were not very apologetic about the lack of help they provided us with.

I read some rather lukewarm reviews about this motel and I booked our two rooms with a little trepidation.  However, I got a great holiday deal - 4 nights with two queens per room for less than $390 per room - including parking and breakfast - so I decided to do it.  The staff was extremely pleasant and helpful, the rooms were spacious and very clean and they welcomed my service dog without batting an eye.  They provided a very decent and free breakfast - not just cold cereals - oatmeal and pancakes and waffles till 9:30.  The rooms come with a refrigerator and microwave and decent free WIFI. There is a pool and hot tub available.  It is right on the ART line for a very convenient trip to Disney Land.  (Don't bother driving and parking at Disney Land - the bus is way more

Although the breakfast was ok and they did offer to accommodate  me and my daughter in a separate room for a low price after we realized the room wasn't fitted for all the people in the family, I would not stay here again. I didn't find it very clean. The floors were not clean everyday (wood floors) so there was a lot of dirt and you could see it in your socks. The bedding was the worst part. The quality of the sheets was very bad.   I had to sleep in a bunk bed and the top sheet wasn't  long enough or the maid  didn't know how to do the bed and left it too short and I could touch the cover with my feet. Closets were very small you couldn't put a suitcase inside so I had to use half if the bathroom and put it there. Some people can live with something like that and I can too but
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your honest feedback about your experience while staying at our property.  I hope you will return and enjoy all of our recent imrpovements to the Hotel.  We are thrilled to be completing a $1 million dollar renovation to this very speical Best Westenr property.  I'm sure you had a chance to enjoy the new Hot breakfast buffet with waffles, pancakes, eggs, yogurt and more!  I hope you also enjoyed the new flat screen TV's in the room and the frig and microwaves as well.  This Best Western is the only one to have 2 bedroom 2 bath Family Suites that sleep 8!  We want our guests traveling with the entire family to enjoy themselves and save money while they're here.  I hope you come back and see all we've done.  There's never a good time to renovate here in Anaheim as we're so busy, and there's times when dust and debree' during a period of transformation happens but cleanliness inside your rooms and the Exterior of our Hotel is our top priority!  I'm glad to say we are completed and ready to go!  I look forward to seeing you back and exceeding your expectations!  All my Best for a Magical Holdiay Season!

Summary: A little farther walk but worth it for the saving. We had a total of 17 and we stayed 5 day and 4 nights. The breakfast was great. The gal in there was quick to refill items and kept it nice & clean. The housekeepers were not as friendly. Every morning they were upset when they had to move their carts so we could pass with strollers. Glad that was the only interaction with them. Rooms were kept clean and stocked.

This is a budget hotel, so it's really not fair to compare it to times I've stayed at 4-star properties (as others seem to have done).    We needed a simple, clean, and inexpensive place close to Disneyland, and we got it.  The place was nice, clean, and more than spacious enough to accomodate our family.  Using Hotwire, we got an especially great rate.  Some have said the walls are thin at this property, and I agree (I would add the ceiling too).  In fairness, this has just as much to do with the consideration that other guests have for the people at the hotel, but it was noticeable.  The free breakfast was great.  We ate there both mornings before heading to Disneyland, and found plenty of options for keeping our tummies full until well after lunch.  Big savings from eating in

The room was clean and comfortable.  We had a family suite and the separation from the kids was great. The staff was friendly, efficient and helpful.  The location was convenient to the local attractions.  The breakfast had a good variety of items.

Our family spent A LOT of money (4 families) to take our children on a fun Disney vacation.  A very noisy child was put in the room above us, that ran and jumped off of every bed! I was un happy to say the least.

Too loud. Could hear runmning water from other rooms. Made reservations for two rooms about 1 month before visit. Added another room about 1 week before actual trip and got a better rate on the added room. When queried about difference hotel personel could not explain. Also did not honor requests about what floor and how close at least the early reservations were to each other (rooms).  I would not stay at this particular Best Western in the future.

We planned a family vacation to Disneyland and had 12 people stay in in 3 rooms.  I was not aware that is is a motor hotel when we booked.  My only complaint is that the rooms open into the parking lot and there are not good seals on the door, so it is very noisy!  We were in 317, so we didn't hear any street noise, but plenty from other guests.  Our rooms were very dated, but clean.  The pool are is very non-descript but we enjoyed it.  The swimming pool was one of the cleanest and warmest pools we have been in.  There seemed to be some issue with the hottub as it was only lukewarm for most of our stay, but was working well on the last night.  The staff was very accommodating.  We had juice down and the pool one morning but forgot glasses and the pool maintenance man ran next

From the moment we checked in to the moment we checked out (late), the service at this hotel was stellar. The housekeeping staff incorporated my daughter's various stuffed animals and blankets in the bed-making everyday and our room was cleaned impeccably. I think they were having more fun with our things than we were. Toiletries were arranged artistically on the counter and souvenirs were placed "just so".  The breakfast was a great way to precede our very full days at Disneyland. All food groups were incorporated and we very rarely had to eat before 1:00pm.  On our off days, the pool and hot tub came in handy. They were both very clean and the pool was even heated to an acceptable temperature.  Special mention for "Cruz", the front desk lady at check-out. Even though we made a

What a delightful stay!  The room was comfortable with a great layout.  We loved that they offered comfortable bunkbeds for our kids.  They loved it!  We have a large family and we greatly appreciate hotels that provide rooms that let us all stay together.  Three cheers!

Summary Heading: Great sized rooms and value for money
Summary: I was really impressed with this Best Western!  The two bedroom room we got, was a fantastic size and well-equipped.  The gent on the front-desk phoned about 30 minutes or so after we checked in, to make sure everything was okay.  There is free wireless and the breakfasts are quite good.  Pretty close to Disneyland too.

This hotel is in a great location for Disneyland access.  You could walk it if you were really keen (I'd guess it would take 15-20 min), but the best thing to do is take the ART shuttle that stops right outside the hotel and takes you right in to the Disney gate in 5 minutes.  It was easy as pie.  This is an older (1950s?) motel with 3 floors and no elevator, but the rooms have been nicely updated.  There's nothing fancy about it, but you are getting a clean, spacious room in good condition.  The pool area is small and unremarkable.   The only thing prevening me from giving this property 5 stars is the parking lot.  As previously mentioned, the spaces are remarkably small.  It was very difficult to fit between the lines and still get your car door open.  The parking lot is

I was checking rates and found this. It had 2 rooms with a queen bed in each plus a "couch bed", hide a bed for the 4 year old. I called the hotel to find out if they had these style room in a handicap, No. One the first floor. No but only a few doors down from the elevator. Great. Mama can walk a bit but standing is not her strong piont. A few weeks before the trip Mama tells me she will need a shower bench. Great call again and yes they have those. Good all set.  We get to the hotel and I am over joyed to find out that we have a room on the first floor. Not only that but once in the room the 2nd bed room has a door not french doors like the pictures. The living area has the couch bed and not a queen bed, but a king. There was also a small dining table with 4 chairs and a

Summary Heading: Nice hotel.  Good value.  Great breakfast
Summary: This is a nice little hotel.  NO frills, good breakfast and friendly staff.  However, we did not find this within walking distance to Disneyland.  After a long day at the parks, the last thing we wanted to do was walk another mile back to the hotel.  ART is recommended for this hotel.  Also seemed a little noisy in the mornings.

This is a fantastic hotel, closely situated to Disneyland. The Kids suites are amazing, and spacious - I highly recommend. The rooms are up-to-date and clean, with big comfy pillows. The free breakfast each day is amazing and a great value with a wide variety of items.  The pool is well maintained, although on the smaller side (hotel sized) it was a lot of fun.. and you can see some of the aerial fireworks from the Jacuzzi. The staff are very friendly and accommodating, we made several trip changes to our reservation, and there were no problems. It is located right on the main Disney Strip (Harbor Blvd.) so shopping and restaurants are very close at hand. Questions were answered in a friendly and courteous manner. Parking is a little tight, especially at the end of the night..

2 adults, 2 teenage girls, accomodations were fabulous. 1st room was large, with a pull out sofa, bunk beds, refridgerator, and TV. Door to second room with queen bed, TV and game system, vanity and closet. Toilet/bath and shower together. Each room had separate a/c units, a little noisy but would rather listen to that than street traffic. Could see that other guests had to double park occassionally, but we did not have that problem. The ONLY downside is the shuttle service-and that is no fault of the hotel. It could be a bit more frequent-if you miss it the wait is about 30 minutes until the next one. We walked one day-fine in the morning, it's about 1.25 miles. By the end of a day in the parks we chose to take the shuttle. Best part for us was the breakfast. Build your own

Summary Heading: Great staff, huge room, comfortable beds
Summary: We stayed for a week for our Disney trip. The room was HUGE, very little noise from the neighboring rooms. Laundry facilities were in good condition. GREAT breakfast - huge selection, and plenty of options. Room is small, but they don't mind if you take your food to your room. Snacks and coffee in the lobby (free) were a great surprise too. Gift shop was a nice surprise too. All staff were helpful and prompt with any and all requests we made. The parking lot was not an issue when we were there. We never had trouble parking our full sized rental. We had a carpeted suite - the flooring could stand to be replaced, but I really think that would be our only complaint. Really not a big deal - we just kept our shoes on. We got a GREAT rate on our room, which allowed us more funds for

Best complimentary breakfast I've had in a long time! Friendly staff, and very professional maidss, i was very surprised to find my tip left for the maid still on the desk when i returned to my room, but then i found out they  will not take it unless there's a note on top saying "For Housekeeping" It was updated room with hard wood floors and very comfy beds. My husband said the internet was slow, but is ran all my Facebook games fine and i was able to watch some hulu as well. All in All i'm already planing my trip back for next year

I have read some less than complimentary reviews for this hotel but I thought it was great for the price. Spacious and really clean. Dennys is two doors down if the complimentary breakfast doesnt suit. Would definitely stay again.

We were very pleased with the spaciousness off the two room suite. Also very convienient to use the toy story parking and take the bus to disney much nicer than the tram. The buses run constantly. Had a full breakfast not just danish and juice. Would like to see biscuit and gravy then  everthing 110%. Also more food option and beer or wine selection in store. Very nice visit, we will be back.

We stayed three nights at this motel while visiting Disneyland. We upgraded to a family suite that had two rooms, two bathrooms, bunkbeds, two queens, and a sofa bed. The room also had beautiful hardwood floors.   Pros:  Extremely friendly office staff. Very clean rooms. Can purchase Disney tickets in office and use ART bus to and from the parks. Breakfast was good. Great location and neighborhood. Pool and hot tub were clean and fun.   Cons:   Outdated TV and the remote did not work (but TV shouldn't be the highlight of your trip!). Breaker tripped each night and had to call front office for them to fix (but they did immediately each time).   I know many reviews mention the lack of parking, which is noticable, but while we were there the motel was not full so there were plenty

We found the hotel to be clean and in decent condition.  Our room had hard wood floors and was very clean.  Parking can be VERY tight and seems like there is a shortage of spots.  The hotel is a short walk to Disneyland.   Not a bad place for the money!

Summary Heading: Excellente value, close to Anaheim Convention Center
Summary: Stayed at this hotel while attending a 2-day conference at the Anaheim Convention Center. Hotel is 10-min walk. The room had two double beds and felt it was a bit small even though it was just me but most importantly it was very clean. It was more a place to sleep as I was all day away. Fridge and microwave oven in the room.   Continental breakfast is average but OK. Breakfast room is packed in the mornings.  Parking is free although spaces are limited and always full.   The price was good so I will definitely stay at this hotel again if I have to attend another meeting in the future.  Excellent value and overall had a good experience.

Small pool and parking but parking is free. Free breakfast and average. Beds are ok. Not updated in a while and older TV's. Free internet that did work. Work is being done in the parking lot making it not easy to park. Room A/C units are ok but noisy. Check in was fast and no issues. Close to Disneyland but walking to Disney can be done be is rather a long haul.

Hotel staff were great, all were very helpful & friendly. Free continental breakfast was delicious. Free wi-fi was an added benefit. Pool is smaller but well maintained. Shuttle using Anaheim transit is very close & easy to use. Our family thoroughly enjoyed our 8 night stay at the Best Western.

Summary Heading: Would have been better if not for the nuisance. . . I mean "resort" fee
Summary: I really liked this hotel.  It was clean and comfortable.  The location was good.  Breakfast was better than most. Staff was friendly and efficient.  Room rates were very reasonable.    BUT. . .having said all the good stuff I probably won't stay there again because of the extra $13 a night they charged me for a "resort fee".  It's a nice 2 star  - but I kept wondering where the "resort" was that I was getting charged for.   I guess like airlines, hotels have found a new source of revenue in these add-on fees.  But it seems a tad dishonest to sell me a room at one rate and then charge me a different rate after I have booked and showed up.  Though Best Western got a little extra cash from me today, they've probably lost a future guest.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel, Close to Disney, Friendly Staff!
Summary: A really great hotel, Stayed to 15 nights had no problems, great for disney, 10 minutes and your there! Staff where frendly, room was always clean! Breakfast was ok. Could do with a better selection though.

we stayed here several times & has always been a good experience. Bus picks up right outside of Hotel every 20 minutes drops off right at Disneyland main gate...only down side was hotel only sold 1 day passes for bus. Staff is very friendly & informative.

Summary Heading: If you are doing Disney with a family, this is a gem
Summary: We stayed at this hotel last week.  We went to Disneyland for 3 days.  Okay, there are a few valid gripes about the Best Western Raffles that I've read here.  However, if you are doing Disney, and are on a budget, this place is affordable, and right around the corner from the park, and there is every kind of restaurant in every direction!  Sure, the hotel is old, and the rooms are a bit outdated and could use refreshing as far as the decor, furniture and carpet. And yeah, the air conditioning units need to be replaced or at the very least, thoroughly cleaned out.  The air that comes out is a tad smelly.   And I think someone mentioned a problem with cable television.  Ours was spotty, but I didn't really care since the only tv we watched were the Olympic highlights after we came

Very good location,great breakfast, slow but free Wi-Fi. Breakfast was always well-stocked whether you arrived early or near the end. Had room #301 for our two family group of 7. The suite consisted of two bedrooms. The outer room was typical and the inner room had a bunk bed and sleeper couch with no window but it was a quiet room and great for the kids (one of the parents liked the bunk bed and slept quietly there!). The parking lot was tight with limited space but hotel staff allowed tandem doubled- up parking and took care of moving any vehicle if it had to come out first in the morning.  Overall a 3 to 4 star rating based on European standards. There is a shuttle bus to the front gate of Disney which is good for 1 or 2 people, otherwise larger groups will find it cheaper to

We arrived on Wednesday after traveling all day.  I have a son who is a diabetic--he had been running high in his blood sugars all day--my husband and I had been monitoring him after he went to bed--but by 11:30 at night he had dropped really low.  we needed to get sugar into him fast.  My husband went down to the lobby to see if they had an ATM so he could get a soda.  The clerk said they didn't, but took out his wallet and gave my husband $2 to get a soda.  He had no idea we needed it for our diabetic son--my husband just told him he wanted a soda.  Also, we had our room right above the designated smoking area.  Smoke was coming in through the air conditioning vent most of the night.  We asked the next morning if we could be moved.  They moved us to a new room while we were

Enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Close to Disney - shuttle stop outside. Nice outdoor spa and pool. Good choice at breakfast. No video games - which description promised but overall would highly recommend

The walk to disneyland only took about 15 minutes. Very nice staff, good breakfast. Parking was not great but once we were parked it stayed there for 4 days so it wasn't a big deal. Rooms were clean. Nice pool & hot tub. You can see the fireworks from the hotel too so that was neat. We will be back for sure.

Room was pretty nice. Lots of space. We stayed in a suite with bunk beds. Parking was absolutely horrid!! Skinny spaces and not enough to accommodate everyone. Staff was pleasant. Not as close to Disneyland as it sounded on the website. So with a 2 year old we drove. Good breakfast Saturday morning but not as good Sunday.

Summary Heading: If you are a smoker, don't walk into your room smelling of smoke!!
Summary: My wife and I are both smokers, we stay here for 7 nights with our 15 year old son and 4 year old grandson. Every day we walked over to their designated smoking area to smoke. As most people know, (but the management here doesnt) smoking makes your clothes smell. After a weeks worth of dirty clothes the smell was even worse. So they proceeded to charge us an un-authorized $200 cleaning fee for NOT Smoking in our room.

Summary Heading: The picture is just a front fascia...not the whole hotel
Summary: Parking, to check in is difficult due to small parking lot.  Lobby had an odor that almost made me turn around and leave.  Room seemed to be clean and restroom was cleaner than most hotels. Guest suite has a sheer window covering which does not allow any privacy.  We had trouble with the toilet plugging and at breakfast, I learned, that several guest had experienced a similar problem.  They didn not have a plunger in the late evening and fron desk was not able to assist. Parking lot in the morning was double parked.  Had an emergency occurred where fire or rescue people were needed, they would not have been able to drive around the parking lot.  Breakfast was good...on Friday, they had a waffle maker...would have been nice to have one every day.

Summary Heading: Great for families visiting Disneyland Resort
Summary: My family and I stayed here from 06 July to 12 July 2012. The staff is very friendly. The rooms are comfortable. It is a short walk to Disneyland Resort. We were able to purchase our Disney tickets at the front desk which saved us a long wait at Disneyland Resort itself. The parking lot is small but the staff is very accommodating and was able to park our vehicle on property every night. The breakfast is a lot better than most hotel continental breakfasts. Overall a very family friendly hotel. I would highly recommend staying here.

Summary Heading: I'm baaaack! This hotel is GREAT!
Summary: We came back to this hotel from our last visit this time to visit family this time. I came this time with my kids and 2 of their friends and the Family Suite was just perfect as always! It's great that this hotel offers such accomodations that allow the family to be in seperate rooms and the kids still have their own tv and bathroom, no fighting here in the morning! The staff was excellent as always, very friendly and helpful which is something I can't say about other big hotels *cough* Hilton *cough* Embassey Suites*...ANYWAY, breakfast was good, lots of things to choose from not just cereal and coffee. Parking was fine, I think some people just HAVE to bring their big Yukons for a family of 4 or people bringing 3 cars, as I overheard one guy saying in a group of 3. Really
Staff was very friendly and helpful.  The kids really enjoyed the bunk beds, don't know why other hotels don't have them.

We stayed at this hotel from 7/7-7/10.  Our first disappointment was that they only had one washing machine functioning for the entire resort.  When we went to the frront desk to ask for change for the washing machine, we were told to walk to the liquor store down the street and ask them for change.  We then asked them to leave the laundry open later so that we could finish our laundry (since they only had one functioning washer) and we were told that they could only leave it open for an extra 30 minutes.  The parking at this hotel is a nightmare.  They don't have enough parking spaces for each room, so you may have to give your keys to the front desk where they will sometimes triple park your car.  The worst aspect of this hotel we noticed when we were returning from California

Summary Heading: Good cheap conference digs, if the big hotels are sold out...
Summary: I wanted to save money and from the map, it looked like this motel was not far from the Anaheim conference center and it was considerably cheaper than the big hotels next to it.  In fact, if you are willing to cross a big avenue in the middle of the block and figure out the cut-through of other hotels' parking lots, it's only about a 10 min. walk, and fortunately the weather was nice.  The motel was clean and seemed to have the amenities I needed, including free wifi (which was slow, but... free).  Not much in the way of food or nightlife in the immediate neighborhood, but at the end of the day I was ready to conk anyway.  They do serve breakfast - choices were not bad, if you don't mind circular scrambled eggs, and they had a waffle maker.  Although there's no interior entrance

I was staying in an awful hotel, and I had to get out of there. I called this Best Western at 11:00 at night, and they got me right into a very nice suite, gave me a discount and told me to come on down to get checked in. The staff was AMAZING, they were so friendly and went above and beyond to help me with anything I needed. If you are staying in the area, and need a hotel for a good price, I would definitely stay here, it is so worth it!!!
I booked the hotel for 8 nights from 11 JUNE till 19 JUNE, with my wife and three kids the hotel was so nice, clean, close to Disney and shops, the room was ver nice and breakfast was great

This hotel was excellent.  The room was clean and very large.  We had 2 bedrooms, both with televisions which made the kids really happy.  The hotel is located next to a large Disneyland shuttle bus parking lot.  We were able to hop on and off of the bus throughout the day.  Money saving!  The other money saver besides the low cost per night and the short walk to the free disney shuttle was the great breakfast.  You get a hot meal to start off your day.  There is something for everybody.  You can even see the Disneyland late night fireworks show from the hotel.  If I had to say one thing that was a downfall, it would be the parking.  The spaces are very small and it was at times difficult to park our Yukon.  I would suggest staying here.

We stayed 3 nights and had  a wonderful time.  Breakfast was very good and the staff kept it filled up.  The check in staff was very helpful and cheerfully answered many questions we had about our stay.  For the price it was an excellent room for a family of 6.  there is just one elevator on the southwest corner of the motel and the parking is at a premium late in the evening but still a nice place to stay.

Summary Heading: You can put lipstick on a pig but it is still a pig, dirty and bad
Summary: This place looks good online but it is really bad in person.  They have done a paint and fake wood floors update of the place but you can tell they did a poor job of it.  The door to our room had a two inch gap at the bottom to the outside because when they took up the carpet and the pad it had been thicker than the laminate floor they put in and never bothered to fix the door, bugs were not fun.  The sink in the room had a newer top but had a fabric curtain covering the fact that the underside of the sink was dirty and they had not even bothered to paint the wall under it.  The light switches were really old, not changed in the "update" and were caked with dirt in our room.  The towels should have been white but they were gray, not clean.  When we arrived the shower had hair on

This place was great. We had 8 people and felt very comfortable in our room. Each night at 9:30 or so you could watch fireworks right of the balcony! Breakfast was very good and very, very plentiful. My kids really loved the waffles! The BEST part about our visit was that the staff was so nice. Wew lost our room keys- replaced immeadiatly! We needed a ironin board -there it was before we could blink. They even let us keep our car parked in the lot after we had checked out so we could stay at Disneyland and not worry about it! Two Thumbs way up!!!!!

Summary Heading: OK hotel, but not a resort
Summary: This is an older hotel, in a good location. Rooms still have the old style "window unit" air conditioners, which are noisy.  We had some issues here, including them wanted to charge me extra for checking in at 2:30pm, none of the vending machines worked, and there is nothing to walk to nearby to buy anything.  The parking lot was completely full when we returned at 11:00pm, so we had to double park and hope we didn't block someone in. And they charge a "resort fee" on top of the room rate.  This is not a resort, it is a motel with a small front office and a small pool. Positives were breakfast was good and wifi was fast.

We stayed here from April 27- May 4, 2012; I must say that our hotel stay was better then expected. We reserved two suites (one with 2 bathrooms and one with just one bathroom). Prior to arrival I called several times just to ensure that everything with our hotel was set and ready to go being that we live in Hawaii and had a long trip ahead of us. Everytime I called the staff was very helpful. We arrived the evening of the 27th and received our keys and a lot of useful information. The rooms looked exactly like the pictures I'd seen online. Our room didn't have hardwood floor like seen in some photos but it was ALWAYS clean, the bunk beds worked wonderfully, and the breakfast daily was a HUGE saver. We would stay here again and look forward to our trip back!
Went through an external booking site.  Got there late in the day and got free upgrade to the 2 rooms w/ bunk beds.  Very nice array at breakfast.  Clean.  Comfy beds.  Mushy pillows.
We enjoyed our week here - rooms were clean and spacious. Loved having a guest laundry! The breakfasts were awesome, and enjoyed the fresh fruit provided all day long. Very helpful staff!

This hotel doesnt look exactly like the picture. there are no disney characters on the beds. however the kids loved the bunk beds and the shuttle has only 2 stops on the way to disney. The cleaning lady made our room nice and cozy for us each night we came home from disney. That was nice because we were sooo tired! when our coffee maker broke the first morning, they checked it and replaced it right away. they also had a pool and hottub. we didnt have time to use it though. also the breakfast wasnt bad, it consisted of waffles, toast, bagels, sausage eggs, cereal, coffee, juices, tea, fruit, yogurt, milk, etc. not too bad in my opinion.we paid about $600 for 5 nights, which i thought was very reasonable. although i would consider staying again, i would also price out hotels that

Pro's nice rooms, updating is looks good, variety at breakfast, day staff and management great, comfortable beds, great price, right by toy story lot where you can get a free shuttle to disney without a wait  Con's lousy parking (not the hotels fault but they do an amazing job of organizing it in busy times) , coffee is horrendous, night staff not up to best western expectations, resort fee   Overall a great place to stay in anahiem if you are looking for a clean comfortable reasonably priced place to stay in anahiem

We had booked the Kids suite, and thought we were getting a great deal! However, they have a really good photographer..the rooms are smaller than they look! Our room was on the second floor, right by the stairs. You walked in and there was the bathroom, nothing to seperate the kids room other than a large shutter door. Walking by some of the other rooms we were able to tell they are not all layed out the same. So, it's a basic room, small, but it's a clean place to sleep. Parking IS tight, but it's not horrid! Just let the family out of the car before you park, tight spots! Breakfast was good (I mean, come on, it's free!) It is a basic carb filled continental breakfast. The eggs and sausage, with yogurt were good though, the kids loved the waffle maker, but it was very crowded

Summary Heading: So Many Better Options to Stay at Near Disneyland
Summary: The room was clean but basic.  We dealt with live bugs (gnats?) every night in the bathroom sinks.  Parking was a nightmare - by the third night of our stay part of the parking lot had been cordoned off and you had to park one car in front of the other.  Waited over 40 minutes to have the car behind me moved so I could pack to leave the next morning.
