On the second night of our stay went to take a shower after being at Disneyland all day and no water.  Maintenance did come up to fix it but it was a pain and the last thing I wanted to deal with.  It is a long walk to the parks and there are much better options to stay at near Disneyland.

Summary Heading: 20 min walk to disney, room was a little dumpy but okay, Great Breakfast!
Summary: The beds and tv's could use some updating.  A little noisy with the sounds of people walking up and down stairs and corridors.  Website said that the kids would be able to play a Nintendo 64 instead there was a system that was hard to operate and required an extra charge.  Wasn't told about the shuttle bus till after a couple of walks to Disney- that would of been really helpful.... Morning breakfast was great!  Good assortment of food and plenty of healthy options ;)

This is my third stay at a Best Western stay in the last week.  Exeter, Cal., Las Vegas, and Anaheim. This one was clean and spacious and quiet.  I normally pick up the remote with a kleenex and push the buttons with the kleenex for sanitary reasons (I figure if I act like Howard Hughes, the money will come!).  I was amazed that the remote came in a plastic pouch and a sticker on top of the bag that said "sterilized".  Jolly Good Show! My Wife is going to Spain next month and we booked her at a Best Western as they seem to be a good chain.

Checked in ready to go to bed, pulled back the comforter and stained (or still dirty?) sheets covered the bed. The bathroom floor was dirty, room was not well cleaned and no other room options available per the front desk. They came and changed the sheets so I made the best of it. I don't recommend this hotel due to their poor housekeeping standards.

This ended up being the best place for our needs.  My husband and I shared a room with my daughter and son-in-law and their two little boys, aged 2 1/2 and 4 months.   We had the family suite, which included a seperate bedroom which worked out perfectly for us.   Afger a long day, we could retire to the back room and let my daughter focus on their routine on getting the boys in bed.   The room was large, and had a dining area where we could eat or let my grandson play and color.   The room had a mini fridge, microwave and sink area.  The extra bedroom had its own sink area which was convenient.  The breakfast was better than expected, with eggs and sausage, breads, cereals, nice coffee selection and waffles you can made yourself.  The location was next to the Disneyland Toy

Recently stayed at this location for our stay while visiting Disneyland.  Though the outside entrance was not the most appealing idea, the rest of the hotel was great.  The fridge inside was larger than expected offering plenty of room to store our food while we were there.  The deluxe breakfast was great, offering plenty of choices for our family of 5.  The ART bus stop was located near by which was convenient.  Would book again!

we stayed in this hotel for 3days last week, the price was just right,for the hotel that's near disneyland.the shuttle bus going to the park is very near,it's really very convenient.the hotel room was clean and the housekeeping always clean our room daily.the breakfast was not bad at all.the parking is free and there are restaurants near the hotel. i will recommend this hotel if you are going to disneyland on budget

We are a family of 6 and got a huge room on the 3rd floor it had a king bed, sofa bed, desk, closet, drawers, table & 4 chairs, refrigerator & microwave and food cabinets. It also had a 2nd room with a queen bed, drawers & own sink & mirror. One bathroom with hallway sink. We have no complaints at all, everything was great and the breakfast was awesome, sausage, eggs, we made our own waffles, cool waffle maker & plenty of cereal, pastries, fruits, juices & coffee. The room was very clean and beds were comfortable, staff was friendly. We will definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel to everyone. We caught the shuttle to disneyland out front for 8.00 a person daily pass.

We had room 339, HIGHLY recommended!  Had a king bed in the main room, good sized fridge & microwave, 2nd room had a pullout sofa sleeper and a bunk bed.  Only drawbacks:  No windows opened for circulation and the 2nd room got kind of stuffy.  Kids didn't complain at all though!  Only one bathroom made it challenging, but seriously we were only in the room at night and left early in the mornings.  The kids loved the pool and hot tub!  The walk, well, it IS long...we opted for the transit 2 of our 7 days, walked the other 5.  It's about 20 minutes or so which doesn't seem bad, but after being in the park for 12 or more hours, it's LONG!  Our room was SO QUIET every night and the bed was SO COMFY we slept GREAT the whole week!  Only our last night three tour busses of kids pulled

My wife, two young toddlers enjoyed a great stay at Raffles Feb 2-5 at Raffles.  I had read up on most of the hotels in the area and decided on BW Raffles because it had seperate sleeping area for the kids with bunk beds, breakfast was included and it was close to Disney.  We knew about the parking problem and the resort fee of about 10 bucks a day so it wasn't an issue.  Their is not enough parking on busy nights.  We only got blocked in on our last night which was a Saturday night.  I let the night manager know that we needed to get out and we were on our way in 5 minutes.  We booked the Family Suite that is basically one long room seperated in the middle with a door.  Each area had its own TV and AC so we could moderate the temps for the kids.  Our portion of the room had the

I'm trying to think of a reason for staying at this hotel but really cannot come up with one.   My family recently spent 5 nights at the hotel, on a Disneyland vacation of sorts. I initially found the hotel to be similar to that of a Motel 6, from years ago. On the street side, the hotel looks appealing, but when you enter the parking lot, it stops there. The building looks old and the parking lot has seen better days.  Since we were traveling with a teenager, we booked a room that offered 2 bathrooms and a second room (bedroom). The second bathroom really came in handy. I was a little dissapointed by the bedroom aspect, it had a set of bunk beds and a sofa bed which required moving all the furniture to let it out. The room does not have it's own air conditioning unit, instead

Summary Heading: Clean, great for families budget friendly for 5+ people
Summary: We stayed here May 27-June 6 2011, in a 2 queen, 2 bathroom, 2 tvs, with bunk beds and a couch, frdge and microwave on 3rd floor room in the middle.  our room was clean and fully functioning. the layout was fine but the ac didnt circulate air very well into the kids room, (mino) but if weaqther was super hot it could be an issue. Not old but not new furnishingings- but who needs flat screen TVs while on a DL vacation, however i have heard since then they are currently remolding ALOT!   there were some minor construction/remodeling on the first floor but it didn't affect anything,   the elevator is small, old school- but fully functioning and get the job done!!!  Breakfast was good, nice dining area. The pool was clean and always used!!! Parking was packed at night and vacant

Summary Heading: They sneak $$ out of you the way bank of america does, with sneaky fees!
Summary: The parking here is very poor, we were blocked in every morning, until 10am!

Summary Heading: Another great stay at Best Western Raffles Inn & Suites
Summary: We take a performing arts school group to Anaheim each year to perform at Disneyland and we select this property. Again in 2011, the service was outstanding. The front office staff and sales team could not do enough to ensure that the group were safe, happy and felt welcome.  The wooden floors do mean that it is noisier than other motels (unless you are on the top floor), but the cleanliness and service far outweigh a little noise.
This was a great place to end our day after spending a very long day at Disneyland.  Great accommodations!  Great staff! Great free continental breakfast!

Summary Heading: Clean, reasonably priced, and comes with breakfast
Summary: About 15-20 min walk from the park entrance which seemed bit far after spending all day in the parks, but worth it in our estimation.  Prices were lower than the hotels directly across from Disneyland and the rooms were in much better shape.  Not top of the line, but we spent all day at the parks and only needed the room to sleep in.  Floors were hardwood compared to carpet, so the room felt MUCH cleaner than other rooms we've stayed in.  This is a plus for us because our kids throw off their shoes the minute we walk indoors.  The breakfast was pretty good.  Make your own waffles, doughnuts, pasteries, hard boiled eggs, cereal, coffee (with french-vanilla creamer - score!), juice, and milk.  Scrambled eggs, potatoes or something less sugary would have been nice, but can't

Room was very clean, nice bunk beds for kids.  pullout couch bed could have been better, but extra blankets and pillows were provided.  we were on the third floor and the elevator was a ways away.  Laundry machine was broken.  Very nice breakfast offered with lots of options.  Very close to Disneyland and good transportation options.

I stayed here September 14 - 15 with my daughter and husband for a quick visit to Disneyland and to visit family. I picked this hotel because of the reviews on Tripadvisor and also because I was able to use airline miles to pay for the hotel. When we checked in the person working behind the desk (Robert) was very helpful. I asked if there were any rooms available with bunk beds as I had booked a 2 queen bed room. Robert gave me a key and let me check out the room first to see if it would suit our needs. It was a great room. We were on the first floor so the room had wood flooring and the bunk beds were in the back of the room. The room also had a couch with was nice so we didn't have to sit on the beds when we were in the room. Breakfast was fine...typical continental...could

I stayed at your hotel this past weekend, 9/16/11 - 9/17/11. My daughter, myself and my granddaughter. I must say that Renee, (night Manager) gave a new meaning to the phrase, "Customer Service". She was their both nights we were and she couldn't have been anymore helpful than she already was. Her demeanor, attitude, and professionalism was beyond anything I have ever experienced. Additionally, we loved the room. We had 1 room w/two queen beds. The room was beautiful. The continental breakfast was great. Everything was beyond what we expected. (if I had to pick one thing that was not so good, it would be the parking) However, that will not keep us away. When we plan our next trip to Disneyland, your hotel will be the one we come to.  Thank you so much for making our stay an

Summary Heading: This location worked great for our family visit to Disneyland
Summary: Our family of 6 adults and 1 child stayed in one of the suites with 2 bathrooms, 2 queen beds, bunk beds and a sofa bed.  This was great for our group and we really appreciated having the 2 bathrooms.  The "kids" room didn't have a separate ac unit so it wasn't as cool as the main room, but was still comfortable.  The breakfast wasn't fancy, but had everything we needed. The maid service was very prompt.  The parking spaces might be a problem when the motel is full, they are quite small, but weren't a problem for us.  This location is not a close walk to Disneyland, but some of our family walked it and said it wasn't too bad.  We had a great experience and would definitely come back.

We stayed here because it is close to the Disneyland Resort (about a half mile) and cheaper.  We spent nine nights here as we visited the major California them parks; Disneyland, Universal Studios, Sea World, Knott's Berry Farm, Legoland, and the beaches of Orange County.    Three of us travelling had a room with two queen beds, bathroom with two sinks, desk and chair, table with two chairs, TV, microwave, and small refer/freezer. Not bad!  All the staff were friendly.  There is a swimming pool and a laundryroom, as well as daily housekeeping.  Free continental breakfast is served every morning with fresh fruits, cereals, pastries, milk, juice, coffee, & hardboiled eggs.  A waffle iron is provided so you have freshly made waffles.  Not your dry, toaster pop-up waffles.  The bus

A decent family accommodation about a 15 min walk to the Disneyland maingate.  Stayed in a family suite, which gave us decent space, but the room felt a bit old, but comfortable and clean.  Included breakfast was OK - too crowded with not enough seating for the number of guests.  Good value for the price. Staff friendly and helpful.

Summary Heading: Good choice if you need to sleep 6
Summary: We just got back from our trip. We had 3 adults and 3 kids 6 and under. We needed a hotel that slept 6 and this hotel did do that. I paid 119/night but when I checked in I was told there was a $10 per day resort fee reservations did NOT tell me about. I do not like surprises.  Good= room slept 6 and had nice layout. It was a suite. A door separated the room you walk into where there is a double bed. In this room there is a TV with cable, mini fridge and micro. Then there is a door and then the bathroom on left and vanity sink on right. Then bunk beds and a sofa sleeper as well as another TV with Nintendo. Good location too only 1 mile from Disney.  Not so good: breakfast was practically inedible. No hot choice but waffles. Only apples and oranges for fruit. Cheap yucky pastries

Summary Heading: Great place at a Great Price!!
Summary: Stayed here for 3 nights in June 2011 for our family's trip to Disneyland. The staff was very friendly, outgoing, and very eager to help. The room was very clean, the grounds well kept, and most of all, it was quiet at night. On top of all this, the price was right and free breakfast and parking was included. Nice place and,  if the prices are still right,  we'll be back we'll stay here when we head back to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Did what it said on the tin........
Summary: I stayed here for 11 nights with my 12 year old son. The rooms were a little tired, but clean and comfortable. A/C was noisy but if you turn it on full cold when you go out to dinner & switch off when you come back you can get through the night without being too hot. Breakfast was fine, cereals, toast, waffles etc. Enough to start your day. I was a little worried by the external corridors and the potential for noise, only once did we have raised voices outside our room, phoned reception and they were told to be quiet, slept fine after that. The staff were very friendly, especially the reception staff, Cruz was lovely! Pool is small, but clean and plenty of clean towels. I would recommend this motel if you want to be close to Disney but don't want to pay the inflated prices at
Manager Response: Hello here Valued Guest!  Thank you for your honest feedback regarding your recent stay at our property.   By telling us what you liked about your stay and how we can improve, you are helping us deliver a superior experience for you and other guests in the future. I'm so glad you enjoyed the breakfast and your room for your long stay!  Wow-a 2 week visit-you really enjoyed the Magic of Disney!  I'm also glad you felt safe here and you got a good night's sleep!  Thank you for the kind words about the front desk team.  They do a great job!  We hope to see you back here for your next Disneyland Vacation!  All my best!

Summary Heading: Great Room, Great Breakfast but Horrible Parking!
Summary: I stayed here for 3 days with my family of 4.  We really only slept here since we were at Disneyland most of the time but our room was still very nice.  Everything in our room  was VERY clean and the well kept.  Pool / Hot Tub was small but still very clean.  The Breakfast was also very good.  Parking: Horrible.  It is free but the parking spots are SUPER SKINNY!!  I have never seen any this skinny before.  Also there are NOT enough spots for the number of rooms.  We even counted!  They have people parking everywhere, even double parking people!!  Also this hotel is not in walking distance to Disneyland(like advertised).  But there is a bus stop right in front of the hotel.    Would I stay here again?  Maybe...only if the parking situation gets fixed!

Summary Heading: Enjoyed our stay, will definately stay there again!!!
Summary: We really enjoyed stay our stay at the Best Western Plus Rafffles.  When we got there we were informed that we had been upgraded to a 2 queen and sofa bed suite, which was great.  Very spacious, and very clean, kudos to the housekeeping staff.  Beds were very comfortable, a/c worked great and was very quiet. My kids loved the pool area, I particularly liked the the hot tub, it had great, powerful jets that helped me relax.  We enjoyed the continental breakfast, more than enough to start your day.  Make yourself waffles were great, they also had boiled eggs, 3 kinds of cereal, fruit, orange and apple juice, donuts and danishs, toast and english muffins.  Most days we walked up to the toy story parking lot and took their complimentary shuttle buses for free.  They have a sidewalk
Manager Response: What a great review!  Thank you soo much!  We get so excited when friends and families can relax and truly enjoy the Magic of Disney!  We know that it starts here with us, when you check in.  The staff here works so hard to make sure each guest gets their hard earned money's worth!  The brand new waffle maker station is great and it smells so good in the morning!   You're right, guests staying here do get more for their complimentary breakfast than other Hotels similar to us.  I love that you took a little "you" time and enjoyed the hot tub.  It is newly renovated and is quite relaxing.  As Disney continues to add to the California Adventure Side thru 2012 we hope to see you back here celebrating with us!   Your comments mean alot-Thank You!  Happy Summer!  Shawn

Summary Heading: We loved it and WILL be back!!
Summary: The location is wonderful for access to the Convention Center, and not too far from Downtown Disney.  The staff was very accomodating and quick in fulfilling requests.  A very enjoyable experience.
Manager Response: I loved reading your review!  Thank you so much!  We were so pleased to have you stay with us and I'm so happy the Hotel exceeded your expectations!  We hope your travels are bringing you back to visit us at the home of Walt Disney’s Original Theme Park!   We’d love for you to come back and enjoy the completion of the $2 million dollar renovation which includes new bedding, hard wood floors in selected rooms, a complimentary deluxe continental breakfast with brand new outdoor seating to enjoy the beautiful California Weather!   Cant wait to see you~   Yours in Hospitality!   Shawn Regional Sales Manager/Guest Relations Mgr.

Summary: This hotel is not our normal Best Western hotel, however, it is our new favorite.  Beautiful hardwood floors and lots of room.  Very peaceful and close to Disneyland.  Can't wait to go back and try out their family suites.

This was one of the most convient and family friendly vacations that we have taken in a while.  The hotel is located within walking distance of Disneyland and several restaurants that were all reasonably priced.  The room we stayed in is perfect for a family, there is a queen bed in one room and bunk beds with a hide-a-bed in the same room.  These accommodations easily house 6 people.  The pool and breakfast each morning were a great added bonus to the vacation.  Thanks Best Western!
Manager Response: Greetings from the Happiest Place on Earth!     I hope this message finds you doing well.    First, I wanted to Thank You for the feedback provided about your recent stay here at Best Western Raffles Inn and Suites. It is feedback like yours that helps us become better and improve the stay of future guests.  We're so thrilled to hear you enjoyed the Hotel stay as well as the Magic of Disney!  You’re right-the bunk bed suites are fantastic!  Young kids and teenagers love them!  Since they have no weight restriction, they work well for everyone!   I'm so excited you enjoyed the breakfast and I love the new waffle makers!    Since we've recently completed our $2 million dollar renovation which includes new bedding, hard wood floors in selected rooms and more, I'm glad to know you were able to experience a nice, relaxing stay for your hard earned dollars!  We appreciate you and look forward to seeing you again when your travels bring you back to the Happiest Place on Earth!   Thanks again for your feedback!   Shawn Ross Regional Sales Manager/Manager of Customer Feedback

Summary Heading: Friendly, polite, staff and a clean atmosphere
Summary: We usually stay at the Park Place Inn but we didn't want to pay the cost.  We search around and found this hotel to be reasonably priced and the parking was free.  The room smelled fresh and the staff was friendly.  We had a great sleep and although we did not take advantage of the pool or relaxing in the room we will go back to this hotel again.
Manager Response: Thank you for this great review!   We are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your stay!  We pride ourselves on being a great value for Disneyland Families and/or groups but our service is what keeps you coming back!  This is the MOST unique Best Western in the Anaheim Area with our Suites and we're always looking for ways to improve.  We appreciate the feedback!   Come back and see the great improvements we're doing!  Can't wait to see you again  at the Happiest Place On Earth!    Yours in Hospitality,  Shawn Ross Regional Sales Manager/Manager of Customer Feedback

Summary: My family and I stayed the weekend at this Hotel and we had great experience. The staff are really friendly and helpfull. The room was very clean and pleasent, my kids were very happy there. The location is great we only walked 10 minutes to Disney. You can literally go in the morning and come back to take a rest and go back again for the fireworks. The breakfast was surprisingly good, a lot of variety of food, not mentioning the waffle that you make yourself and is delicious!  We already thinking in to go back to Disney and stay at BW Raffles In & Suites!
Manager Response: Thank you for this great review!   We are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your stay!  I'm so glad you got to enjoy the brand new waffle maker station!  Aren’t they delicious?  They smell sooo good too!  Thanks so much for your feedback, we will definitely share et with the team members.  I’m so glad the close location to the Theme Parks added to your overall stay.  It’s always nice to walk and enjoy time with family and friends!  Our great California weather helps too!  We pride ourselves on being a great value for Disneyland Families and/or groups but our service is what keeps you coming back!  Can't wait to see you again  at the Happiest Place On Earth!    Yours in Hospitality,  Shawn Ross Regional Sales Manager/Manager of Customer Feedback

Summary: The only thing that was difficult was parking.  Didn't seem like spaces were wide enough to accomodate larger vehicles and spaces were limited so people double parked.  BUT all in all, we would definitely stay there again

We booked this hotel as it was much cheaper than the similar hotels in the area, and was pleasantly surprised.  The room was very clean and spacious, with a comfortable bed and excellent pillows. The breakfast is limited, but a good free start to the day. As with all these hotels, the breakfast room is too small and at times crowded, but otherwise all ok( certainly better than provided at the Alpine inn etc). It's about a 10 minute walk to the Garden Walk and about 20 mins to the parks and down down Disney, the shuttle bus stops right outside the hotel, should you need it.  The desk staff were very helpful and friendly, giving good advise and booking trips etc.  The only problem we had, was the thin walls. You really can hear conversations in the next room, bad news if you have

Summary Heading: Great price and close to Disney. Very funny staff.
Summary: We were so tired after driving from Utah. We knew checkin was at 3pm but we got there early. I called ahead to see if POSSIBLY there was a room ready and the young lady said if I gave her my number shed call me ad soon as one would be clean. No more than 20 minutes passed and she called! We were so pleased with the follow-up and honestly, if there wasn't a room ready to get in early, I'd still give the hotel a good review. Breakfast was good, I wish there was a choice of more cereals and eggs to choose from. Also, more waffle makers because I swear, some peole have no courtesy and make waffles for their whole family even with 10 people behind them! Next time we come down, I'll be sure to stay st this place again:-)
make sure to choose a hotel that convinient, affordable & comfortable

We have been staying at Raffles since 2002. We have always found Shawn so accommodating and welcoming for our group. The premises is safe and clean and although, it is a little walk from Disneyland, you get the quiet you need to sleep, which you don't get opposite the parks.

Clean and comfortable hotel with contemporaneous furniture. We were pleasantly surprised, as we did not know what to expect.  Close to the park. The bus to Disneyland stops almost in front of the hotel.

For starters, this should be called the Best Western MOTEL (not Inn & Suites). It is one of those MOTELS where it's shaped in a U & cars can park right in front of your door which equals noise, noise & noise. I was woken up at least 2-3 times per night during our 3-night stay with cars honking, people screaming & talking, doors slamming, kids running up & down the outdoor walkways. It is LOUD here! Next, our sink stunk like sewage-- no joke. My husband & I had a few "did you fart?" moments as we were brushing our teeth until we realized it was the sink water that STUNK like raw sewage every time we turned it on (we were in Room 326).  Then, everything just seemed dirty, dirty, dirty. None of us would DARE walk around the room barefoot & I cringed when we had to give my son a

If you read any of the other bad reviews you will notice people mentioning the "bugs in the sink" or "spider bites" and "fleas." That's exactly what I thought too until the maintenance man, Guillarmo, came up and informed me that the bugs were indeed bed bugs. I also took pictures and compared them to photos online. He proceeded to bleach the sink but the bugs weren't just in the sink, they were in the carpet. I had dropped a towel on the floor, picked it up within 5 seconds and put it in the sink when about 20-40 bugs appeared before my eyes. If a towel picked up that many bugs within 5 seconds then the place must be infested! My suitcase was open on the floor and I began to panic because I didn't want all of my clothes infested. I couldn't walk around naked so I had to put

We had a two room suite that slept 8 and had 2 baths, which was perfect for our family of 7.  The hotel was clean and had laminate flooring, which I liked. They served a expansive breakfast from waffles to rolls. The pool was heated, and though nothing special the kids liked it.  The hotel is walking distance to Disneyland or there is  bus stop in front of the hotel.  We will stay there again.

We arrived to our hotel at check in time.  We had two rooms booked and only one room was ready.  My mother in law had to wait 45 minutes beyond the 3 oclock check in time which was frustrating after a long trip to LA.  The room appeared to be ok until night came.  We had a family suite with 2 bathrooms and 4 sinks.  At nightfall the sinks filled up with these little brown bugs.  I called down to the desk who had the maintenance man come in and spray bleach all over each of the sinks.  We not only were gased out of our room but the bugs came back 2 hours later!  My mother in law's room had cockroaches.  When I approached the front desk she was very rude and it was not until I told her I had pictures of the bugs did she finally send someone up there.  Needless to say we checked

We accidentally left something behind, and asked the hotel to return it at our expense.  They wanted copies of driver's license and credit card, front and back.  Being concerned about identity theft, we asked if it could be returned COD.  They refused. They said only other method was to set up a FedEx account.  Did that; left messages; they did not return calls or return the item.  Corporate headquarters said they could have returned it COD.  Desk personnel and manager were rude and condescending.    In addition, we were without hot water in room three different times during a stay at a time of unusually cold weather.  Management totally unconcerned.  Would never recommend this hotel to anyone.

Summary Heading: Great family hotel, close to Disneyland.
Summary: Really enjoyed our stay at the Raffles Inn. Happy with the accommodation. Beds were comfortable, the two bedroom suites were really suitable with our two younger kids. Gave them some space, whilst giving us some of our own. Two bathroons were really nice as well. Breakfasts were acceptable, coming from Australia the American tastes are a little different to ours. We had no problems, staff were always pleasent to deal with and the rates were good.

Our extended family of 10 went for a Disneyland vacation back in November 2010. We booked 2 rooms, 4 persons in 1 room and 6 in another. Laminate wood flooring was in place instead of carpet, nice for a change. The beds were really bad; thin, springy and sank in the middle. Pillows were flat like pancakes and air-conditioning were really loud. Everything else was standard; management tried to upgrade an old motel but failed terribly. I will say the location is excellent, 15 to 20 mins walk to Disneyland entrance or take a free 5 mins shuttle from the Disneyland carpark next door. (Make yourself) Waffles were good during breakfast, and there were plenty of juice, milk, coffee, bread, bagels, etc. If price and location are your priorities, this is the hotel for you. If you have

We were terribly disgusted with this hotel! We were not expecting it to be a Motel, once we checked into our room, which was located on the 3rd floor with only 1 elevator located across the entire parking lot, we were completely disgusted with our room, which only had 1 queen bed that was located right beside the window that looked out at the stairway. There was 1 tiny bathroom that was dirty and dingy. The Kids bunkbeds were ok, but there was no way we would open up the sofa bed, that they call a queen bed! I imediatley called the front desk to be moved, they said that they couldnt since they were full that nite but could the next day, which they did and the room was much bigger but still very old and out dated and smelled very musty. This time we were moved to the ground floor

Summary Heading: Good value, close to Disney, good for young families
Summary: Very well priced hotel, easy walk to Disneyland and California Adventure. Travelled with our two young sons, who enjoyed having a separate bedroom with bunk beds. Rooms could do with a restyle as a bit eighties (so much wallpaper - even in the bathroom!) but they had comfortable beds, adequate space, and everything we needed. Breakfast very ordinary - cereals and waffles - but enough to get you started in the morning. It's not the Ritz, or the Grand Californian, but how could it be at such incredibly low rates? We found the staff pleasant to dea;l with at all times, also appreciated onsite laundry, free newspapers, and help-yourself fruit bowls in the lobby.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, great location, great value.
Summary: This is the second time in a year that I have stayed at this location.  It is across the street from Disney.  It is a great value and it even includes a hot breakfast.  The rooms are clean and quiet and the beds are comfortable.  Hats off to Raffles.

Summary Heading: A distinctly crummy and rundown motel at the Disney Resort
Summary: We booked the RAFFLES motel due to its proximity to the Anaheim Convention Center to attend a recent tradeshow, and we were really disappointed with the quality of these accommodations.  Nearly every aspect of the motel is needing attention - starting with the surly desk staff who seem like smiling and making you feel welcome is simply not part of their job description.    Our stay started out bad, being charged a previously undisclosed "Resort and Parking fee" of $7 per night... give me a break.  For what?  So we could park our car?  That kinda set the tone for our whole stay.   Then there is the room itself, where you turn on the fluorescent light fixture when you walk in the room and it sounds like a sci fi movie drone sound effect.  You know that sound:

We stayed at the Best Western Raffles Suites for our disneyland vacation in the begining of the New Year. The rooms are small, old, not terribly clean and were poorly redone. We chose a two room suite. The bunk bed was fine, but was missing a fitted sheet on the lower bunk. There were also tools in the top bunk left after a repair? The sofa sleeper was un sleepable~ the matress was poor to begin with but was also completely worn out. We had to put the sofa cushons and sleeping bags on the bed to sleep my son. We were going to just sleep him on the sofa but it was to short. The queen bed in the main room was ok.  The room does have a small refrigerator and microwave, which is handy! Breakfast provided were sweet rolls and coffee.  My main complaint was that the room was on the

This hotel is located very close to Disneyland and is very clean.  The suite has a separate room, which is wonderful and the rooms are very spacious.  The staff was very friendly.  The breakfast is nothing to write home about, as others have said.  It was very nice to have internet and free parking.  That being said, this hotel is in need of some serious maintenance work.  When the heat was on it sounded like a truck idling.  The toilet had a loud screeching noise when flushed, the bathroom fan also sounded like a truck, the bedroom light had a very loud buzz, the doors squeaked ( a little W-D 40 would go a long way).  But, the beds were comfortable and the bathroom was very clean.  I would not pay more, but for the price, it was a good deal.  I would recommend the hotel if the

Summary Heading: Great Value very Spacious, Would definately stay again
Summary: We stayed in a kids suite (bedroom with king bed, seperate bedroom with bunk beds, and living room with sofa bed) for one week over the Christmas holidays.   I would agree with other posters that the sofa bed probably would not have been very comfortable.  Ours appeared quite worn out.  Other than the sofa, the bathrooms have been redone and the rooms were very clean.  We could walk around on the carpets and socks did not get dirty. The beds were very comfortable.  My teen girls shared the bunk beds and they were very sturdy.  No complaints of "she is shaking the bed!".  It was great having the extra room the kids suite provided.  I used the laundry facilities a few times with no complaints.  Parking was only tight Christmas day, but everyone did get a spot.  We left our keys at

Summary Heading: Can't do better for the price
Summary: Loved the fact that we had 2 "bedrooms" for a total of 2 queen beds and a pull out sofa sleeper.  Also loved the in room microwave and mini-fridge.   The breakfast bar is the standard pastires, make your own waffles, cereal, milk, juice, tea, etc. The parking lot is SMALL- not an issue if they aren't sold out, but if they are, get there early or else!!! Staff was Super friendly and helpful, couldn't have asked for more from them~ We had a great view from our room of the Disney fireworks everynight, kids loved it! On the down side, the beds were a liitle lumpy and there was a bit of noise (should have turned on the heater / cooler to drownd it out). Pool was not quite as "heated" as I had hoped it would be!!  The kids of course didn't see a problem with it.

Summary Heading: Its clean and convenient but rooms aren't quite whats in the pictures.
Summary: We stayed in a two room suite and expected a little extra room but got very "little" extra. The pictures of the two room suites on their site are misleading to say the least.  There is probably only one room that looks like the picture (bright colors and hardwood floors).  The room we were in and the rooms I saw are very dark and dreary and cramped.  But you get what you pay for and we got a pretty good deal.  The staff was helpful and nice but not as cheerful as other places we’ve stayed.  The suite had a king in one room with small fridge, microwave &  TV.  Second room had bunk beds, a small pullout queen, a coffee table, a TV and recliner. This second room had no windows, only the door in and a small  VERY loud wall fan to move air from one room to the next.  Being that it

My family and I have stayed at the Best Western Raffles Inn twice now, and we have been very impressed with the hotel both times.  The rooms are clean and comfortable. The staff is very helpful and polite.  My kids really enjoyed the complimentary breakfast in the morning. It is close enough to Disneyland that you can come back to the hotel for lunch or even just to give the kids a nap if needed.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a nice hotel to stay at while in Anaheim that won't break the bank.

Summary Heading: This is  nice place to stay close to Disneyland.
Summary: The value of this hotel is good.  The rooms were comfortable and clean.  There is a complimentary breakfast with cereal, waffles and hard boiled eggs as well as bread and pastries.  The city bus stop is right outside the hotel and it cost $1.50 for an all day pass.  The bus runs every 15 minutes.  Parking at the hotel is free, but there is an $8.00 resort fee which is better than the resort fees close to the park.  The hotel is one mile from DIsneyland.

Summary Heading: Comfort with Teens, Need I say More
Summary: The hotel was clean... teenagers got thier own room with bunk beds. I loved that. Air conditioner didn't work in kids room  tho.. if we stayed more than one day it would have been an issue. main bedroom A/C worked fine. All in All I would stay again!!! It is a bit of a walk to Downtown Disney... take a cab or a car.

A great place to stay.  Our room was clean, beds comfy.  Front desk agents were friendly and helpful.  The little store on site is nice for munchies and last minute souveniers.  Of course the pool had too much chlorine, but that is to be expected with 10 kids swimming at the same time.  Free breakfast was great - cereal, apples, donuts, make your own waffles, etc.  We got in late our first night but we were able to watch Disney fireworks from the balcony.  Car rental places within walking distance.  20 minutes to the beach.  It is too far to walk to Disney, but the Disney shuttle stop is right out front.  You do get some noise from people closing doors and going up and down the stairs.  And the occasional kids running by our door.  But it is Disneyland, after all.

With being a military family we have stayed at ALOT of hotels and this met everyone of our expectations. Disneyland is about a 15 min walk and on the firlst day it wasnt bad, the 2nd and 3rd day we walked over and cought the buzz bus to and from the park. For breakfast just like at any hotel for best picking go earily but that was no problem for us. We stayed in the family room with the bunkbeds and with our daughter I will never say in anything but a suite. It was really nice not having to go to bed everynight because it was her bed time. When we got here there were some rooms geting there carpets cleaned and we were even able to get to a room at 1130 am instead of the 3pm check in time. The only thing I would recomend is to bring your own pillow if your like me who can sleep

The property looks nothing like the pictures on the website. It certainly had a motel feel about it. Our "queen" beds were certainly smaller than any queen I've ever slept in. But my real issue is with breakfast. 1). They do not serve any water. I was shocked.  2). The hours are 6:30-9:30. Our second day we arrived at breakfast at 9:00 to find most of the food gone, and were told they don't put more out that close to closing.  3). Our third day we were there at 6:30 and it was closed. The front desk person told me the person in charge of opening breakfast was late to work. He didn't know when she would arrive and there was no other employee who could do it. He couldn't leave the front desk. It was extremely frustrating since we were trying to get to Disneyland early.

I booked a non-smoking room. When my family entered the room for the 1st time it stunk of heavy cigar and cigarette smoke. "No problem.." I thought, I'll just go to the office voice my concern and request another room.  Immediately upon hearing that the room contained a strong smell of smoke the night desk clerk's demonor changed for the worse as he  matter-of-factly informed me " it's a nonsmoking room." and then stared blankly at my family. I offered to accompany him to the room so he could witness the smell 1st hand. With an empty lobby...He refused, rolled his eyes back into his head, and rudely grabbed the electronic door key, re-formatted to another room and asked us to have all of our luggage "..out of the room within the next 5 minutes"  so he could get house cleaning

Good spot to sleep during three days of Disneyland.  Got the family suite and it worked perfectly for our group.  My wife,daughters, and I stayed in the 2-queen bed room and the two boyfriends stayed in the 2 bunkbed room.  Breakfast was ok, nothing special.  Beds were comfortable and hotel was very clean.  Pool and jacuzzi were average.  Only negatives were the pool was out of towels the two times we used it, parking very crowded and small spaces, sinks were clogged.  Good rates for six people to lay their heads down for a few hours each night between Disneyland trips.

Summary Heading: Nice and Clean and Price is Reasonable
Summary: We walked in and booked a room with a king bed and bunk bed suite for $89/night. There is a resort fee of $7.50.<<<that's for your parking fee. This place offers free breakfast and free high speed internet. Some places you have to pay extra for the connection.The rooms are clean including the bedsheets. The AC works really well, except in the kids room there isn't any AC at all. Plenty of clean towels and toiletries. It has a 27" TV with cable. Our room was on the 3rd floor in the very corner. We slept fine, maybe because we were tired but all in all, this hotel is good if you just want a place to sleep and not craving for anything fancy. In fact, there is even a laundry $2.00 a load.

Summary Heading: It is not The Grand Californian, however, It does not charge as much either
Summary: After all, the main reason you probably go to Anahiem is Disneyland.  One just needs a place to drop your head at night. It was clean, service was great. The breakfast was nice, do you really want a greasy Denny's breakfast before Space Mountain or Tower of Terror?  Anahiem shuttle takes you hotel to park on a routine basis for a small price. Our family of 6 goes each year to the park.  We have stayed in many other hotels  , Raffles is the best deal , honestly. If you want more, go to the Park hotels.

Stayed here during NAMM 2010, and was satisfied with what we got. Pretty typical SoCal motel design, but the rooms were in good shape, beds fine & bathroom well setup for two people (double sinks outside the toilet/tub room). It wasn't on my dime so I can't so much comment on the value, but it was close enough to the Anaheim Convention Centre that we'd probably use it again. There are certainly worse places to stay in this city!

Everything worked fine, and the room didn't smell funny.  The wireless Internet and complimentary breakfast were good.  I guess that I think that there should have been a little bit more of a wow factor.  Next time we visit Disneyland, I'm pretty sure that I can find a hotel that has a better ambience, is closer to the Disneyland parks, and is priced comparable to this Best Western.

I would not recommend staying at this hotel.  We arrived a day early checked in a room and the smell was awful.  The next day we changed rooms went to the room and found jumping bugs in the sink area.  The walk is way to long to get to the park.  If you do walk it takes like 20min to get there.  The staff is great but the hotel needs some updating.  If you like bugs and smells in your room great.  But I would stay some where else the next time I go on a trip with the family.

Summary Heading: A friendly and comfortable place to stay
Summary: We moved to the Best Western Raffles from one of the expensive hotels across the road as we were stranded in LA due to the volcano eruption in Iceland and had no idea how long we would be there.  They gave us an excellent room rate and free Internet access, free parking and free local calls and which was essential for us after paying nearly 20 dollars a day across the road on top of our room rate.  The rooms were comfortable, clean and we had the free continental breakfast each day which was adequate.  The waffle maker was good! The pool area is pleasant and also has a hot tub.  The staff at this hotel made our stay - a huge thank you to Jerry and Frank who were so helpful. We had our 11 year old daughter with us and walked to Disney. It took 20 mins.  We took the Disney parking

The Best Western Raffles was wonderful! We arrived fairly late on a Monday, checked out on Wednesday. They do not charge for parking and I was able to leave my car there until we left around midnight even though I had already checked out. The room was big, had a microwave and refrigerator, plenty of space for storage, and enough towels for kids. We never moved the car which was good because the parking was very tight. The bed was nice and there were plenty of pillows, which hardly ever happens. They had your basic breakfast foods; cereal, muffins, bagels, waffles, and juices. There is a small pool and hot tub. The hot tub was not very warm but I still used it. The pool was well heated and the kids loved it. They also had towels at the pool, which is always a nice option. I

Summary Heading: Very good hotel for the price with a great continental breakfast.....
Summary: First let me say that the review of the last 2 people were right on about what is in the continental breakfast and what the room looks like.  The breakfast was great with many options but after the 4th day you will want to eat at denny's or on mainstreet at the Carnation for mickey waffles!  We also had the kids suite....first room has 2 queen beds which were very comfortable along with a bathroom/closet area.  In our room there was a solid door that went into the kids room with bunkbeds and a pull out couch and also a bathrrom/closet area.  Bunkbeds were comfortable, kids didn't complain but the pull out couch had a miserable mattress if you could call it that.  Thank goodness we had 2 small kids sleeping on it so they didn't sink down. ok, let's get to the parking....free

Summary Heading: Close to DL & great value for price paid
Summary: So after reading lots of reviews  and speaking with a travel agent who was leaning more towards a hotel on disney property it was not in our budget.  We decided to stay here and was much nicer than I expected.  We got a ground floor room, It has 2 queen beds, and included a microwave & mini fridge.  The breakfast in the morning was an added bonus, During our 5 days it was all the same, The offered muffins, donuts, toast & boiled eggs as well as hot waffles, cereal, juices, milk, coffee & hot chocolate.  The rooms were clean, beds were a little hard for my comfort, but after full days at disney I was able to sleep, there is one computer with internet in the lobby as well as fruit & coffee all hours.  I believe they also offered internet in the rooms, but we did not bring the

Summary Heading: Alot more for what I expected
Summary: I really enjoyed the hotel. It was clean and quiet. We checked in Sat, left on Monday morning. Parking was okay we were able to find parking after returning from disneyland around 11:30p.m no problem. Breakfast was good could be a little better but over all my teenagers didn't complain. It's not walking distance so with small children can be hard. overall I would stay again.

We've stayed at three hotels along Harbor Blvd over several visits to Disney over the last 5 or 6 years travelling with our two young kids now 9 and 4 along with our 18 year old niece. We picked the Raffles this time because we wanted a little bit more space and a separate room for the kids and the room seemed spacious in the internet photos. Our last stay at a "suite" was the BW Park Place Inn directly across from the Disney entrance gate 2 years ago. Our disappointment with the Park Place was the "suite" was actually a sofa bed separated by a low wall - it was not actually a separate private enclosed area - so it really didn't meet our needs for a room with a closed off room so the kids could go to bed early. For this reason we chose the Raffles. Our disappointment here was

We needed a place to hang our hats while we attended meetings and had fun at the local attractions. The property was generously sized, clean, convenient to just about everything and even had an interesting pool. The staff, Ms. Ceja, Maria and Jerry (hope I got the names right) were extremely accomodating. Why stay anywhere else? You couldn't beat the price if you tried.  OH, and don't forget the free internet access in the lobby!

Summary Heading: Good value hotel reasonably close to Disneyland Main Gate
Summary: Like most hotels in Anaheim, the Raffles caters specifically to families visiting Disneyland. Check-in was easy and we were able to purchase Disneyland tickets and ART shuttle tickets right there. Nice touches such as fresh fruit and hot coffee in foyer, as well as a small gift shop with souveniers and basic grocery items across the driveway. A computer & printer was also available in the foyer. We booked via Hotwire and were pleased we weren't hit by the hidden 'resort fee' like the Holiday Inn charged.  Parking was free although would be tight when the hotel is full. Nice pool and spa. The ART shuttle stop ($4 all day) is right at the door and only a few stops going to DL. Conversely, you're at the end of the line coming home.  About a 15-20 minute walk otherwise. Plentiful if

Summary Heading: Fine. But next time I am staying closer to the park!
Summary: This was my second stay at the Best Western Inn.  My four children are all older so as compared to the last stay years ago, the hotel felt a little cramped.  All of the other reviews seem accurate as far a an adequate breakfast, service.  The hotel did have to valet park for us which worked fine.  Here is why I would choose a different hotel next time... the hotel is about a mile from the park.  Day 1, we walked and it seemed fine.  But by 11pm, the walk home was long and you know how much you walk in the park so it was too exhausting.  I noticed there were some "suite" hotels right across from the main gate and I thought this would be preferrable to be able to take breaks from the park and go back and forth.  We ended up driving to the Mickey garage since we had free AAA

Summary Heading: Great place to stay while at Disneyland!
Summary: This was our second stay at this facility, the first being about 4 years ago for one night.  This time my daughter and I stayed for two nights.  Check in was effecient, with our reservation met.  The room was comfortable, with adequate pillows.  The bathroom was fine, although the double sink vanity area was a bit cramped for the two of us at one time.  Small store on site, closes kind of early (9:30pm), with gifts and snacks and sundries.  Avoid the vending machines...way overpriced.  While other people had noted adequate parking, I'm not so sure about this--seemed to be far more rooms than parking available, but was not at problem for us.  The Anaheim Resort Shuttle is just in front of the facility, and is a great way to get to and from Disneyland!

Summary Heading: Do not choose to stay at this Inn find another they have Roaches.
Summary: The workers are very nice and the place looks clean but yes, who ever is reading this review pleaese believe me this place have roaches.  I told the manager and he was like really trying not to hear it.  Also he made a statement that they just spryed the Inn.   Other then the roaches the Inn is very nice.

The staff at this hotel are fantastic.  They always exceeded our expectations when we had a request. The rooms are great. You never hear the traffic from the main road. Breakfast was what you would expect. Public transport is right outside your door to Disney or the OC bus can get you anywhere you need to go.

Summary Heading: Great for kids and large families
Summary: Suites have 2 bathrooms, 2 queen beds, some have a sleeper sofa, and bunkbeds...the kids loved the bunkbeds, plus gave us more room.  Close to Disneyland, breakfast is plentiful and varied each day, only negative is that you have to go outside to access it.  Staff very friendly and helpful, ample parking, soda machines readily avaliable.  We usually stay here for our group of ten for our 2+ times a year we take the kids to DL.

Suitable for a quick overnight stay if you want to be near the convention centre or Disney without paying a high price.  Room was a reasonable size; however carpet was not the cleanness as my wife found out when she was bare foot.  You can walk to most attractions from this hotel.

Summary Heading: Best Value Accommodation, Clean, tidy, Fantastic
Summary: We found this hotel fantastic, the room was cleaned and tidied on a daily basis very well with a 9 and 11 year old boy imagine the mess but each day we came home it was beaut. The breakfast was adequate, toast, jam, pastries, apples, bananas, oranges, fruit juice, tea and coffee. There was a gym if needed, we did not have time, parking did not seem to be a problem i was there 12 days and never had a problem once. The pool was great always plenty of room for the kids to play during the day and evening. Bus stop out the front, pizza, chinese room service deliveries were great. Computer available in the foyer. Helpful staff when making enquiries about shopping malls..... plenty of information.... great shopping, gift shop was very handy.......We had a great time and i think for the

Summary Heading: Clean rooms, friendly staff and close to Disneyland
Summary: Staff were all very friendly and nothing was too much for them to do. Continental breakfast had most thing people want and is included in the price of the room, great for a family with young kids. Rooms were large sized and clean, everything worked. Great value and close to Disneyland. Front desk clerk, Cruz was very helpful

I forgot my laptop and the staff was wonderful in helping return it too me. Very Honest and helpful housekeeping staff!  The rooms are clean and have many "extras"  It is located just a short distance from Disneyland, Angel Stadium, ice hockey, and etc.  Only problem is the parking lot is too small OR the Inn is too successful...It was always full and the lot too crowded.  (nice problem in this economy)

It was neither great nor bad.  The continental breakfast was pretty good and the room was clean.  It was somewhat outdated but again was not horrible.  Our room was on the first floor, right by the breakfast area and thus very load in the morning.  We had the two room with the second having the bunk beds and pullout.  The bathroom was very small but the shower had great pressure.  The sink (only one) was outside of the bathroom wiich is great and it had a granite countertop.  These two areas are in the kids part of the two rooms.  We wish it would have been closer to Disney but that is not their fault.  Just want you to know that it is too far to walk to and you must either drive or take the bus system they is used heavily by the disney hotel croud.  There are other hotels much

Summary Heading: For a budget hotel this was great
Summary: We stayed with 2 adults and 3 children ages 15,13 and 9. We paid under $90 AUD which included a basic continental breakfast each morning for all of us. Laundry facilities, small pool, free wifi and ice machine were great. Rooms were clean and comfortable. My only complaint would be the fold out sofa bed was very lumpy and uncomfortable but luckily our slightly built 13 year old found it ok to sleep it! Ten minute walk to Disneyland with lots of restaurants and mini marts surrounding it and after all the fried food you'll be eating the walk is welcome exercise. Had cable TV and a small fridge. Overall a geat price for a family on a budget. We are now paying the same amount just to park our RV at a park with none of those facilities so thought it was great value!

Summary Heading: Great Service, nice rooms, and walking distance to Disney.
Summary: This hotel had everything that we were looking for in an affordable option for our family trip to Disneyland. We stayed in a Kid's Suite Room (one queen separated by french doors, and bunk beds and sleeper sofa in the other room). We had 4 adults and 2 young children in the room for most of our trip and did not feel over-crowded (one of our children was in a playpen, so only one person had to sleep on the sofa - might have been a little more uncomfortable if two had to share it). The floor in the room was new laminate, so I didn't have to worry about older carpet or cleaners with my youngest who was crawling. The housekeeping staff was wonderful and everything was clean and restocked by the time we got back for a break in the early afternoon. The pool is a little small - might

I stayed at the Raffles for 6 nights with my family and I must say that it really wasn't that bad at all.. I must admit that all the negative reviews made me very uneasy but I found my stay very pleasant. First off  the staff is very friendly and helpful (Frank, Thank you).. secondly it is very close to everything, seriously folks its just a 10 minute walk to Disney I read all these reviews on how far the walk is but I found the walk very pleasant, I guess walking for us is no big deal cause were from NY and its just what New Yorkers do.. I think that they need to add just a few more items for breakfast but overall its enough to get your day started.  Everyday I found parking with no problem, the pool was a bit small but it served its purpose... and getting to downtown L.A. was

We stayed at the Raffles for 5 nights in early June for our Disneyland/California Adventure vacation.  Our party consisted of myself, my husband, and our two sons (ages 9 and 4).  We booked a Family Suite due to the fact that the second room had bunk beds, which would eliminate the need for the children to share a bed and fight over pillows and would also afford a little privacy to the parents.  Upon arrival, we found parking relatively quickly.  The front desk staff was friendly and directed us to our room.  Once we entered the room, there was a slight musty smell, but everything appeared to look okay and the carpets were not as bad as we had anticipated based upon the reviews we had read.    However, what you need to know about the Family Suites are that the walk into the room

This is probably the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. None of the appliances works, and some additionally are missing major parts. The room smells disgusting, and cleanliness is, for all intents and purposes, non-existent. When we asked for a room change, the hotel clerk, who clearly could not speak English probably (she explained that her primary language is Spanish), was incredibly obtuse until we threatened to call the credit card company to rescind the hotel charge.  In fact, given the incredible awfulness of this hotel, we will probably call up the credit company to do take punitive measures.  The worst part is, we couldn't sleep, because as this hotel was a magnet for tour groups, a great number of very ill-behaved and unruly children ended up stamping up and down the

This was a business and pleasure trip.  We had a family of 6 people stay in their family suite.  Two teens and two children.  The sheets had blood and rust stains on them.  So we had to obtain new bedding and make our own beds upon retiring the first night.  I have stayed at many Best Western properties and this was HORRIBLE.  The food was frozen and ran out.  Breakfast was fruit, cereal, pastries and biscuits with gravy if available.  The pastries were frozen.  The juice even ran out and good luck finding the only single person that was working it.  Next we had the front desk staff that was less than helpful for anything.  It was a real do it yourself place.    We purchased our reservation and paid in advance only to be charged again when we checked out.  Only problem was they

Summary Heading: I would stay here again, but a few things need to be considered
Summary: It was a great motel nice and clean and totally what we expected.  Like the other reviews the car parking was very tight and you needed to get in early to get a parking spot, although I am sure we still received quite a few door dents. The location was fantastic close to all amenties eg: Disneyland, Restaurants and even Target.  The breakfast was ok not fantastic and you needed to get in early to even get a seat.  A bit disappointed that there was not even a bottle opener for my wine in the building at all.  Even reception did not have a bottle opener which is an essential when on holidays.

We stayed at this hotel for 6 days in may 2009. We called ahead to see if there would e any schedueled maintaniece. I was told there would be none. We came from Oregon so a pool and spa were a major concern. The second day of our trip we recieved a note saying the pool be be closed for the following 2 days for maintatence. We left disney early that day too get in the spa to our surprise they had closed spa a day early. The day it opened neither were warm enough to swim in. So in a 6 day stay we only could swim 2 days. The rooms were very out dated and our door was broken we had to go to front desk to get in room 3 times before they fixed door. The walk to disney is about half hour. I would not stay here again.

Summary Heading: Should pay another $30/night at another closer hotel and feel like a holiday
Summary: The hotel is a bit too far to walk to disney with kid's, so you'll need to spend another $13-18/day for the transit, so might as well stay closer and apply this to the hotel room.  The hotel is getting dated.  The breakfast has no waffle maker, which kid's NEED, along with a limited selection.  The desk staff, while friendly, were not much help with basis questions of where things were or how to get there.  The cleaniness could have been one notch higher in the rooms as well.

My family and I stayed here for our first Disneyland vacaton. I highly recomend that you book another hotel. Among the few minor inconviences of an ice machine and elevator not working, the major problem was the horrible parking. Rather lack of parking available to guests. I called three weeks before check-in to get a downstairs room due to the fact that I suffered an injury and needed to be in a wheelchair a good bit. I got called at 5:30 in the morning to come move my car. We were blocked in and couldn't get out for 35 minutes on another occassion. Another guest from Canada had a disabled son and they put them on the third floor at the other end from the elevator. My children sat outside to eat breakfast because the smell of the breakfast room made them sick. It was the worst

This the 2nd time we've stayed at the Raffles Inn. Both times we needed a larger space to accomodate adults and children, but didn't want to pay a lot. The Raffles in has a few different multi room suites. We stayed in the Family suite : 2 queens, 1 sofa queen and bunk beds with 2 bathrooms. We've stayed in the queen suite which has 2 queens and a sofa queen. I prefer the 2nd one because although it has less beds and only 1 bathroom is it more spacious and updated. The family suite suffered from outdated everything and felt cramped. The air circulation was poor in the 2nd room and didn't have a window to open. The price was wonderful at just over $100 a night for a party of 7. The location is great if you use ART and the free breakfast was okay. Get there early as it's a mob

Hotel needs to be renovated. I have traveled to the Anaheim area  for many, many years and this area is really evolving and updating. Providing nicer, higher-end hotels and food establishments. It does have a great view to see the Disneyland fireworks, but I find (as mentioned in other reviews), it would be a long walk to Disneyland. Be wary, if you have kids. Now on to the room...I have a family of 4, we stayed in the "kids suite". The  layout consists of the usual hotel "adult" room with a queen, microwave, frig, & t.v. The rooms are seperated by a french door that didn't close, stained and uneven carpet. Yes, you will  trip on it. A very tight shower/tub/toilet combo...meaning you have to turn against the wall to close the door. But I will say the "kids" portion is cute with

Stayed at this hotel after a day in San Diego.  It is about 1.5 miles from the main gate of Disneyland.  The property is clean.  Parking is limited so try to get there early for check in.  The pool and spa appeared to be clean but I did not use them.  THe room was very spacious.  It had two queen beds and a sofa the turned into a sleeper.  The second queen bed was in a separate room that had its own locking door.  The separate room also had its own t.v.  The continental breakfast was enough to last most of the morning.  The breakfast included biscuits and gravy, toast, hard boiled eggs, several types of cereal, oatmeal, danishes, donuts, fruit, juice, milk, and coffee.  The staff was very pleasant at check-in and check-out.  Overall this was a very well kept hotel and I would

We went Dec. 19-21,2008.   The parking was terrible, spaces too small.  We got  the kids suite (one king bed, other room with bunks & sofa bed) with one bathroom for 4 people.  The carpet looked like it had been 100's of years old, stained, loose with ripples,  the chairs in the room had stains on them,  the heater was in our room, there was a fan to blow heat to next room with no knob to turn on, so we had to buy a small heater to keep kids warm in next room, we were cooking in our room.  The room next to us, people were up til 3:00 am making all kinds of noise.   We found cockroaches in the room, which I told the front desk clerk and I also left a few on the counter so the maids would see them.   I would never stay there again.  The price seemed good and for a Best Western I

Summary Heading: Great location for Disneyland, nice hotel for good price
Summary: Stayed here 2 nights with family for trip to Disneyland.  Property was very neat, clean, newly renovated rooms from what I could tell.  Granite double sink, fridge, large enough space in standard room.  Pool there but did swim.  Decent (not great) breakfast included but will save you some money for the loads of cash you'll spend at Disney.  Booked room here for less than $75 which is a great deal as far as I am concerned.  They sell shuttle tickets at the front desk for around $3 adults and $1 kids.  Walk up the street a block to the next shuttle stop as the bus picks up there more frquently than the shuttle stop in front of the hotel.  We stayed too late at Disney (shuttle stops about 30 minutes after close) so we had to walk home but its only about a mile and there is a wide

Our family of 4 stayed at Raffles Inn recently during our trip to Anaheim/Disneyland.  The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. When we checked in we were able to upgrade to the kids suite room. Both rooms were very clean and great water pressure in the shower.  We used the pool and spa everyday which were also clean. The pool was heated and was at the perfect temperature. The continental breakfast was good, but by the fourth morning we were a little tired of the same thing, but can't complain considering it was free breakfast!  (Would have loved a little more variety, and the donuts/pastries were very cold!) The poor girl working in the breakfast room did a good job trying to keep everything filled up by herself but they almost need 2 people to be in there during the

My family and I stayed at this hotel for 4 days in Sept. We have been to Disneyland several times but this was our first and last stay at the Raffles Inn.  First off, the beds are hard as a rock! Better to sleep on the floor. It is certainly not just two blocks from Disneyland, more like 8-9 blocks. Cannot walk back to hotel at end of day with tired kids as planned. Re-surfacing pool during our stay, daughter was dissappointed, especialy since temperatures reached 100 degrees during our stay. Continental breakfast consisted of a bowl of hard boiled eggs and a tray of donuts. Sugary kids cereal only, some bananas and apples. Get there early or there won't be much left! Parking lot too small, no where to park at end of day, hotel had to shuffle cars around and park cars right

We booked a suite with a separate bedroom off the main living area for our party of 2 adults and 2 kids and it worked out perfectly.  It was nice that both adults and kids could have privacy if so desired.  The rooms were clean and every staff member we encountered greeted us with smiles.  The breakfast buffet was always well stocked...we didn't miss out on anything or have to choose from leftovers just because we straggled in near the ending time.   The hotel was a bit further than I had anticipated from Disneyland but we still walked it with no problems whatsoever.

This was a wonderful place to stay for our Disneyland/Newport Beach vacation!  My husband and I have nothing but good things to say about this place.  It was VERY clean, all in working order and the staff was wonderful.  What's not to like?!  It was beautifully landscaped too.  I timed our walk to Disney - 13 minutes!  We could see the fireworks from the hotel window.  The pool was very clean and the outdoor patio furniture was brand new and lovely!  The continental breakfast was GREAT!  Lots of fresh fruit, selection of pastries & dounuts, selection of bread for toast, hard boiled eggs,  juice, coffee, milk 1% & skim, selection of cereal and biscuits and gravy!!  That's FABULOUS for a continental breakfast!  I don't understand why some people bag on certain things??  What's not

We booked our stay at the Best Western Raffles thru Disneyland travel.  I LOVE staying at Best Westerns as they have always had this clean, awesome smell to them. . .well, I was disappointed on this one.  The room (suite) was somewhat musty smelling.  The rooms are of ok size (we had 5 adults). . .there is a seperate bedroom in the suite that my husband and I stayed in.  The dresser stands in front of the closet so you had to work your way around the dresser to hang clothes.  The breakfast. . .it was boring.  There were hard boiled eggs, bisc/gravy, donuts, toast, orange/apple juice and coffee/tea and some fruit.  It was the SAME everyday.  A little hard to swallow so we went out every other day.  It was also not diabetic friendly. . .everything was carbs making things difficult

Summary Heading: Nice staff, clean rooms..worth the money!
Summary: My son and I stayed at this hotel May 5th-11th. Like everyone, I read alot of reviews on  hotels before booking my vacation. Of course, reviews aren't based on our own perception or expectations so shouldn't always be what makes or breaks the decision. That being said, we had a great stay at this location. We arrived at the hotel at 9am with check-in not  until 3pm so I was hoping that the hotel would let us just leave our bags at the front desk so we could go to Downtown Disney. Bettter than that, since our room was ready they just let us check in - what a relief that was!!! Front desk staff was very friendly and helpful during the entire stay. Our rooms were just right for us - we had two queen beds, table and 2 chairs, small microwave/fridge combo and dual sink vanity. We

My husband and I stayed at the Raffles Inn for our honeymoon 05/2008 and it was by far the worst hotel experience either of us have ever experienced and we have stayed in many hotels throughout our lifetimes.  I don't believe our bathroom floor had ever been vaccumed mopped.  We felt like we had to have our shoes on at all times.  There was mold and mildew not only growing in the tub surround but traveling throughout every wall in the bathroom area.  When we first arrived at our room at 11:30 pm the door was wide open for anyone to come in and use our restroom or bed. There are no DO NOT DISTURB signs that you can put on the outside of the door and we were woken up every morning by them trying to open the door.  The breakfast was not even a morning snack.  There is hardly any

Was travelling with a family of 9, so had 2 rooms...the room that I was in,was a suite with a king bed, and then a separate room with 1 queen bed, and a sofa bed...the bathroom was good, considering that we had 3 gals in my room, the 2 sinks came in handy, and the shower being in a separate room was good...liked the great internet connection that was there....kids liked the pool and hot tub...  The down side:  The beds were extremely hard, we spent 3 nights there, and I was ready to scream...if you like hard beds, then this will be your delight, otherwise, you might be in trouble...on the forth day I spent the day at the beach, and fell asleep on the beach, and it tells you something about the beds, when I fall sleep on the beach in the sand, because of the beds...  The distance

Stayed here for (of course) weekend at Disney with friends.  First off, the building is somewhat dated but the front desk staff was very helpful and gave us a nice corner unit that had generous floorspace and the price was right.  The downside was that since this was a suite pretty much everyone staying at the inn has a family and is visiting Disney with some pretty psyched up kids.  The result was that it always sounded like a herd of elephants was moving in the room above us at all hours.  The moral of this story is that if you want to stay here and actually would like to sleep be sure you get a room on the 3rd floor as the insulation in this building is pretty much non-existent and people can hear every step you take as well as what you are watching on TV. The price includes

This hotel was decent considering the price I paid.  We stayed for 6 nights on a visit to Disneyland in January.  The room was small, but nicely decorated.  In the bathroom, you could either have the door open, or closed, but if it were open you couldn't use the toilet.  The water pressure was good in the bathroom, but the water was hard so you couldn't really wash.  The hotel overall was OK, but the parking lot flooded, and was small.  Breakfast was a joke.  Not many choices, food quality mediocre.  Now, to the worst part.  This hotel is WAY too far away from Disneyland to walk, so you have to rely on the ART.  The stop was right outside the hotel, but we waited a minimum of 30 minutes between buses.  To hurry and get up, get ready and eat breakfast and then wait at a bus stop

I was initially disappointed when I arrived at this hotel as it does not compare to it's website.   However, I did have an enjoyable stay here and the rooms offer everything you could need.  I was here for a conference but the hotel is close to Disneyland and the room I had was perfect for families.   The breakfast was basic but there was plenty choice from cereals, to toast and cakes. The only downfall was everything was served on polystyrene crockery so it wasn't enivronmentally friendly. I'd like to see the management review this policy.  I would recommend this hotel for those looking to visit Disneyland but do not want to pay over the odds to stay at the Hilton or Sheraton.

I booked this place because of the price and thinking it was closer to Disneyland than it turned out to be. The room was okay, but the carpet needs to be replaced. The breakfast is not very good. There was hardly anything, and to try and get the worker to refill the food was almost impossible. The other problem was the shuttle to the park.It says it comes every 20 min., but it's more like every 30-40 min. I'd recommend paying a little more and being closer to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Good value for the money, breakfast is lacking
Summary: I stay at a lot of Best Westerns since I'm a Gold Elite member of their Gold Crown Club so I know what to expect from a typical Best Western.  I thought this hotel was a very good value for the money.  I stayed there for one night because I was attending a conference at the Sheraton up the street and the Sheraton cost almost twice as much.  With tax I paid $111 for the Best Western.  The room was a king and was large with a large bathroom.   The bathroom, however, did not have a toilet paper holder.  There was just a roll sitting on the top of the toilet.  I also had a problem getting the sink stopper to come back up after I finished shaving.  The wireless Internet worked like a charm and there were plenty of channels on TV.  The room had a fridge and microwave. Unlike some

We booked through Disney.com and hotel was listed as "Good Neighbor" hotel.  Disney should reconsider this.  The room rate was over the top.  We stayed one extra day and got charged $172 for the one night.  The sofa bed was not usable for sleep.  The mattress was too thin and stained to even want to use.  One queen bed had a double box spring and a queen mattress (which keep slipping off the bed).  The towels in the room felt like you were using sand paper to dry with.  The Family Suite - kids couldn't even see the TV unless they sat on the sofa bed couch.  Carpets were dirty and you had to leave your shoes on or get nasty feet.  During the stay we killed no less than three cockroaches and two spiders in the room.  We got put in room 127 two doors down on ground floor from

Summary Heading: Left a lot to be desired.
Summary: We were disappointed with the two room suite we booked for our visit to Disneyland.  While the room was just "adequate" the decor was outdated and the carpets were very dirty.  Walking in socks was definately not possible unless they were the colour black.  The chair in the room was also covered with visible stains.    Upon arrival we had an ample supply of towels, however on both the second and third days the face cloths were not replenished.  We had to attend to the front desk for replacements.  The coffee supply and the cups were also not replaced during our stay although this was just a minor inconvenience.   The non replacement of face cloths was the most inconvenient as we had two toddlers with us.  The continental breakfast was adequete however two of the three toasters
