good for the price. here are the highlights of the kids suite- space - the room is very spacious. if you have little ones, then it's great for crawling. the bunkbeds give more floor space.  cleanliness - very clean parking- very limited. the parking space is surrounded by the rooms. there weren't anymore spaces so we left our key with the front desk and double parked. the only problem with this is that we were on the first floor, and right when you step out the front door is a parked car. it gets very noisy in the morning.  the room was better than i thought for a good price. we have 3 children so it was more than enough space. cons: airconditioning is the kids room, so it's colder than the other bedroom. the parking is bad. pros: decent pricing, microwave and fridge ... and

We stayed here on our trip to Disneyland and this was our first trip here for a extended stay. It was very nice spanish style deco. The room was nice and the continental breakfast was not to bad either. We paid a little extra for a ART pass to take us to the park daily and the trolley stops in front of the Inn. It was pretty quiet and we could see the fireworks from our balcony, which was nice. The parking lot and the pool are kind of small. Friendly staff was a plus. Overall it was not to bad for our first time.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for...
Summary: I travel a lot and stay at hotels from 3 to 5 stars.  I had no expectation of this being the Grand Californian (our favorite hotel for Disneyland), but I did expect a minimal level of  quality.  1) It says walking distance to the park.  It is not.  Unless you have very fit kids that can survive a day at the park and then feel like walking another 1/2 mile back to the hotel...this is not within walking distance.  You are then left with 2 choices, park at Disneyland or take the Anaheim Shuttle.  The shuttle comes once about every 30 mintutes (which in reality is more like 45 to 1 hour).  Imagine if you will, sitting at a bus stop for nearly an hour with 3 kids waiting to go to Disneyland, having the bus finally show up and having it be full!  So, assume this place is DRIVING

3 adults stayed at the Best Western Raffles Inn for a trip to Disneyland. We got the nights stay pretty cheap. The rooms were not bad and were somewhat clean. The Raffles Inn is not close enough for walking distance, but it was on a main line for the ART Transit.  The hottub was disgusting! You couldn't even see the bottom it was so foggy from groaders. We couldn't stand to go into the pool afraid of the same reason.  We wouldn't stay there again.

We booked this hotel for a week.  After one night we checked out and went looking for another place.  It was dirty, noisy and by the end of the evening everyone was double parked.  This place does not deserve the AAA three diamond rating.

I stayed at Raffles for  three nights during a convention and had no problems. The room was neat, everything was clean, and despite there being a lot of kids with families, it was quiet. I appreciated the refrigerator and the micro. Breakfast was ok, but the dining room was a little small for the hotel size and very noisy. A convenient walk from the convention center. I would stay there again.

We stayed at Raffles from May 14 through May 18, 2007 during our trip to Disneyland. We booked a kid's suite, through Get Away Today Vacations, for two adults, a 17-year-old, a 10-year-old, a 5-year-old and an infant.  We arrived around 6 p.m. on Monday and were upgraded to room 301, a deluxe kid's suite with two bathrooms and two queen beds, as well as the separate bunk-bed room. The room is in the back building, away from the main road, and is close to the pool.  The main room is nice, and it has a decent sized mini-fridge with a small freezer and a little produce drawer. The microwave is tiny, with a turn-knob that counts in 2-minute increments. I overcooked our oatmeal everyday, but maybe that's just me! One annoyance is that there is only a small table with two chairs, and

Unfortunately I did not read the review before I booked (2) rooms at this hotel (their pictures are Very Deceiving) this is an old Hotel that has had a face lift!  Our room had fleas, bugs in the Ice Bucket, and even though we had a ‘Do Not Disturb’ sign on the door the maid knock on our door at 8:00 am - my daughter’s Suite was dirty and the toilet didn’t flush properly.  When we told the front desk staff they just looked at each other and said, is that all that was wrong?*`!  Not so much as we're sorry about the conditions or any talk of compensation!    Additionally when we arrived late that night after going to Disneyland there was no place to park our car.   A hotel employee said, they were full and asked for our keys so he could double park our car and move it in case

Housekeeoing stole my favorite shoes, when I went to the front desk they simply stated they were not liable and sent me on my way.  I realize they cannot control their employees but even a coupon would have made me happy! It wasn't all that clean... not a great experience.

Summary Heading: need better staff at the front desk
Summary: This hotel had a great proximity to Disneyland. Our room was okay...older style decor...but clean and two bathrooms. Our eldest son was able to sleep in the second room and have his own bathroom. Both of them had two sinks outside the main bathroom. However what spoiled our visit was the guy at the front desk when we checked in...questions were answered very curtly and when we asked him what time Disneyland opened he pointed his finger at the Disneyland timetable on the counter and said " I dont know".... The next day we had a better guy....the continental breakfast room was very basic, we actually had to find the butter ourselves in the storeroom. all in all, no-one is there to stay in the room...reasonable rates for a large roomed hotel....good location to Disneyland....

Summary Heading: The creme de la creme de Best Westerns in Anaheim
Summary: I had planned to spend a week in Disneyland in November, and I decided to book a hotel to stay in instead of the 1.5 hour drive from my house each day. I would usually have stayed somewhere with a bit more class, but my friend gave me a giftcard to Best Western for $500 so I decided, "Why not use it?"  I am used to higher standards. The room was a good size for myself, but nothing exceptional. The beds were comfortable but the sheets were rather scratchy. The shower heads didnt look that clean, and the water pressure was rather iffy. I did like the Best Western lotion and shampoo. I was hoping to take a morning swim one day, but I was dismayed to find the tiniest hotel pool I have ever seen. At least there was a nice continental breakfast in the morning, nicer than Ive seen at

Summary Heading: If you like bugs this is the place for you....
Summary: This was the entire families first trip to Disneyland.  We booked this hotel b/c of the price & location off of the Disneyland.com website.  We got the kids suite which was cool since it had bunk beds & an additional tv set but there were gnats in the bathroom sink area.  We would kill one & 5 more would appear.  We called room service for additional pillows never received them.  We also called the front desk to get the time the park opened...no one knew the answer!  Getting off of the elevators there were HUGE waterbugs to great you....just disgusting!  Stay some place else!!!!

My family of 5 stayed in a kids suite for 8 nights in mid November.  It was exactly as we expected.  This is not a luxury hotel, but it was nice for the price.  The pool and whirlpool were small but nicely heated and looked after.  The place was quite clean although the carpets are stained.  We never heard anything from another room although the walkways could get quite noisy early with excited children (a problem I am sure in every disney area hotel).  The front desk staff was extremely friendly and helpful.  The breakfast was very simple and there were long lineups for the toasters on the weekend.  The meal consisted of toast, waffles, a pastery item, oatmeal, cereal and sometimes hard boiled eggs.  It was plain but did the trick and was in a nice room (which was small when

I reserved this hotel for a 4 day trip to Anaheim.   I work for Disney in Florida but could not get a great rate at one of Disney's resorts so I opted for Best Western-my hotel chain of choice in Europe.  I think I was in Room 307!  Positives:  1) most comfortable bed I've slept on in years 2) not too far from Disneyland 3) room clean, no problems with carpet that others had..good selection of tv stations, coffee and tea supplied daily, towels, etc. nice refrigerator...quiet most of the time outside room 4) hotel totally non-smoking 5) booked a package through Best Western web site that included rent a car for 4 days from LAX for about $25 more than hotel room only at best rate price 6) plenty of ice  7) a/c works very well  Negatives: 1) smokers stand outside rooms, next to

stayed at the raffles from the 19th through the 23rd of July. Had a standard room and a kids suite. The kids suite was nice but it was so hot...got a fan from the office but never cooled off. They need a small a/c unit in the suite.  Air conditioning was set to turn off just as it got cool in the room. I hate that. Breakfast was ok, they have hard boiled eggs, but only 3 days of the week. Tues. Thurs and Sat i think. the rest are just toast, 1 cereal and frozen waffles. It works but i have had much better at BW before. Staff was really nice though.  ART worked well and we had a good time.

Summary Heading: STAY AWAY!! Doesn't even have enough room for parking!
Summary: WE decided to stay here to use our 2 day park hopper passes at Disneyland in early July. BIG MISTAKE! First of all, we get there, and they gave us (my fiance, his sister, my brother) an already occupied room! So then we had to get another room, and when we opened the door, a nasty musty smell overpowered us.  The carpet was stained, dirty, very nasty and we made sure to wear socks in the room.  There were pubic hairs in the shower, which completely disgusted me.  That day we went to the park and we came back to the hotel about 10 at night.  Well, all the parking spots were taken.  So my fiance had to go to the front desk man (who had been very rude early on which switching rooms...it was his fault to give us an occupied room) and ask where to park, which he replied to give him

I booked this hotel through the Disney travel company for my family of 6 (4 kids ages 4,7, 12 & 14) & me & my husband.  On the website, it showed a kids suite very clean, bright & quite roomy.  When we arrived we were very disappointed to find a very tiny room, hardly big enough for six people, my two sons are adult sized so it really made this room seem cramped.  The carpet was horrible.  Big stains, not to mention ugly & there were places where it was bubbled up & I tripped on it quite frequently.  There is only one airconditioner & it is in the parents portion of the room.  The kids room was very hot.  There was  a window in the kids room but the screen was off & I did not want to open it for fear that my 4 year old might crawl out of it (we were on the third floor, so quite

Disneyland just a few blocks away and the shuttle picks you right in front for $3 a person a day and drops you off right in front of Disneylands maingate.This hotel rooms are very clean, the bathroom a little on the small side but all in all the room is great for the value. The continental breakfast was just that....fruit, juice, coffee, pastries, boiled eggs, toast, hot and cold cereals....for those who need more there is a Denny's restaurant (walking distance). Parking lot is small but they do have vallet parking which works out great.....Great hotel and would stay again!!!

We just returned from a 8 night stay at this hotel in a kid suite and loved every minuite! The kid suite was perfect for us in fact I loved the seperate kid suite! it was so cute! When you entered your hotel room you enter into (ours was a 2 Q) room with a table, desk, tv amour, fridge & mirco, two vanity seperate shower bathroom closet area. When you enter through the door is the kids suite which has a large double or queen sleeper couch, bunk beds which have three drawers under them as well as a tv dresser with three more drawers. They also then have there own two vanity sink area with a closet as well as a seperate bath, shower tolet area! It was so perfect! You also had a extra storage area under the skirted sinks to store your luggage if you unpacked. The carpets where

Summary Heading: Stay away for your own good!
Summary: Our family of 4 stayed 3 nights in this hotel. We booked a kids suite and it was nothing special. It isn't any bigger than a standard hotel room, they just added some inner walls and a door and called it a suite. The air conditioner was in the adult portion, so we froze all night so the kids could have some cool air. The carpet was filthy! I am not squeamish, but I had to wear sox to walk around the motel room, and they were black by bed time! There was also a moldy smell in the room, the bed was tiny and the mattress was dilapidated. I could go on and on about this terrible motel. Take my advice and avoid this place at all costs. To top everything off, my wife left her notebook in the room and we arranged to have the motel Fed Ex it to our house. They promised to do this on

We went to this hotel with only moderate expectations, because of the low price we got on the net, so we could not have been more delighted to find the hotel well appointed, very clean and with an excellent staff. It is also just a brisk fifteen minute walk from Disneyland and the complementary morning breakfast served from 6.30 was functional enough to start the day on (toast, waffles, apples, oranges, danish pasties, fruit juice, coffee, etc.). The parking at the car park was scarce, but we always found a space and overall our 8 day stay was very pleasing. My only reservation would be, that in the family suite where we stayed, there is only one air con unit in the main room, so in the heat of summer, this may cause a problem in the kids section of the suite. There is an

We stayed April 12 -16.  We're a family of five, 2 adults and children ages 14, 10, and 10.  Here's our complaints:  The room was clean, however the carpet was very soiled (I notice the next morning my slipper socks were BLACK)  Hotel in need of some repairs, remodeling, ect.  By the way, they decided to start on some of those repairs, remodeling during our stay.  New bedding, this leads to my next issue.  The new bedding took up several parking spaces.  PARKING is a real big issue if you choose to stay, you'll need to walk.  Not a problem Disney isn't too far away.  However we went to Universal Studios and San Diego.  Our rental was blocked by other guest.  This lead to delays in our departure to other attractions.  The inn advertised a upgraded breakfast.  Boil eggs were

Just returned from our Spring Break vacation--this was our third trip to Disneyland, the second with the children, and our first to the Raffles.  Traveled with my husband, 13 year-old son, and 10 year-old daughter.  Had a standard room and it was plenty big enough--loved the double vanity sinks.  Breakfast was adequate, didn't really need eggs and bacon before going on Tower of Terror, but Denny's is right next door if you need more.  Was within walking distance, but took the shuttle most days--esp in the afternoons--never waited more than 10 minutes for one, even at the park.  Maids were to our room by the time we returned in the afternoon--one morning had to go back to get sweat shirts and the room was already done by 9:30.  Asked for extra pillows and face cloths and they

I went to the Best Western Raffles with my son last year. The pricing was moderate, but there's a lot wrong with it.  1. About a mile and a half from Disneyland (we had to pay for a shuttle)  2. Walkways were disgusting  3. Maid service skipped our room   4. Beds extremly uncomfertable  5. TV gets about 20 channels  6. Bathroom is tiny

sometimes going to the chain of hotel that you've heard of  isn't the best option, glad we were only there for the weekend. the room was pretty awful, there was a window that had a picturesque view of the stairs, no natural light got into the room at all.  it was very noisy from the service area.  the room itself needed a facelift and the lamps weren't all working which made it even more dull.  whereas the reception staff were lovely (no other rooms were available ) i would not consider staying at this hotel again on my next visit.

Summary Heading: A great vaule for this hotel.
Summary: We loved our stay here.  It was our first time to see Disneyland as a family.  We have three children ages 8,6, & 2 and there was plenty of room for us to all have our own space in our hotel room.  I have told friends to stay here when they tell me they are going to Disneyland, and will continue to do so.  We will stay at this hotel again, the next time we go to Disneyland.

SCARY AIR: I was disappointed that the entire unit was air conditioned by a tiny under-window unit in the main room which did not keep up with the humidity even in the very comfortable weather of early January.  The second room had no window, and was "vented" by a tiny exhaust fan in the wall between the two rooms which had to be run constantly. I'm afraid if there was any heat or cold the second room would have been very uncomfortable.  REASONABLY GOOD VALUE: For approximately $89 per night, we got a "suite" which could sleep 8 in relative comfort.  2 Queen beds in the main room, bunk beds and a fold-out sofa in the second room, and each room had a full bathroom.  The room was quiet except for the family upstairs thumping around until 2am.    ADEQUATE BREAKFAST: The hotel

Summary Heading: Definitely worth the money for family of 4
Summary: My family of 4 (2 kids 11 and 13) stayed here for 2 nights in early jan. We went to disneyland main street the first night for dinner at Rainforest and it allowed us to time the walk for ourselves (it really is 20 mins). We also got to see the fireworks as we were leaving dinner which was AMAZING. We were glad we caught them because the next day we went to disneyland (1 day only) and decided to ride rides while the fireworks were going. Kids suite was awesome for us to have a separate room from the kids (sliding door between). Their room had the bathroom but it wasn't a problem for us at all. The kids loved the bunk beds and said linens and bed were very comfortable. We went into the pool the first night which was nice and warm (open until 11pm) What a deal for 100 dollars! I

Summary Heading: We had a great time at this hotel!
Summary: WE just got back from spending the Christmas/New Years Holiday and had one of our best trips ever to Disneyland.   This was our third trip this year and our first time staying at BW Raffles.   Our check in went as expected and we were given a third floor room as requested.   We stayed in the two bedroom/two bath suite.  The room was clean and furnishings were in good condition.  The remote was out of batteries but those were replaced within the hour of our calling the front desk.  The room for the children had twin size bunkbeds, television and sofa bed.  Our daughter loved the sofa bed and it seemed to have a better mattress than most we've seen.  There are plenty of drawers for storage, a closet, two sinks on a large vanity and a bathtub/shower combination and toilet in a

We had great front desk service (adjacent kid suites with our friends, early check-in, stored bags after check-out), and the ART stop was right out front, but from there things were sketchy.  I didn't realize there are no interior rooms - all face the parking lot, making for noisy times. The breakfast, which we rely on for a good start to a Disney-filled day, was awful.  No protein foods (except for milk), white bread only, sugary danishes & poundcake (??), one kind of cereal (Cheerios), thin oatmeal, apple & orange juice. Our room had maintenance issues - tub stopper did not work (we put plastic film from the cups over the drain so the kids could have baths), ironing board was missing feet, making it dangerously precarious when in use, huge rip in sofa cushion, two light bulbs

We made reservations well in advance to spend the weekend at the Best Western Inn Suites. When we arrived they did not have the room we requested. The suite was roomly but hard to sleep when your 50 feet from a freeway exit. Tried to check out an hour after check in and still was forced to pay for both days. Desk manager said I would have to call expedia for a refund. When I called they called the front desk and I was told no refunds were given even though the room was not what we requested. The front desk was rude, aloof, and quite frankly didn't care if we were happy or not. I spent one night there, paid for two, and moved to the Marriott and had a great second night. Also the breafast was gone by 9:30 in the morning. My wife and I travel alot on weekends and have stayed in

I was very unhappy with my stay here.  We were situated on the 2nd floor and the elevators were on the opposite side so we had to walk across the parking lot to get to them and then walk back to where the room was, with kids and luggage we needed use of the elevator.  We were at the front of the property on Harbor Blvd.  It was very loud, our screen was off of our window and there was a large stain as you walked into the room.  I asked if we could possibly change rooms and they were not one bit apologetic and claimed they were sold out and could not change rooms for us.  The kid's suite was arranged that the bathroom was first, then the adults sleeping area with the kids room in back.  Leaving the kids with the only access to a window and phone.  The continental breakfast was

Summary Heading: check your reservation before you arrive
Summary: Best Western Raffles  I called my travel agent and planned my trip about  5 weeks earlier, after a long flight being air sick and tired I arrived at the hotel where I learned  that my room had been given away. I only had 2 days to spend in anaheim.  I arrived at the hotel at 11 am and I didn't get a room until 12 noon which took time away from my trip to disneyland. Finally I had a room and I was on the very top floor i struggled to get the luggage upstairs being very frustrated a nice worker helped me with my bags.  Needless to say I won't stay here again I will stay at vagabond inn.

The service is excellent here. the TV had more channels than i cared to watch, and I had a great night sleep here. Beds are comfortable, not too hard, plenty of bath towels were provided. There were enough outlets to plug in cell phones, cameras, ipods, etc. Overall an excellent stay. I would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Would stay here again But confirm res. before arrival!!!
Summary: We just returned back from our trip today & I must say I was pleasantly happy with our stay here. I was a bit reserved about staying here at first because I had read the reviews & some made it sound that this place was very dirty but because we wanted a seperate room from our children with actual beds in each room instead of a pull out sofa, and because other reviews said the place was clean & great, I decided to give it a try. I'm glad I did. The place is very nice. We stayed in a kids suite, which is very spacious & clean. It looks just like the virtual tour. The only thing I thought was stupid was that the ceiling above the head area on the upper bunk bed was a bit lower than the rest of the ceiling & my son kept bumping his head the first night & morning we arrived. He did

Date of Stay: August 13-15, 2005 Reservation originally booked: August 13-16, 2005  My wife and I booked a room for 3 nights at this hotel using hotels.  We knew we were in for problems when the hotel could not find our reservations. I showed them the confirmation e-mail and they were able to place us in an upgraded room only because there was a cancellation.  That was fine. We were later told that our reservations were located. This was also fine.  Then on the 15th, we were told that we had to check out, because our reservation was up. They checked and double checked, but only showed us staying until the 15th.  I quickly called hotels and was told that we did in fact have reservations until the 16th. The customer service dept. contacted the hotel and they immeditately found the
Excellent room set up for families. The children felt special havingtheir own area and we liked a little privacy. Easy walk to Disneyland and decent breakfast. We would stay there again.

Summary Heading: Worst Hotel I Ever Stayed At
Summary: We just returned from our trip to Disneyland and stayed at the Best Western - it was terrible!!  First, the lobby had a very stale odor to it (a moldy smell), then when we entered our room there was a very strong disinfectant smell covering more of a mold smell.  It was very overwhelming.The room was very dark and depressing, even with the lights on and the curtains open.  The carpeting was so dirty and stained I couldn't even let my toddler crawl or walk on it!  Do not recommend this hotel at all!!

When we checked into our room, one of the comforters smelled of VOMIT!!!! I called down to the front desk to complain, and they did send a maid up right away. However, the maid just handed us a new set of sheets and said goodnight. I had to ask HER to take the tainted bedspread out of the room, then turn around and change the sheets myself. They did not have another bedspread available, which turned out ok because it was so hot, but still...they should have been more prepared. Also, the pull out bed in the other suite we reserved was of poor quality..it sank in the middle and was terribly uncomfortable. THe kids' suite we reserved looked nothing like the picture at all. It was very cramped and not stocked at all. I will never stay there again!!!!

we stayed here in april 20th for 6 days we stayed in a kids suite we liked it we wished we would had a room set up better our room setup was the fridge and the telephone was in the kids room and we did not have a table or anything to st up our laptop , the staff was great and they where very friendly the parking was hard some nights but they valet park your car for you all and all it was a nice place to stay so we had our own room and the kids had there own space  i would stay here again .

We stayed in a suite over spring break, and found the room to meet all of our needs for space and cleanliness.  The separate bedroom with a T.V. , sink and mirror, gave my parents a place to escape and have some peace and quiet. The extra room was quite large and equipped with a table, sink, fridge and microwave..   We walked to Disneyland for 3 days even though it was an extra 40 minutes  of walking day (20 minutes each way)  its a great way to unwind and talk about the day . It helped to burn off some of those Disney sweets.. You can take the shuttle or city bus...  Breakfast was okay at best, but did provide fruit,coffee and the occassional donut..  We definitely recommend this hotel if you need to sleep 6,  it is a little removed from the entrance, but close enough to still

Summary Heading: Best Western Raffles Inn, good location
Summary: We stayed at the Best Western Raffles Inn.  The room was ok... we had a kid's suite which had a parents room.  My daughter immediately claimed it as hers and that turned out just fine with us having access to the fridge and the washroom without disturbing her.  The rooms were clean and spacious.  The front desk attendants were helpful and polite.  The parking was bad, small parking spots and often no parking left later at night.  The front staff did a good job of valet parking (double parking) after hours to accomodate the cars.  The free breakfast was welcomed after learning how expensive it is to order breakfast in this area!!  It was often just cereal, toast and alternating danishes, waffles and hard boiled eggs.  They had oranges and apples everyday as well as apple and

We stayed for a week at the Raffles Inn back in Nov and we had a great stay. We were using Aeroplan points to pay for the room so we can't comment on the rates (I was worried because I figured they would give us the worst room in the hotel) and we had to stay at a Best Western. We used Trip Advisor a lot and I am glad we did. We read the reviews and found some of the reviews of the Best Westerns around Disneyland alarming. The Raffles Inn had some good review so we decided to stay there. Again I am glad we did, we had a great stay.  I can only say that some people are way too picky and love to complain about nothing. The Raffles Inn was very nice and the rooms were great. We had a regular room (2 double beds) and it was very clean, spacious and we loved the set up.  The staff

We just got back from our trip to DL and we had a blast.  Our famliy of 11 stayed at this property.  We had three rooms and the room cofiguration was great.  We had the Kid Suites and the room had a queen size bed with a seperate room with twin size bunk beds.  The seperate room also had a sofa sleeper, TV coffee maker, iron and board and refrigerator.  The room was clean with the exception of the carpet.  There were large stains, and it could have used a shampoo.  The housekeeping staff was very friendly and efficent.  We enjoyed the continental breakfast.  It was very limited in selection, but they kept things well stocked.  We were able to catch the shuttle to DL right outside the hotel.  The only draw back was the fact that you have to buy your pass through a "vending

Not a bad location but pretty basic hotel. Beds were very poor and breakfast was very basic. Front staff friendly enough but no one in house keeping could speak English. They ran out of tissues & towels and you had to repeat your requests each day.

Summary Heading: Not luxury, but great room set-ups
Summary: This was the perfect place for our families to get together for a reunion and trip to Disneyland.  The hotel was clean, functional and safe, not quiet and not fancy.  The breakfast buffet was very very basic, but it'll put some food in you before you hit the park (juice, toast, cereal, coffee, oatmeal, danish).  The room configurations were great for families.  Our room had two queen-sized beds and a bathroom in one side, then through the french doors we had a bunk bed, fold-out couch and another bathroom.  We paid about $120/night (average).  It's not walking distance to Disneyland, and the local shuttle system, while cheap ($3/day adults, free for kids) is not 100% reliable.  We wanted to hit the park when it opened, but the first shuttle was over 30 minutes late.  The

Stayed here by myself for 5 nights in November while attending a conference at the Anaheim convention center.  I found the reception clerks to be friendly and helpful, room large and in excellent condition, and room amenities better than average.  Hotel "added touches" such as heated pool, daily paper, double sink, ironing board in room, breakfast, and enormous TV give the impression that this place gives a good deal for its nominal rating. The hotel was a convenient walk to wherever I needed to go, quiet (at least on the far side from the street where I stayed), and well worth the rate I paid ($62 + tax per night).

As others have said, this is a two star Best Western. As such, it fit our family just fine.  The kids loved their own room, there was a newspaper at the door every morning, and I thought the temp on the hot tub was perfect.  We stayed 4 nights in mid-November, the stay was quiet, the room comfy, and the staff efficient.  It is way to far to walk to Disneyland, but the bus stops out front.  Breakfast is worth what you pay for it, and there is a Denny's a block away if you want more.  We would go back again!

We stayed at the Raffles Best Western from Oct 23-31/04.  When we arrived they accomdated us by upgrading to a family suite.  Travelling with my mom and two kids made that upgrade a very welcome indeed!!  The first two nights we had no sleep because of upstairs neighbors but the third day they graciously moved us to the third floor.  We had a couple minor issues - a burnt out light and a piece of metal sticking out from under the bed but both issues were quickly resolved and the front counter people were very friendly and helpful.  As for the distance....it seems there blocks are about 3 canadian block (maybe it's the metric thing...HA) but the ART picks up just out front of the hotel and delivers up to the front entrance of Disneyland.  It cost $3.00/person with children under

Stayed at the Raffles Oct 11 - Oct 18th 2004.  We stayed in the "kids suite" for $89 US/night for the first 4 nights, and $106 US/night for the last 3 nights.  With the Canadian dollar getting stronger, the price was quite attractive.  Now, you have to keep in mind, this isn't a 4 star Hilton... it's a 2 star Best Western, and the overall value is good for the money you pay - you're really only there to sleep anyway.  The front room has a queen bed, fridge, microwave, dresser, TV, desk and chair, and the "kids" room has bunkbeds, sofabed(lousy mattress on that one!), table, dreser and TV.  In between the two rooms is the vanity and bathroom.  Overall, it was comfortable, clean and very convenient.  The website claims it's a block and a half from Disneyland... nope.  Try 7 or 8

I have stayed at this property four times.   The rooms are large and completely refurbished.  early checkins were requested each time after the long haul flight from Sydney and granted without fuss. The management are friendly and accomodating.

Summary Heading: Don't think your rate is guaranteed!!!!
Summary: What a horrible experience at this hotel. I had made reservations with Best Western's web site almost one year in advance for our 2 week family vacation to California. I reserved the kids suite for $89.00. I also called one month prior to arrival and confirmed the reservation--I was told everything was in order. When we arrived on the evening of August 2 we were told that our reservation was for a cheaper room--not the kids suite. The desk clerk called the customer service line where I was told that someone I had never heard of changed my reservation in December!! After almost an hour of discussing this with several people on the phone, it was finally admitted that the person was an employee of the Raffles Inn!! She had changed my reservation to avoid my getting that suite at

Summary Heading: Handicap rooms are a joke at this property
Summary: After making reservations and even getting a written confirmation of a handicap room I got there and they knew nothing about it.  They did have a <quote> handicap room still available so they graciously(ha ha) gave it to me.  First the idiots put handicap rooms on the second floor instead of using one of the many ground level rooms that you could park right in front of, second - the toilet had hand bars but absolutely NOTHING in the TUB- no grab bars and it was a slippery tub shower instead of a wheelin shower. no pull down seat and not even a bath mat,  no way at all to take a shower, third - the sink instead of lowering it for wheelchair access was higher than any sink or vanity I've ever seen in a normal room making even brushing your teeth an adventure.  Stay away from this

We stayed here over the 4th of July weekend for a convention.  This hotel is across the street from the convention center.  I booked the Family suite, 2 queen beds in the front room and bunkbeds and a sofabed in the 2nd room, with 2 bathrooms & a 27 inch tv in each room.  The room was equipped with a coffeemaker, refrigerator, microwave, hairdryer, iron & ironing board.  The air conditioner in the front room was very quiet and worked well.   I did not like the fan in the wall between the front room and the kids room it was suppose to circulate the air from the front room to the kids room it was very noisy.  Also the room was too small for the sofa, if the sofa was bumped away from the wall 1 inch you could not close the door.   The available channels on the tv were a

Traveling with 3 adults and 3 children, we needed a hotel that would be big enough and that wouldn't cost alot.  We found that here....nice hotel with very spacious rooms.  We stayed in a Kids Suite and the kids loved it. With only a five minute walk to Disneyland, you can leave your car at the hotel and walk to the park.  We had a great time and can't wait to go back.

Worked very well on our trip to Disneyland/Calif Adv. - I would recommend requesting a room off of the main road as it was a bit noisy.  We had a kids suite which our two kids loved (bunk beds).  Plenty of room although could use new carpeting.  Continental b'fast a bit sparse.

We again spend 6 nights at Raffles Inn Anaheim. A great location, even though they have raised the price a lot. Walking distance to Disney and wonderful 2 bedroom suites which are very clean and well maintained - even after 1.5 years they look the same than before! This demonstartes to me, that they are continous improving there facilities instead of running it down over the years as so many other hotels do.  I have read lots of complains about the parking situation: Its not that bad - typically you find a lot, only at the weekend its can be very full - this time it never was a problem. So don't bother of that. Breakfest: Not a sensation, but much better than at other locations. Danish, beagles, muffins, toast, cerials, coffee, tea, milk, juice - what else do you really need?

took 2 families 5/04.   This is a standard looking court type hotel from the outside, but has been completely remodeled where it counts inside. The standard room is a very nice basic. And the kids suite was great, sleeping up to 8 with a bunk bed and mini couch (with its own TV) in a separate room for the kids, and the main room with 2 queen beds.  The remodeling was well done. A good Denney's restaurant is 2 door's down and the Disneyland trolley picks up in front (I do not suggest walking) We went in the spring so do not know about the concerns expressed by others about the air conditioner, but in this suite it was located in the main room. Also found soundproofing between rooms was excellent.  A jacuzzi & pool open til 11:30 but located away from the rooms so no noise was a

I was very impressed by the accommodations! It was not my first choice ( I researched intensively, but in the end our travel agent booked us somewhere else so I scrambled and found Raffles)but I'm glad it was available for us. The place was clean, the staff friendly and efficient, front desk courteous and knowledgeable. We were upgraded (no extra charge) possibly someone else needed our room two queens, but with the size and age of my two kids, the room they upgraded us to was much better for all of us. We were next to the elevator and laundry room which after long days of walking it was great to have everything right there! The noise level was fine, we had NO complaints and I know we will stay there again!

Our family of 5 stayed at this motel while visiting Disneyland. We had a Family Suite which was extremely spacious and comfortable. The rooms were not new and high end, however, they were very clean, comfortable and as I mentioned very roomy.The Family Suite has two rooms, one contains two queen beds and the adjoining room conected by a single french door has 1 set of bunk beds and a hide-a-bed. Each room had their own large TV and bathroom. (Bathrooms were marble counters with two sinks in each!! Just awesome)The continental breakfast included with the rooms was perfect. It was set up each morning in a bright cheerful breakfast room. There was a selection of muffins, danishes, toast, english muffins and cereal and fruit. Coffee and juice were also provided.The outdoot pool was

Summary Heading: Bring your own breakfast and towels
Summary: We stayed at Raffles for 7 days during Thanksgiving week. The shuttle to Disneyland is easy to access and we had no problems with parking.  The pool was freezing and the maid service is stingy with towels. With 3 kids and 2 adults in a a suite, you would think they would remember to leave more than 3 towels each day. We constantly had to request more. The Breakfast (?) was little more than some stale muffins, terrible, generic cold cereal and bruised apples. The coffee is weak.  Bring your own fresh fruit, coffee and yogurt if you want more than just cold danish. The mgr. was friendly and helpful. The kids loved the bunk beds! Heating/cooling system is inconsistent. Rooms are nice and spacious.

We had a kids suite with three kids and two adults and give it a thumbs up. The kids loved having their own seperate room with bunks and t.v.  The fridge and micro came in handy for sure. We were there for one week and each afternoon we would come back for a break and the room would always be done up. The cont. breakfast had cereals, muffins, pastries, toast, juices etc.. If you are looking for a big pool, this one is quite small but we found it fine and never crowded. The ART bus stops right outside or you can walk to the resort in about 15 mins. All in all, we enjoyed our stay at the raffles very much.

I do not usually bother to do this, but in all fairness to the hotel feel I shoud. Before we arrived I read other review and was very nervous, even to the point of taking other hotel phone numbers with me.  Well, yes the Raffles is a motel, yes parking was hard on the Saturday night. The manager told my husband they could valet park for him, that they were taking cars to their property along the road. I do not have a problem with this as they would be liable.  The room was very clean, we had the large family suite, ok it was not too large but the two bathrooms was what sold me. We had two queen beds in the main room and then bunk beds and sofa sleeper. Lots of room for just three adults and a todller.  The breakfast was adequate, toast, muffins, danish, cereal, fruit.  We have

Stayed at the hotel 22nd thro 28th June 2003. While the hotel was clean and tidy must agree with other reveiwers that the parking is appalling and the breakfast is somewhat limited. The good point about the hotel is that you can easily use the ART and that was cheaper than driving into Disney, (2 adults $6 1 child Free) which meant once the car was parked we forgot about it for a few days. When we stayed there it seemed the American youth wanted to practise skateboarding skills on the ground floor so it made for an interesting stay. On the whole OK but you might want to consider being a little further away.

We stood in Raffles Inn for 10 days while attending a conference in April 2003. The suite was just fine, big, 2 bedrooms, clean and in a walking distance to Disney and the conference center. The only drawback was that the heating of the pool was not working(Not a big restriction, because it was too cold anyway) and that the breakfirst was a little poor, but still OK. For the quality a very good deal compared to the price. Would go there again!

We made a reservation for two rooms, one a single king, the other a kids suite, about two months before our arrival. Upon arriving, the single king was not available and a room with two queens was substituted. We drove over to Disneyland that evening and returned about 11 p.m. to find, not only, no parking spaces, but many cars double-parked. If a fire had started the fire department would have had a difficult, and probably impossible time getting fire trucks into the central area of the property. Upon asking the management about this, they said to just give them your keys and they would move your vehicle if it was blocking someone's exit. I don't think so... As was mentioned in another review, there is a problem with the air conditioner being in the kids area of the suite, and

We stayed at the Raffles Inn at the end of August, 2002. We have three children and got a family suite with a bunk bed and a sofabed in the kids' room. It was a great deal. The only problem was that the fan in the kids' room was a little noisy. We would definitely stay there again.
